Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: texasproud
Reviews.Content: My college-age daughter and I just finished a terrific stay here. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived to be upgraded to a room on the top floor with a view that was breathtaking. The location was great with plenty of stores, restaurants and nightspots close-by in the Back Bay area. Also good access to several T-stations and the Back Bay train station. The front desk staff was always friendly and very helpful, the room was nice and the business center was large, accessible and pleasant. We'd definitely recommend the hotel and will certainly stay here on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: etapley
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Boston Back Bay has got to be my favorite Boston hotel, maybe more because of memories than venue, but the hotel also provides excellent amenities and service. I've had two very good experiences there- one with a loved one and the other with a group of high school students I was accompanying to a Model U.N. conference at the Hynes Convention Center. For the first experience, they allowed me to check-in early and prepare the hotel room- as I was trying to surprise my girlfriend who was returning from a trip overseas. Their pristine and classy rooms and ultra-comfortable sleigh beds and high-thread-count sheets provided for the perfect evening and morning. For the second experience, I always felt the group was looked after and the proximity to the Convention Center was incredibly useful given the group's constant activity during the M.U.N. conference. (Note: the two times I have been to this hotel were in September, 2006 and January, 2011- but neither are an option on the drop-down menu)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamAnita
Reviews.Content: Good room, perfect location. Ac made too much noise though. Free wifi if you go downstairs and logg in at the starbucks. Friendly staff, especially the female concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Issues with room but great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Daizie45
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for two nights. I chose this location due to its proximity to the Hynes Convention Center were I was taking a very stressful licensing exam. I had many issues with my room including overly hot temperatures, dirty pillow cases, a mini-fridge whose temperature was set too high (all the contents became frozen causing a soda to explode all over my exam materials), AND a bathtub that was not properly set in its foundation. I honestly expected more from this hotel, and it added more stress to an already stressful two days of exams. However, despite all these issues, the front desk and engineering department were great. Mario in engineering should receive an award for his patience he had with me. Although I was offered another room for my last night, I decided against it because I needed to study. I think it's important to voice your concerns in order for the hotel staff to do their best possible to remedy their situation and for the hotel to improve/learn from their mistakes. The great customer service at this hotel is worth noting, and I hope that all the issues in room 1207 will be fixed for the next hotel customer. I hope the Quality Assurance takes note of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE 30TH!”
Reviews.Author: TNTORTIZ8809
Reviews.Content: My wife surprised me for my 30th with a trip to Boston. We had three rooms (family and friends surprised me as well) on the 24th floor, which boasts incredible views including the Charles River and Fenway. The hotel is located in a wonderful area, tons of bars and great food right on Boyalston. I HIGHLY recommend the Samuel Adams Brewery tour along with the free trolly to Doyle's after. The food at Doyle's is incredible. The pool area and workout rooms are top notch and the staff was amazing. They even sent a complimentary cheese plate and two Boston Lagers with a hand written note wishing me a happy 30th birthday....very nice and classy touch! The rooms were very nice (layout as expected, but very nice aesthetic touches here and there). Celebrated the big day at Gypsy Bar (very trendy, high class...and very expensive!!!) If you're looking for bars, try Storyville (nice lounge) as well as Beantown Pub. The hotel definitely stands out and it certainly made for a great backdrop to an unforgettable birthday. Two thumbs up for the Hilton Back Bay! We will be back when the weather starts warming up!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lal0s
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Boston at the Hilton Back Bay. It is centrally located and the service and staff were great. Close to amny attractions and public transportation. The only down side was how expensive the parking is... but it is Boston and parking in expensive all over. So if you really dont need a car, use the T or taxis and save on the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: melmic
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this 19th floor rooms beautiful view of sunset out towards Northeastern & Fenway area. Ventured out into the Back Bay Neighborhood with stops at Dillions for drinks, to the top of the Prudential to see the city lit up and then down into the Back Bay Social Club for some eats. Great little lounge back at the Hilton for nightcaps! King Bed was fantastic. We also walked to Tremont 647 for breakfast. Love this area of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gillianholt
Reviews.Content: My daughter let me out with the luggage and then disappeared into a maze of one way streets to get back to check in with me. Very unusual that there is not room for another car to pass. Check in very efficient,noted Hilton status,got free Wifi,water etc.41 dollars for parking does seem excessive,even for Downtown Boston. Comfy room even if the overriding color was "biscuit", "taupe", it just looked brown to me.Fridge didnt work ,bedside light didnt work,telly didnt work.Engineering fixed the televison. Bathroom o.k. no grab bars but I didnt request an accessable room,just thought of safety as opposed to accessability. Great to have Starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: StacyLynnn
Reviews.Content: Went to Fenway for a conference and was amazed at the hospitality that was shown towards me by , Omar, the front desk attendant. The person that I was traveling with had to be in a class that was to begin at 11 and mine didn't start until 2. I dropped her off and thought I'd try to store our belongings at the hotel. When I called to inquire, Omar told me that not only could I store my things, he was also able to check me in. Let me tell you, I was so pleased that I could settle in, take a shower, park my car and begin a 2 day real estate convention, relaxed but ready to go! I have always been a Marriott girl,seeing that I used to work for them many years ago.However, with this being the face of Hilton, I will be staying with them from here on out. Thank you, Omar! Oh and by the way, being a mom of an 18 month old, the double headed shower that I had was AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning View!”
Reviews.Author: davidandlynne
Reviews.Content: A corner room, the 20th floor, wrap-around windows, a corner office at last! The view at night was so stunning that I slept with the curtains open all night just so that I could wake up, lift my head from the pillow and view the lights of the city spread out below me. The room was immaculate, and well arranged with the desk in front of the huge windows. No tub but a large walk-in shower with dual heads. Walk to Prudential Center shopping, the Convention Center, Boston Public Library, Newbury Street shopping. Nice little Thai/Vietnamese restaurant, Pho Basil, a five minute walk. The only downers - no free wi-fi, expensive parking. (Hint: park across the street in a small, pay parking lot and save $12.)

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hilton”
Reviews.Author: shawchessplayer
Reviews.Content: I had asked for a high floor, but the best I could achieve was 9. From here I could here the noise of the trains, not sure if it was overground or the underground, but it was regular. It wasn't loud, not so bad as too disturb sleep but it was there. For some reason it seemed noisier in the bathroom. If you placed your hand on the window sill you could actually feel the vibration. My wife couldn't as it was very faint, so it wasn't a problem, just interesting. The beds were not as comfotable as most Hiltons we have stayed in. They were getting quite dated. There was a single dressing-gown in the wardrobe. How odd. The same happened here as it did in Montrea - See that review - when I asked to borrow two plates I was sent to ask in the restaurant. Not very impressed. We stayed here for the location. Most hotels in Boston seem very expensive compared with other US cities and towns, and the quality is lacking as well. In fact accommodation is so expensive, we had a week in Cape Cod and just 3 days in Boston. Not our original plan.

Reviews.Title: “Berkshire Concepts Does Have Great Proices”
Reviews.Author: boston m
Reviews.Content: I will have to agree w/climax they do seem to have the best prices for the hotel hilton back bay ,,I did alot of home work and they did come up with the best price...........lucky for me

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, but could be better!”
Reviews.Author: na n
Reviews.Content: Staff: This Hilton definitely has one of the nicest staff I have enountered. They will go out of their way to make you happy. This includes the restaurant staff. Restaurant: Amazing food. Yes, pricey breakfast buffet with not alot ot choose from, but worked for me. Clean: the hallways and elevator neede cleaning. The room was clean, but not great. I am extremely picky.. so take that for what it is worth. It was not horrible, and I would stay at this hotel again. Beds: Not the best. They are okay, but could use with the current Hilton upgrade other hotels are getting. Transportation: Call for a taxi first or your will have to walk to the Sheraton across a busy street to catch taxis. All said.. a very convenient hotel. Wonderful restaurant, starbucks service, staff... better then most of the other hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Kirk K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Back Bay Hilton and loved it! I was attending a dental conference and wanted to stay near the conference site and near the action of the city. This place was centrally located to everything......shops, dining, tours, ect. I had the best time too. The staff was extremely courteous, the room was totally modern and super clean. I used the gym and pool too. The parking was on site. Also, the best shops are right outside. I had to buy gifts and my favorite store Saks Fifth Ave was a minute walk. Then, I was off to eat at the best street, Newberry. I will def stay again. I hope this all helps and wish all who stay here the same pleasant and wonderful experience I enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, sound hotel”
Reviews.Author: B S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern and up-to-date. The staff were friendly and helpful, so the service was excellent. And the business center was very nice. However, the room did not have a microwave or refrigerator. And parking was $41 for over night parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: AtlDane
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Level member in Hilton program, so I always stay at Hilton when I can. This is a great property in a really great location. Very close to many restaurants and shopping and highly recommend. Not quite the level of the Intercontinental, but really great. Quiet bar, but great service and great food. The Club Sandwhich for lunch is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, excellent as always...”
Reviews.Author: ONGOLDENPOND2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times over the years and are happy to report that they continue to upgrade, redecorate and live up to the high standards we have come to expect. We are near a daughter who is a student at The Boston Conservatory here, and close to another who works in Boston. This hotel is staffed by professionals and meets all of our needs. The rooms are a good size, well-appointed, exceptionally clean and quiet. Their showers are amazing for the city! We got a high floor and had a beautiful view. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to be from here, which is a big plus in Boston (Back Bay and Fenway neighborhoods). We met our adult children for meals, grabbed some needed supplies at a pharmacy, and just enjoyed our stay. The Hynes Convention Center is a very short walk as is the Prudential Center (across one street, then indoors). I highly recommend this hotel; it is the best these neighborhoods in Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay at the Back Bay Hilton”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I was a frequent visitor of the Hilton Back Bay when I traveled to Boston for work frequently several years ago. Recently I had an opportunity to return to Boston and stay at a long time favorite hotel in Boston for three nights with my wife. Once again the stay was fantastic. The thing that always sets an hotel apart for me is the staff, at the end of the day lots of hotels in Boston are similar to the Hilton, but the staff takes very good care of you here. One example was when I was returning to the hotel at night and because of a party there were no parking spots. The doorman talked to the manager and found us a spot in the "permit" parking area, going out of their way to assist us. The rooms have been recently renovated and were very nice. They were a good size, very comfortable bed, sofa, desk area and HDTV. I liked the updates to the room with the exception that they have bolted the balcony doors closed so you can't go out anymore. One thing I do like about the rooms however is you can open the window for fresh air which is rare downtown and something I always appreciate. The hotel is a perfect size, not monolithic and crowded like some of the surrounding hotels so you never feel crowded. They have a great workout area and indoor pool and a starbucks in the lobby. The location of the hotel is perfect for getting around, just across from the Pru Center. Always look forward to returning to this long time favorite.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints here!!”
Reviews.Author: KimBux
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay on the night of January 21. I arrived at 11:00 and was able to check-in immediately. My room was on the 6th floor - the view was terrible - but I didn't stay here for the view. The bed was comfortable and I got a perfect night's sleep. I did not hear any noise from the elevators. The location is PERFECT. A little hint if it's raining: make a left out the front door and walk across the street to the Sheraton. The Sheraton is connected to the Prudential Center - the shopping is FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “immaculate hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: mpinkas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Back bay for 2 days. The room was immaculate. You could tell that houskeeping took pride in their work. Front desk staff and bartender were extremely friendly and helpful with tips about where to go for the day and where to get some great food. Location is within walking distance of everything in downtown Boston. Copley Square, the Prudential, and even the Commons if you dare take on the cold. Unless you are in a group, the Go Boston Shuttle provides very efficient service for a good price. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Stay on a Very Cold Weekend”
Reviews.Author: northsoutheastwest
Reviews.Content: This is a very nicely maintained property in a very good location. This Hilton represent an outstanding value. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. the beds are fantastic. The staff was helpful with questions and suggestions. The hotel is right across the street from the Sheraton, which is attached to the Prudential Center Mall , so we could cut through there to warm up after walking on the coldest days of the year so far. Back Bay is not far away from any location you want to travel to. There is really no reason to rent a car. Having rented a car on prior visits, I can tell you that it is more a hindrance than a help. You can take the T or grab a cab and go anywhere. Besides , Boston by foot is great in all kinds of weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: lali317
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston for my birthday weekend. We pre-booked and got a better rate, but we also upgraded ahead of time and got a superior room with a panoramic view for just 5 bucks extra! Totally worth it! Only downfall is paying for Internet...$14.95 a day per device. I'm so used to free Internet/wifi, that paying was so foreign to me. Other than that, very happy with the hotel and would consider staying again, despite the Internet charge.

Reviews.Title: “Steady as she goes”
Reviews.Author: SJB1209
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just before xmas, booked through discount site. Nice and clean room. Pretty good size - but we were in corner room which is a bit bigger. Did not use desk staff very much but they were polite and pleasant. Pool and gym looked good. Starbucks in lobby and free internet there too. Hotel is close to prudential shops, just nip across the road to Sheraton and enter shops from there.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations, great view, central location”
Reviews.Author: IT_road_warrior
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online after an extensive, value-based search. Found a great deal less than a week before my trip for a king room for just a bit of $100 a night. I am also a HHonors member so they automatically upgraded my pre-paid reservation to a room on the top floor with a pretty nice view. The bed was very comfortable, maybe a bit soft for some but very adequate for my liking. The room was modern and warm with an updated bathroom that was very functional. Room service was efficient and undetected. I actually never saw any service members, but the room was in top condition whenever I returned from breakfast with my girlfriend. My stay here was great! A block from the Prudential Center, the Christian Science Plaza and a convenient T-stop on the green line. Cabs were always stationed close by and the King's bowling alley\bar\lounge\pool hall is within a block as well. If you're looking for a walk, go about three blocks from the hotel to well-known Newbury Street. A ton of restaurants and shops are close by. The was the basis of a really nice trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome home”
Reviews.Author: AllSet2011
Reviews.Content: Once a while in your travels you find a hotel that feels like home and that's the case with the Hilton Back Bay. Have stayed in other Boston hotels nearby, i.e the Sheraton, just across the street and the Westin Copley - both absolutely fine - but after a previous stay in the Hilton, opted for the Hilton. Once again, it more than exceeded expectations. It's a smaller hotel than the others but that makes it more personal. Staff were wonderful - friendly but professional, both of the concierges were very helpful and the entire team are a credit to themselves and management. Stayed on the Hilton honors floor in a room with a fabulous river view; bed was sublime - and I'm uber-fussy about a comfortable bed! - leisure centre was terrific with immaculate changing area and the location is superb. Next to the Prudential Center, constant supply of taxis available or the T station in the Center across the street. Thank you for another wonderful stay and the Hilton Back Bay is definitely my #1 choice for any future Boston trips - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Everything Else”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that I prefer staying here rather than the Sheraton across the street or the Westin or Marriott at Copley. Not necessarily a significantly better property, but better value for your money. You can't beat the location in general. Although the other three hotels mentioned are all connected indoors to the Prudential Center and Copley Place, it is only a very quick stroll across the street to the Sheraton from the lobby of which you can access all of the above. Even on the coldest day, it's not a bad crossing. Convention Center T stop (which is actually on Mass Ave) is closer to this hotel than the others. Parking here is competitively priced, but offers self-parking which can save you a lot of time compared to the valet services of the other hotels. Just watch out as the lot is cramped and prone to scrapes - especially as you're exiting - if you're not careful. Not the hotel's fault - that of the architect. Staff are pleasant but no one stood out except for the host in the Gold/Diamond breakfast space who I think must have been living on Red Bull. Very friendly, helpful, pleasant, hospitable and accommodating, but a bit manic about it :). Front office staff were actually a little more on the ball than my last visits here. There is nothing exciting about the lobby in the least, except for the availability of Starbucks coffee. Rooms are smallish by American standards but well equipped and maintained. Rooms are spotless. Wifi, which was free for Gold/Diamond elites, was fast enough and did not drop a connection. Great views on the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: movedmainer
Reviews.Content: Was in town for Frozen Fenway... hotel very close to the Ballpark. The T is also very close. The room was great

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Cubsgirl1
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the rooms are a decent size for Boston. The staff was very friendly and helpful with recommending places in the area. My only word of cautiion - park somewhere else! $41 a night...ridiculous. There are a bunch of garages nearby at a cheaper rate - a much better option. There is a garage next door for $12 a night, but I think you might have to be out by 6am.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a New Yearâ€™s in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: I got the Hilton on Priceline name your price for $120/night ($140/night total with taxes), just as I was hoping for. Definitely a great deal for the quality and the location. It was basically what Iâ€™d expect from a Hilton. The beds were ridiculously comfortable, especially the pillowsâ€¦ heavenly. Room was standard, clean, well-kept, etc. Safe is big enough for a 15â€� laptop or two and a big purse. Our TV didnâ€™t work due to a problem with the remote. We also had some long, dark, gross hairs that were stuck in the toilet for like the first day. Couldnâ€™t tell you about the customer service on those things though, since we were barely there and didnâ€™t care enough to complain about them! Only other complaint is that the shower head was not that good, though it was sufficient. Youâ€™ll pay for wi-fi in your room, but the lobby/â€œbusiness centerâ€� wi-fi works very well, although there is an hour limit, which I thought was strange. For parking, look into other area garages if youâ€™re trying to save money, some are slightly cheaper than the Hilton. Or take the train in like I did. You donâ€™t need a car in Boston anyway. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: NJOY909
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were awesome. The room was splendid. The bar had good sliders and strong tasty cocktails. Everyone was very friendly and hospitable. Great shopping is a few blocks over on Newbury St. I like that the hotel is across from a indoor mall, lots of dining choices, site seeing bus pickup is right across the street ,as well as, a bowling alley.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: zorro514
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice rooms. Meeting rooms not designed for a large crowd. Only 3 slow elevators. Nice fitness room, small pool. Excellent wi-fi coverage.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: od418
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in September, it's location is ideal for accessing the main shopping area and Fenway park as well as having easy access to the subway. The hotel itself was clean and the staff pleasant. Checkin and checkout was pleasant and quick. The staff in the complimentary breakfast lounge for those on executive floor rooms were very helpful and went the extra mile to ensure a good start to the day. The leisure facilities were small but perfectly usable and never busy when we were there. Would be happy to stay here again but would pick my dates carefully to get the best value prices.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: TXMoving_soon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and found the staff good, the breakfast buffet for Gold and above members ok, and repetitive (eggs and oatmeal were the two warm choices everyday), with a reasonable selection of fresh fruit, bagels, breads, pastries, yogurt etc to compliment. Never ate in the hotel restaurant since there were so many other choices in the area. The room was clean, but the details in the bathroom could have been better (the shower head had a pretty heavy layer of buildup on it for example). Location was excellent for anyone using the Hynes Convention Center...just a quick walk across the street and through the Sheraton to get there.

Reviews.Title: “typical hilton quality and great location”
Reviews.Author: gigidev
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights and had room service each night.... good food, but of course, very $$. Great bed, upgraded ton HHonors floor... but I had to ask for this,,, not sure why. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great location, Great location”
Reviews.Author: jgallag
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 12 pm, but my room was understandably not ready. They held my bags and I took the T (the metro) to the Union Oyster House (1st restaurant in the U.S.). There were several T stops by the hotel. Right across the street was the Sheraton which was connected to the Prudential Center which housed the Hynes Convention Center. The Prudential Center also contained a nice food court, great shops, and the Cheesecake Factory. A T stop was also right next to / connected to the Prudential Center (by the Cheesecake Factory). This was not clear in earlier reviews. The T will take you anywhere! Back to the hotel: Don't miss the pool and hot tub and the fitness center. They are amazing!!! The lobby is small, but adequate. Five computers were adjacent to the library with free printing. If you are a gold or diamond -vip member, don't forget the complimentary breakfast room to the left of the dining room. The front desk staff were very helpful as well as the concierge. The concierge made reservations for me to the Union Oyster House. He was very very helpful! Our room, 1706 (the Hilton Honors Floor) overlooked the city. I could see Fenway ball park at a distance. It was very clean and was very well designed!! We had an empty refrigerator was helped out a lot. There was a Wendy's down the road as well as Dunkin Donuts. Any questions, email me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and accommodations in a small footprint”
Reviews.Author: foodbuffs
Reviews.Content: Staying in a downtown Boston hotel was an interesting first-time experience for us, seeing as we lived for 25 years less than a mile away from the Back Bay Hilton and still consider ourselves locals. This property is perfectly located in close proximity to many of Boston's cultural, dining, and shopping venues, and was for us a perfect home away from home. Commercial property available for new hotel construction has been virtually non-existent in Boston's congested downtown and Back Bay areas for decades. This would explain why the Hilton, a relatively recent arrival to the Boston hotel scene, is appreciably smaller than, for example, the much larger and older Sheraton directly across the street, which has the advantages and disadvantages of being integrated into the Hynes Convention Center and Prudential Center complexes. The Hilton, on the other hand, has a very small triangular footprint on a tiny lot and is only 26 stories tall; this gives it the unexpected and highly welcome ambience of a European-style boutique hotel rather than a big-city American commercial property. The feel of a boutique hotel was reinforced by the front desk staff, housekeeping staff, and other lobby service personnel, who were all extremely friendly, efficient, helpful, and solicitous, almost to a fault. We were greeted by one or more staff members each time we passed through the lobby. This level of personalized service is quite remarkable, even by high Hilton corporate standards, and especially so for this city. Bostonians in general have a well-earned reputation for being rather unfriendly and xenophobic; the thought idly occurred to me that perhaps all of the Hilton's staff had been recruited from non-natives imported from elsewhere. The room rates and parking fees are rather steep, as is normal for big-city hotels. The adjacent parking garage was well-maintained and convenient to the lobby. As Hilton Gold members. we were given a free upgrade to a corner room, which is somewhat larger, asymmetrical, and appreciably less claustrophobic than the standard rectilinear rooms. Our room seemed to have been recently rehabbed and was nicely decorated and well-equipped, including a large flat screen HDTV with a generous assortment of digital channels. The free breakfast served in the executive lounge was somewhat more limited in selection but far higher in quality and freshness than the standard breakfast fare served in Hampton Inns and Hilton Garden Inns in the Hilton family - in fact, it was much better than the restaurants in most Hilton hotels as well. We plan to give their adjacent 40 Dalton restaurant, which shares a common kitchen, a try on our next stay. All in all, this was one of the most satisfying and rewarding Hilton experiences we have had in recent years. To find this extremely high level of guest accommodations and service in our former home city was as astonishing as it was unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: drjoe66
Reviews.Content: This is a standard (i.e., boring) hotel in a great location for the Boston conference center. The breakfast for Hilton Honors is below average as compared to many other Hilton propoerties. The room was not overly clean with hair in the drawers and on the bathroom floor. I did not get mich sleep during my stay. The walls are so thin, I could her EVERY word that was spoken in the room next door. I could her them opening/closing drawers, gointo to the bathroom, snoring etc.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here. Quite good.”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice business hotel with a no frills lobby. Right next to the convention centre. You can walk up to various restaurants including Cheesecake factory, PF changs etc. Lots of eating our options.

Reviews.Title: “a stone's throw from the convention center...”
Reviews.Author: honolulujc
Reviews.Content: all you need to do is walk across the street, pass through the sheraton hotel, and you're smack dab in the hynes convention center! the hilton is a bit drab and out-dated. one would think that the hilton brand epitomized quality and a smidge of luxury. this one was wrong. the lobby was not much to see. in fact, it seemed like a small, no-brand, hotel lobby. the personnel was comprised of a series of warm bodies. really here-nor-there; no pleasantries. the concierge was a hit-or-miss...mostly a miss. whether calling or going to the lobby to see one, s/he was like "where's waldo?" bummers. the rooms were roomy, but again, outdated. it's as if they need a brighter paint or wall-covering because it seemed drab and dark. the bathroom was below average; in need of an update. in general, the accommodations were drab, but the location and price fit. then again, we got a special rate. had we not, and we paid what the rack rate was, i would've felt ripped off. the location, AGAIN, is great! try to find something else around the neighborhood OR good luck here...

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: balz
Reviews.Content: As HH Gold member I was given an upgrade, but in reality, it was only a higher floor, not a better room. Room is ok, a little less than average. No executive lounge and the breakfast for HH is in a separate room with a very limited choice. Staff was pleasent. I beleive that for the same $$$, there are better choices in the area

Reviews.Title: “Nice room,hotel needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: BugletMa.
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and we got into our room early.The hotel itself could use some updating.Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, greatest staff ...”
Reviews.Author: WMD_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We splurged on a 25th floor suite (room 2514) and it was worth every penny. The King and Queen of Spain apparently enjoyed this room, too. Floor-to-ceiling windows afforded 180 degree sweeping panaromic skyscape views. Especially beautiful at night! Seems to be a newer Hilton. Very modern design, clean ... all the amenities you'd expect from an in-town Hilton property. Easy walk to public transportation, boutique shopping, sightseeing hot spots, Fenway Park!, performing and visual arts venues, dining ... what more could you ask for? Ask for bartender Matt at the on-premise restaurant -- his hospitality and touring tips put the put special touch on a perfect stay. Highly recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: DetroitStar48226
Reviews.Content: The view of the city from our room was breathtaking. We had large bow window that overlooked the cityscape. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. We also enjoyed swimming and lounging in the indoor pool and hot tub. But I must also state, I found the breakfast that came with our stay only average in quality and what was offered--which was scrambled eggs, cereal, sweet breads and fruit. We found out after, that if you wanted eggs cooked any other way, meats or waffles, pancakes or french toast--this was something extra that you had to pay for to upgrade your meal. My biggest disappointment though, is the parking rates for this hotel as well as the whole city of Boston. As a guest of the hotel, I would think that parking should be included at the hotel as a staying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Back Bay is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels and a few in boston but this property is by far a family favorite. From the moment I walk into the spacious lobby till I tuck myself in to the super comfortable beds, I am reminded that you do get what you pay for. While some might find this property a bit on the pricy side, its location and convenience to all that Boston has to offer is far worth the money spent. The property has several different rooms depending on the budget your afforded. My family typically stays in the panoramic view rooms. Lots of space and huge windows to view what is arguably one of the finest skylines in the world. The Hilton has a restaurant as well as a small cafe type area where folks can sit and use the wireless internet to catch up on emails and the news. There are many choices outside the hotel for dining and entertainment. It's is a short distance to public transportation which will get you anywhere around the easily navigable city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a decently priced hotel that is feel worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs a lick of paint”
Reviews.Author: OxfordTigger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights whilst on a Saga tour of New England so I am afraid that I cannot comment on value for money as we paid an all-in price.My initial impression was not very positive; Bolton Street (on which the hotel is situated) is not very attractive and, as we arrived I wondered about the neighbourhood. However, I was quite wrong. The hotel is ideally situated as it is just round the corner from Boylston Street which is full of restaurants, bars and many of the sights of Boston as well us the beginning of the Freedom Trail and just a block away from the very picturesque Newbury street which is has many upmarket restaurants and shops. It is also very close to the First Church of Christ Scientist whose amazing plaza, church and Mapparium are well worth a visit. Boston has not really got a heart so it is a matter of personal preference where you want to be. Sightseeing Trolleys stop outside. The hotel itself was clean and efficient but in need of an update; it really was a bit dreary and unloved. Our room was typical of those in many middle-range international hotels. The beds were comfy, the shower had lots of hot water and it had a flat-screen TV but there was nothing in the room that encouraged you to linger. I am a light sleeper and was disturbed by the sound of the lift going up and down but my husband did not hear a thing. There was a quite pleasant public area with access to the internet but, if you want internet access in your room you have to pay extra (shame on you, Hilton). Breakfast was good with all the usual options (super sausages) and the service at breakfast was attentive and friendly. If you just want somewhere convenient to rest your head after a hard day's sightseeing, then the Back Bay Hilton is fine. I would certainly consider staying there again if ever we returned to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TigerHeart25
Reviews.Content: I booked online in advance and took advantage of discount savings. The room was as expected - both times we stayed there. It is located within walking distance of Fenway Ballpark as well as the famous Newbury Street. It is close to the Prudential building and shops as well as the subway. One of the tour buses stops at the hotel - a great way to see Boston. We will stay there again if we return to the area for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BrownBalto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for two nights while we were in Boston for Parents' Weekend at Northeastern. The room was fine, but for what we paid, we expected more. The bed was a little soft and the end of the bed didn't feel as if there was any support there at all. The bathroom is small and the toilet paper holder is in an inconvenient place for those of us not double jointed. We broke a glass and it was never replaced. The day after we checked out, we needed a place to store our luggage for 5 hours and the hotel refused. Next time we're in Boston to visit our daughter, we will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: smh212
Reviews.Content: Stayed using Hilton Honors points while visiting student at nearby Northeastern University. Convenient location within a short walk from Newbury Street, Mass Ave, and lots of other good dining spots. Hilton is getting a little stale, small rooms typical of older inner city locations, but nice staff, and pretty good furnishings. Limited dining / bar opportunities within the hotel, but enough nearby that that isn't a problem in nice weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! good location, comfy rooms with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: wanderingyahud
Reviews.Content: I came here for a conference (five nights) at the Hynes convention centre across the street. When I arrived, they actually reduced my rate from 560 dollars to 360 a night because I was staying with a group. They didnâ€™t have to do that (since the group rate rooms had sold out) but I really appreciated it. Everyone was helpful and friendly. The staff constantly saw the big picture and did everything possible to make you happy. My room was on the twenty first floor with a panoramic view. The room was perfectly clean, renovated and the bed was very comfortable. The bed faced three huge windows (floor to ceiling overlooking most of the city)The view was great and the walls seemed sound proof. There was a heavenly double shower in the room (2 jets one on each side) which would be amazing for couples so someone isnâ€™t constantly left out in the cold but was fantastic for one person as well. What an incredibly decadent experience! Thereâ€™s a Starbucks in the hotel and free internet access in the business lounge but not in the rooms. Sometimes the hotel staff is nice and will give you the access code for the internet in your room. Ask nicely and they generally give it to you. They only disadvantage this hotel has versus the Sheraton is that you actually have to cross the street rather than walk through indoor connections. This may be a minor factor in cold or rainy weather. The Westin is also connected through indoor skywalksâ€� but is substantially further 10 minute walk from the convention centre than the Hilton. If you want to zip back and forth from meeting to your room stay here or the Sheraton The only negative was that the panoramic rooms have poor heating in the fall due to a design flaw in the heating coils of the vents. Apparently this is not an issue in the winter when the entire building is heated but is a factor in the fall before central heating is turned on. They sent an engineer right up to make a few changes but it didnâ€™t help much. If you get cold easy and are staying here in October or early November you may want to choose a standard room and forfeit the view. Otherwise they are more than happy to offer an extra comforter. Once the conference, catch a tour bus across the street. You can buy tickets at the hotel concierge. I strongly suggest â€œSuper Toursâ€� over the others because you get a 2 day pass and bonus tour of Harvard and choice of cruises for around forty bucks. There is a great seafood restaurant 10 seconds away from the hotel named â€œSummer Shackâ€� you can get two whole soft shell (sweet) lobsters for 30 bucks! If you want to head to the huge indoor mall, Hynes convention centre or Copley place just cross the street into the Sheraton which is connected to these structures.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to relax after a day of touring”
Reviews.Author: beachnative24
Reviews.Content: Boston is a wonderful place to visit. The Hilton Boston Back Bay is set in the upscale section of Boston. The desk staff was very accomodating. We arrived at 10:30 am, I not feeling well with check in time not until 3pm, and they found a room for us when we arrived. The rooms were spacious, beds were comfortable, and very clean. Being a tourist location the concierge was most helpful with his knowledge of the area. I was however, dissapointed with the choice of sweets offered as late night snacks, they all looked old, I asked for a cheese danish and got a lemon danish, I have a feeling if I had asked for a lemon, I would have gotten a cheese.. The only other dissapointment was a hotel with this status charged for internet service in your room. Most hotels I stay at, don't charge any longer. They did however, have 6 computers to log onto in the lobby. Overall our visit was very pleasing.

Reviews.Title: “good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: poppy57
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nights at this hotel and found it well located. it is adjacent to a large shopping mall and also Newbury street for shopping and eating venues. the Boston Symphony Orchestra is nearby . we walked to the city centre which was a good 30-45 min walk but there are good transport links. the hotel staff were efficient and our room well equipped with tea andcoffee provided.

Reviews.Title: “What Matters Most is What They Do When Something Goes Wrong”
Reviews.Author: Grmpmbl
Reviews.Content: I booked at this Hilton for a very short (barely 24-hour) visit to make a presentation at a conference. While I was surprised that this Hilton's lobby isn't as opulent as others I've seen, I realized once again that what matters most are the facilities in general, the room and its cleanliness, and how the staff members conduct themselves when things aren't right. I checked in, the nice young woman found my reservation, and then she said, "My goodness. I see that the room we have set aside for you hasn't been readied yet by housekeeping. Let me check." She was embarrassed, as she should have been--it was 6pm!! Before she went to check, she said, "Please go over to the Starbucks and get a cup of coffee and a snack as a gesture because of the inconvenience; they will charge these to the front desk." When I did so and came back to the front desk, she said, "I'm going to give you an upgrade--to a King corner room--because we weren't ready for you when you arrived, and here's the coupon for free WiFi in your room." I was reminded that this kind of customer service is what really matters--and, of course, that the room is very clean, very large, and with a small balcony. In short, I'm very pleased with this Hilton, and if this young woman was any example, the management has done a tremendous job in hiring and training its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a vacation in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JonoB1971
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in the States starting with four nights in the Hilton Boston Back Bay. It was my second trip to Boston and I was more than happy with the location of the hotel. Our room was spacious, well furnished and clean and we were more than happy with all the facilities. It was a great start to our vacation. Boston was great fun and I am sure we will return. If we do we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient - excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rhajah
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hilton location periodically for two years as my daughter attends a nearby university. My family has always found the staff to be pleasant and professional, the rooms to be clean and the parking provides in/out privileges. Great location to nearby shopping and restaurants. And it is pet friendly - so Sophie - the white miniature Schnauzer - is treated like a guest and there is a convenient dog friendly open space within a block of the hotel. Life is good at this location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: anitaWellington
Reviews.Content: Very Convenient location. Christian Science centre, Newbury, Prudential. Would like a time limit on lobby computers during peak usage times.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: _Mundo_Traveler_11
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience here for a conference. Good location, clean rooms. For dinner you have a multitude of good seafood restaurants within walking distance. I am Hilton diamond member and had free continental breakfast in the lobby lounge. There is a guy working in there that is very helpful and has an extremely positive personality -- he was in a cheery and good mood each of the three mornings I went there for breakfast. That helps get your day off to a good start. Hotels can have excellent furnishings and cleanliness, but if the employees have an attitude and just don't care about the guests that ruins it all. I must say that the other employees were for the most part helpful too, but the friendly guy in the diamond lounge goes above and beyond. I must note a couple cons: I was on the 19th floor and my shower water pressure was quite weak - took forever to wash the soap off. the Conference area (ballrooms) right above the lobby have an odd design and are situated on two floors with no way of going on stairs (aside from fire escape) between these levels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice panoramic room”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugVA
Reviews.Content: We had a very hard time deciding where to stay in Boston for Columbus Day weekend. A friend recommended the Hilton Back Bay, and it was perfect. It is near the Green Line subway (known as the T in Boston), which makes it easily accessible from the airport and touring in general. The Old Town Trolley has a stop right in front as well--very handy. We chose a Panoramic View room and loved the view of the Christian Science Church headquarters--think basilica. In the morning, we walked 1 1/2-2 blocks to a great restaurant called Thorton's. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely experience in sunny hot Boston”
Reviews.Author: mistyat11
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this hotel in September 2011 as part of a Titan tour. The hotel was everything one has come to expect from a Hilton. Lovely clean big rooms, and all the usual extras, hairdryer, iron, coffee making etc. the bathroom was a little small compared to the room size, and there could have been a few more toiletries, equally one could only make one cuppa per day for 2 people. Wide screen TV was great, and the air conditioning was managable, especially as we hit Boston in an unseasonable, but very welcome heatwave. The bed was fabulously comfortable. Also in the room was an unstocked, unplugged fridge which seems the norm now, the days of the mini bar seem to be over unless specifically requested!! Would also have liked a soft drinks machine on the floor somewhere near the lift area, their was ice but nothing else. The hotel is well situated for all amenities, although the restaurant was not only pricey but rather limited in the menu. It was also understaffed, making service very slow. There was a lot of noise from the bar area, so meals were a lttle disrupted, and we asked to move to a different table on one occasion. There is a Starbucks in the foyer for those 'on the go' with free internet access, which proved popular. The staff were helpful and charming at all times. All in all would recommend this hotel for a short stay in Boston, one of my favourite U.S. cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard Hilton quality”
Reviews.Author: siptraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, had a great stay, hotel is a short walk from Boylston Street meaning that some great restaurants and bars are real close, only about a 15 min walk from Fenway to.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: skier003
Reviews.Content: I booked this via price line. you never know what you will get, but with the costs of hotels for the town, I figured I would try. I got a lovely room within a block of the T. It is 2 blocks from Newbury St and right next to the capital grill. The people were great, the process wonderful and the room was great. I've had some nice nights at some lovely hotels, this was what a hilton should be, and more. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Back Bay - First Class!”
Reviews.Author: CoolBeansinNC
Reviews.Content: I visited Boston for my first time this weekend and I can't wait to go back! The Hilton Back Bay is clean, friendly, and the amenities are excellent! Peter Thomas Roth toiletries, a great shower, soft pillow-top beds, great views.... the staff were all extremely helpful and efficient. The location was great... easy to access the T, shopping, restaurants, tours, etc. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “good location, bit tired though”
Reviews.Author: weluvusa
Reviews.Content: We read they had spent a load of money on refurbs but can't see where. Was ignored by porters who preyed upon people who looked more wealthy than us, even though I was struggling (being disabled). Got an upgrade to an honours level room after stating it was our anniversary but got a room with 2 small beds, how romantic. Ok for price but not very luxurious

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great....”
Reviews.Author: jarakus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a king room on the HHonors floor for two nights, and were not disappointed, but also not impressed.....typical Hilton room, typical Hilton location, typical Hilton service. Clean room, good access to restaurants, subway stop a block away, but nothing special. We stayed for rewards points, but I think I would have been somewhat disappointed if I had paid full price....Boston hotel rooms are very expensive, and for he price, this hotel offers only location. Parking is $41 a night, the rooms are kind of "boring", the bathroom is small, the lobby is lackluster, carpets are old, furniture is '80's modern....just nothing special. Really good: the bed, the continental breakfast (free for HHonors members), and, as I said, the location. Really, really BAD: the television (a primitive satellite system that takes 30 seconds to re-tune eachtime you push channel up/down, pixellating, poor resolution, poor channel reception).....probably the thing I remember most. All in all, an adequate hotel, but not worth more than others in the area (made over 15 trips to the area in the last few years, as my daughter is a BC senior).

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are visiting Berklee College of Music.”
Reviews.Author: travel5000
Reviews.Content: It was very well priced and centrally located to visit Berklee. Starbucks was in the lobby and a tour bus picked you up outside. Staff was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fenway Close hotel”
Reviews.Author: lqs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 2011 and enjoyed the stay. Hotel is a typical city Hilton with slightly better than normal room. Recommend requesting high floor corner room that overlooks the Charles River and Fenway Park. We were on the 21st floor so had a quiet room. Charge for internet access if you want to use it in your room, but there are approx 8 computers in the lobby next to Starbucks that you can use for free and we used them without trouble. Front desk staff was fine but nothing special. Valet was quite pleasant. Ordered room service one night for dinner. Food was fine, nothing exciting, and overly priced as expected. Bar staff is helpful and typical hotel bar. If you can leave the hotel for food/drinks, definitely do! Exercise room is very nice! Lots of equipment and room! We also used the pool with our child and he enjoyed it. We used Hilton Honors points, but this hotel is pretty pricey at 50,000 points per night so would recommend checking out their list price and save points for a more luxurious hotel/destination. Chose this hotel so we could walk to Fenway but also easily catch trolley tour bus. It is very easy 5-7 min walk to Fenway from the hotel - even our 5 year old was able to make the walk. There were also numerous pedi-cabs working on tips in case you didn't want to walk. All of the tour busses pick up across the street in front of the Sheraton. However, if you're primarily in Boston for sightseeing, I would stay at one of the more centrally located (not Back Bay) hotels. Lots of dining options nearby, Trader Joe's and drug store within short walk (3-4 min) and across from Sheraton/Prudential center.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: lenalidomide
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in an austere city. Not far from Logan airport, with excellent meeting accommodations and amenities but no real accommodations for late- night -arriving guests. The only hotel restaurant includes a noisy, raucous bar with shrieking women and no respite for diners from drinking guests. Still, the food was great, a late-night large Italian party was accommodated with a minimum of stress, only no service to clients, even if already in the restaurant and being served, after midnight. Not user-friendly in a cosmopolitan city. And no room service after 11 pm -- if you arrive late, you go hungry. Not what one would want.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel super location”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Native
Reviews.Content: To be honest not much bad to say about this hotel. Clean, extremely comfortable, located beside "The prudential Center" where a number of excellent shops & restaurants are located. Spotlessly clean and courteous staff. If you are looking for a excellent hotle then I highly recommend Hilton Back Bay Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tiny2golly
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week and wished we had booked to stay longer before going to New York. The room was large and the facilities provided were great. The hotel was in the middle of things without being in a noisy area. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel as a base for a couple of tourist days in Boston”
Reviews.Author: AndyFrame
Reviews.Content: Paid full price for one night and used points for further two nights, and used e-upgrade to get a slightly bigger room - I think the room would have been too small without the upgrade for a family of four. Hotel staff were excellent throughout. Room was very clean and comfortable. We were on a high floor so the view was great. Trolley bus stops right outside. Within ten minutes walk is a large supermarket (can't remember the brand) and lots of restaurants including California Pizza Kitchen and Cheesecake Factory. I am a Hilton Honors Gold card holder so we had breakfast each morning included which the whole family enjoyed and set us up for the first part of the day. Hotel is a little out of town but we were prepared for this. Taxi from airport is very reasonable (I think it was about $40 for the four of us with suitcases). Pool was enjoyed by the kids - not too big and not too small. We were there nice and early the first day as this was the first time the kids had encountered the joys of jet lag !

Reviews.Title: “Good base for seeing the city or seeing the Red Sox”
Reviews.Author: ldhart
Reviews.Content: Ok, to be up front, my husband had a free Hilton night stay, so we didn't really shop around. If you like to dine out and sight see, this is a great base. Newbury St, which houses a LOT of restaurant and shopping options is just steps away, and you've got a T stop (Hynes Convention Center) just up the street. Our room was spacious and clean, with all your basic chain-hotel amenities. Bathroom was slightly cramped (door has to be closed to step in or out of shower), but not terrible. We were there on a Red Sox home game weekend and there were a lot of Sox fans, so we're guessing it's a big base for baseball fans. We were asleep by 11pm and there were some definitely drunk and rowdy fans that woke us up an hour later. Some kind of transportation runs by the hotel on a regular basis (train? T?) that makes a rumbling noise, so don't expect an exceptionally quiet stay. Staff was friendly and helpful, though we didn't ask for much. They stored our suitcase when we arrived 2 hours before check-in time. If you're looking for a comfortable base in the city while you sight-see, dine, shop, etc this is an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well placed.”
Reviews.Author: wayne77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston Hilton for 4 nights and found it to be a comfortable place to stay and very well situated for exploring Boston.The hotel had lots of amenities and a room service if you wanted also.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist base in Boston”
Reviews.Author: PARS1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Hilton Back Bay as part of a Titan UK Tour of Cape Cod/Boston. Had room on 9th floor which was in excellent condition and very modern with all the necessary facilities. The bathroom was lovely as were all other aspects of the room. Front Desk staff friendly and very helpful with tourists. Used Dalton Restaurant in the Hotel for breakfast. Choice and staff were first class. The Hotel is well positioned for tourists, close to Prudential Centre Shopping and many restaurants in Boylston Street. It is well positioned for public transport by underground to various parts of the City. Would happily use this Hotel on any future visit to Boston. One tip - we were there over a weekend and like to try local restaurants for meals at night. In this area restaurants were very busy and involved a fair wait unless you could book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service All Around”
Reviews.Author: Ksr1011
Reviews.Content: We stay at Hilton Hotels quite often and the difference here was we were treated with friendly helpful service at every opportunity. It started at check in, continued at breakfast, and was appreciated at the bar with our server there. The location was also very good. We were fortunate to have beautiful weather and walked every where. We would return should we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A home run....”
Reviews.Author: post68
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I were in Boston to watch Boston Red Sox play. They hit several home runs that night; however, the staff at the Back Bay Hilton managed to hit their own hospitality home runs. From arrival to checkout they could not have been more friendly or helpful. Mario at concierge desk, was indeed a heavy hitter and a star player. Restaurant and lounge staff added to the high score of this two night stay with their good food and quality service. Twelfth floor room cleran and marble bathroom sparkeled. Room A/C controls were a bit confusing to operate but we figured out. Bell staff did their jobs with high degree of personal attention and friendliness. Without question, we would return whether Sox are playing or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: spny83
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, and due to Gold Status were upgraded to Panoramic Room. Loved the room and the view (though would have been perfect if it had not rained the whole time). The room only has a shower which was one of the best showers we have ever had at a hotel (the water pressure was wonderful with plenty of hot water). There were minor issues with the room like peeling wallpaper in the bathroom. The continental breakfast is fine, plenty for us, the staff here kept the items well stocked and cleared tables quickly. It consisted of a chafing dish of eggs and one of oatmeal. Also had bagels, muffins, bread, danish, yogurt, cereal, great cut up fruit. All the staff we met were pleasant and helpful. The best part was the location, we walked all over and there are two T locations within a couple blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location....Nothing More!!”
Reviews.Author: Shatara R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights while in Boston on a fun trip. The one and only benefit of this hotel is its location in Back Bay. It was about 2 blocks over from Newbury Street and directly across the street from the Prudential Center. Other than that, the staff was not friendly or very helpful. The concierge told us to go to this one club called District on a night that it was actually closed. A friend of ours drove down from Maine to hang out with us for the weekend, and parking at the hotel was $41/day. The refrigerator and ipod docking station were both broken, and we had to call the engineering guy a few times to finally resolve those issues. I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel unless you get a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Boston”
Reviews.Author: italaphile
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on two consecutive weekends and enjoyed both visits. The rooms are clean and spacious with comfortable beds and nice linens. AC worked well. Location is excellent. Parking was easy in the attached car park. The hotel restaurant is expensive but there are lots of restaurant options in easy walking distance. Starbucks in the lobby was convenient for coffee and pastries in the morning. The fitness center and pool were very good. The lines at check in were long on both occasions and I thought they could have done with an extra member of staff to help out. We will choose the Hilton again for our next stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and not ridiculously priced”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family event and stayed at the Hilton Back Bay with several other family members. The hotel itself is newly remodeled and has nice facilities overall. My only real complaint would be that the elevators can be rather slow and the breakfast at the hotel restaurant is very overpriced. On the positive side, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Boston favorite”
Reviews.Author: ENVIROCLEAR
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and perfect for a visit to Fenway Park since it is a comfortable walking distance from the ball field. The fitness center and pool are delightful. The location is close enough to the attractions and transportation but in a quiet location. The upper floors have spectacular views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Favorite”
Reviews.Author: cheeseeburger
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at the Hilton Back Bay twice in the past year and we love it. Prime location, excellent service, and fabulous rooms. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Back Bay in March for a college visit and once again last week as our son moved into the dorm. This visit was like the last one; efficient check-in and a clean room on the 21st floor with a great view. But a special thanks is deserved by Kevin who helped us to the room with our 8 large pieces of luggage. We asked him for suggestions as to how to get my son's luggage to his dorm (normally a 4 minute walk from the Hilton) the next day. What a pleasant surprise when Kevin replied he would wheel them over on his luggage cart. He had us at the dorm amongst the hoards of other students/parents in a matter of minutes! We could not have accomplished this on our own! We look forward to many visits to Boston over the next 4 years and will definitely be staying at the Hilton Back Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: kainalu808
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Boston and my husband and I were there for pleasure. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bartender Matt was amazing!! He was full of information about the city and what to do. He really stood out as a true hospitlaity professional. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nfall2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son while he was moving in to Northeastern Univ. in early Sep. The first thing I noticed when the cab dropped us off at the door was that the bellman, Vernon, had our bags out of the car before we were even out. He had a pleasant greeting for us, and assisted us in getting the bags up to the room as soon as we checked in. Hotels should take note - the bellmen are often the first to greet guests, and the last one to see them off, and Vernon is a perfect example of making a great first and last impression with a guest! We were allowed to check in early - at noon, but were informed that they couldn't accommodate us on a "high" floor - with a view of the city - but that didn't matter to us. We got a room on the 7th floor, and the only thing I would say if you are planning to stay here is to request a room on the 8th floor or above. The 7th floor is where the pool and fitness center are, and our room was very near the elevator, so we did hear a lot of voices as people were going to/from those facilities during our stay. The room was very clean, and had top quality bed linens and thick, absorbent bath towels, as well. The bath amenities were also very nice, and were replaced both mornings of our stay, which is nice. It's easy to get a cab here, if need be - they are lined up just down the street from the hotel, and the bellmen will call them for you. Also, it is a 1/2 block walk to the Prudential Center, which is an indoor mall, including many restaurants, as well as the more upscale Copley Plaza. Also, there is a T stop in the Prudential Center (green line) which can take you to other parts of the city. The hotel is 2 T stops from Northeastern Univ., where we were going, but if you have a nice day, as we did, it's also a nice walk - about 5 blocks or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Boston at the Hilton Boston Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: randy794
Reviews.Content: We took a four day trip to Boston and stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We really enjoyed our stay there. We had two rooms on the same floor. The rooms were very nice, clean, and included a refrigerator in the room and Peter Thomas Roth toiletries in the bathroom. The room had great air-conditioning and we had a good view from the 22nd floor. We ate in the restaurant two times and it was very good. We ate breakfast in the lounge for Hilton Honors Gold members every morning. The gentleman in the lounge was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and they offered bottled water for you to take with you as you left the lounge. We used the concierge to make reservations for the Duck Tour and he was very helpful. We also used the business area for printing our boarding passes the day before we left. While we were in Boston we walked everywhere from the hotel. We walked for shopping, a walking tour of the Back Bay and over to the river, to the Boston Common, to the Freedom Trail, and to the starting point for the Duck Tour. We enjoyed eating at Jasper White's Summer Shack and Legal Seafood, both of which are very close to the hotel. We also took a day trip to Martha's Vineyard while we were there. We really enjoyed our stay in Boston and at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Wilburdogs
Reviews.Content: Was in Boston for the Marathon - This was a great spot, next to the convention centre for number pick up and Marathon Expo and not far from the finish line. Had a great time in Boston did the freedom trail with the family over two days before the marathon - Not ideal preperation but had to see Boston whilst I was there, Accom was really good I usually stay in more budget/family style accom but this location really suited my requirements for the marathon, Enjoyed the more luxurious accom and had a great view from our room - Fenway park looked great under lights for a night match on our first night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Tony E
Reviews.Content: Just back from 10 days staying at the Hilton (over from the UK). Never been to a hotel where all the staff were so friendly and helpful. Josh on the desk was particularly welcoming. We had a great corner room with a lovely view. Beds were so comfortable. Absolutely zero complaints about the hotel. Great location, easy to get downtown via the T or just walk. Locally Newbury Street is just round the corner (check out Emack and Bolio's for ice cream and smoothies). All in all a lovely place to stay. Our thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton standards.”
Reviews.Author: evilgem723
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small. Hampton inns have larger and more comfortable rooms. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated, small rooms and not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: janey59
Reviews.Content: When we saw the location it seemed very central, but this is a little misleading. It is down a back street off the more glamorous Boylston. The rooms are really rather small, and the decor very dated. My bill was incorrectly calculated, although the staff were pleasant and corrected it without fuss. The gym and swimming pool were the highlight of the stay. Also it is noisy - you can hear the person in the next bathroom very clearly for example.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevinWhitePlains_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel to attend BoSox game at Fenway Park. Hotel very convenient and clean. Parking garage $$ attached. Walked 3-4 blocks to Fenway and back. Lots of great shops, restaurants along the way. Used the fitness center and kids loved the pool/hot tub. Overall great experience. Didn't spend anytime in lobby restaurant or bar. Would highly recommend the hotel as a base for Boston visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, good rate but here's the catch...”
Reviews.Author: jean t
Reviews.Content: Yes it is conveniently located, and the rooms are nice, staff is good, but what they don't tell you is it is an additional $41 a night to park your car there. Maybe we would have been better off paking in the Havahd yad! Also $15 a day if you want to access the internet from your room..really not kidding

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Interested1328
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and the hotel is well located for Copley Square area of the city. We had access to the lounge for complimentary breakfast which was excellent quality and served by a very helpful and courteous young man. The downside was our room, it was small, dated with a tiny bathroom. It felt "grubby" and claustrophobic and is probably a function of the age of the hotel. There is a lot of choice in Boston and the rooms would have to be completely redesigned for me to consider returning

Reviews.Title: “Great location for music schools”
Reviews.Author: LAstudioMom
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I were in Boston looking at music schools (Berkelee, NEC) and I chose this hotel based on reviews and location. Near the T, Commons, great dining and concerts. We had a nice corner room with a view of Back Bay. We were on a high floor, and the room was very quiet, clean and cool. There's no compimentary breakfast in the hotel, so we wrangled up some Starbucks in the morning from the lobby. Also, no free wifi in the room, but that was also available in the lobby. Staff was helpful, our stay was just fine, but we still felt the room was priced more in line with a luxury hotel (we'd just been spoiled at the Waldorf in NYC) not the lesser level of this Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: FoxNY1
Reviews.Content: Very nice place - clean room. A little dates in places. The curtains didn't close all that easily and the shower doors were sorts of misaligned. Otherwise, great location in Back Bay near nightlife and Prudential center shopping/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations!”
Reviews.Author: hindscpa
Reviews.Content: Hilton web site sold room to me as non-refundable Superior Room purchase with great view, bathtub, robe & slippers. Superior room that has a great view, but missing everything else. Poor room service, cant even get room service or a clean towel! Not to mention that there are no robes or slippers to be found in the room. Beds are so small it is very difficult to fit 2 people on them. Great location for Red Sox games, but everything else is not acceptable for a Hilton hotel. We are very disappointed with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, and location.”
Reviews.Author: kell28
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff great, location wonderful (especially if you want to safely walk to a Red Sox game) and shopping and dining nearby is also very good (try the Summer Shack almost next to the hotel for the best full lobster...get the pan fried with lots of sauce.)

Reviews.Title: “Efficient - as expected”
Reviews.Author: AJ&HTraveltheworld
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed at The Lenox we decided to try the Hilton for our last night after our tour of New England. The hotel is well positioned and exactly as a modern well run hotel should be so no complaints. You could have changed the name over the hotel to any of the other chain hotels in the area and not known the difference. Perfect for business a bit impersonal for family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: djc2k
Reviews.Content: Ideal place to stay for attending conferences at the Hynes Convention Center. It's also close to many restaurants and shops on Boylston and Newbury, as well as to the subway station. The room is nice and comfortable - definitely measures up to the Hilton standard. Very nice hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lawcanada
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip here with our baby who was just becoming mobile. This hotel is in a really nice location at the end of Newbury Street, a 15 minute walk from the Boston Common, and a short distance to Fenway Park. The rooms are good sized. The staff were all very helpful and polite including the front desk, parking attendants, restaurant, concierges and cleaning. We would highly recommend this hotel particularly if you can get it at a good rate. It was significantly less expensive than other nearby hotels such as the Sheraton, in part because it is smaller and also because it is essentially at the end of the hotel strip. It also has a decent gym and a small (and slightly murky) pool.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Staff, Day and Night”
Reviews.Author: stomjoh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend a weekend in Boston. I have stayed at this hotel in the past during a business trip. At that time, I didn't see much of the hotel and the hotel was undergoing renovations --- it has changed quite a lot since then, and all for the best! Everyone at this hotel was very helpful and friendly. In particular, Gloria, Eddie and Bill were exceptional in their attentiveness in the dining room. Although we don't know their names, the bartenders at 40 Dalton during the weekend night shifts were also very friendly and great chatters. The cleaning staff were also very helpful and pleasant. The rooms were exceptionally clean. Although the prices can be high in the summertime, the easy access to Boylston Ave and Newbury Street more than make up for it in saved cab fares. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Boston's Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: cabo23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option for an affordable hotel in the Back Bay area. It is very close to Newbury Street, the main thoroughfare of Back Bay. Furthermore, many of the trolley tour companies have stops in front of or across the street from the hotel. It is also a great option for Fenway Park; it was a 15 minute walk from our hotel to Fenway. You can also reach many historic sites with a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. Another great plus to this property was the proximity to the Prudential Tower. You were able to cross the street to the Sheraton, take the escalators, and go through the shopping mall. The rooms are an interesting shape; however, they are very spacious (larger than the average Hilton rooms) and are very clean. The decor is cookie-cutter Hilton, but it's not hideous and not old or moldy looking. The bathroom is pretty average; the countertop space is good. The fitness center and the pool area were joined together on the same floor at this hotel; the problem with this was that there were unruly young children running around in their bathing suits, leaving the fitness center rather wet and unwelcoming. The downstairs area was great for a quick bite to eat in the mornings; the people at the restaurant are extremely courteous, and helpful. The concierge was also very knowledgable of Boston as a whole, not just Back Bay. Overall, this hotel is great for a mini-vacation or family vacation stay. It is definitely a good hotel to consider if you want a moderately priced room in the Back Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Northeastern University”
Reviews.Author: DDMMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just a night when we took Marshall to his freshman orientation at Northeastern. This hotel is nicely located just a few blocks away from the campus, so it was an ideal location for us. You can walk to the Fens and Fenway Park, as well as the restaurants on Boylston and Newbury streets. This hotel is pretty standard for a Hilton. Biggest complaints about the hotel are small bathroom and no free wifi in the room (they do have computers downstairs in the lobby though).
