We were hoping for an early check-in and left our bags with the hotel, along with our cell phone number, but they never called us. Wound up checking in at the usual time. Hope that's not an indication of what service is like at this hotel, as given its location, we'll probably wind up staying here a number of times over the next few years.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully convenient and easy for travelers”
Reviews.Author: PCmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both coming and going from Ohio to a Canadian vacation. The location is ideal for visiting Back Bay shops and restaurants, and it is connected to a major shopping complex. Rooms were comfortable and quiet despite city location. Breakfasts were hearty and wholesome. Despite all the warnings of Boston traffic, airport transport was fast and efficient. The restaurant scene in this area offers an incredible variety of choices -- some off-beat ethnic in the neighborhood to the north and seafood options abound - at many price levels

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stlshelley
Reviews.Content: Loved the location.could walk to Fenway. Subway was conveniet. Their breakfast was very good. Their staff was very helpful. First time to Boston and would definitely go back here

Reviews.Title: “Close to fenway”
Reviews.Author: durancat
Reviews.Content: stayed July25th and 26th,2011 Very quick check in, spacious,clean and comfortable. Walking distance to Fenway park,our main reason to be in Boston. Close to shopping,tour stops,restaurants. Staff very friendly and helpful. If we go back to Boston,will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 3DStiles
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Very clean. Within walking distance to Newbury Street. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Berkshire Concepts best prices for Hilton Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: climax1967
Reviews.Content: this place is great we used berkshire concepts for booking and it was $89 off of all the other sites out there..we had a great time going to fanueill hall as well as catching a sox's game the rooms here are very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. I recomend staying here and use berkshire concepts for their unbeatable deals here. For the money I think this is the best deal for a hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 2busy18
Reviews.Content: Good location, near the Prudential Center and the "T". Rooms are clean, bathroom small, the view on the high floors are great! The pool is small but the fitness center was very good for a hotel gym. The staff were very professional and friendly. Everyone was nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels
Reviews.Content: Due to the Boston road layout, navigating to the hotel can be a little difficult. Front Entrance is on a small side road. Lobby is a little outdated but the rooms are nicely furnished. The lobby is small so if there are large meetings in the hotel the lobby can be busy and hard to walk to the elevator. Other then that the hotel is in a perfect location for shopping and walking around the downtown area. Parking is a little expensive side but that could just be Boston

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient to Fenway Park with easy access to The Prudential Center”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel_FL3
Reviews.Content: Liked: easy & safe 10-15 min walk to Fenway Park, across the street from The Prudential Center with shops and restaurants, fitness center: clean & updated, Starbucks!, 6 computers with free internet useage in the lobby, clean (basic) rooms, and check in was a breeze. Service was friendly at check-in. Disliked: only complaint that the only full-service restaurant in the hotel (for dinner) was upscaled, and the breakfast buffet was very bland. This hotel isn't in the "middle" of Boston like the hotels around Copley Park (but close being a 5-10 minute walk) and Boston Common Park (20 min. walk). There is no doubt that Boston is a "walking" city. It may take you 45 minutes (give or take) to walk from The Hilton to The Harbor. If you walk around the outside of the hotel, there is a McDonalds and my golly, a Dunkin Donuts (they are everywhere!), and check out Summer Shack Restaurant for lunch or dinner if an upscale restaurant isn't your thing (300 feet outside of Hilton doors). Overall, I rate this Hilton Back Bay Hotel with 4 stars; next time, I'm going to try a different location in the city like near the Harbor for a walk view, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Trip”
Reviews.Author: 5fromSeattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend of the 25th-26th with my 2 teenage sons. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Rollaway was delivered quickly. Concierge was helpful with trolley and dinner recommendations. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with clean accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Aabraham1965
Reviews.Content: Our family of four enjoyed our stay at Hilton Back Bay in Boston. The location was perfect for visiting Fenway Park for some Red Sox games. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast. We would have liked to have had free Wi-Fi, however, as most hotels now offer this service.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: kathybott
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and had a slight problem with parking; however, Michael at the front desk took care of the incident immediately. He was very polite and accommodating. The lobby is beautiful and very well kept as was the private breakfast area serviced by Jacada, who was nothing short of delightful. She took care of all the guests in a pleasant yet friendly manner. Our room was on the corner and faced both Fenway Park and the Charles River. Ten minute walk to the Charles and what a wonderful walk along the river! Take time to enjoy the river views and all the people watching. We weaved our way back from the "hatshell" up Newbury and to Boylston where we enjoyed a fantastic outdoor dinner at the Atlantic Fish Company. So relaxed and the weather was beautiful and food was wonderful. We checked with the front desk and they graciously allowed us a 1 p.m. check out instead of noon so that we could enjoy another walk along the river and then shower before our departure. Top notch. We are freqent visitors to the Hilton chain and this visit was wonderful. Brian, the GM, and his staff are attentive and accommodating. If you're looking for a great place to stay in Boston, I'd say try out the Hilton Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for the money”
Reviews.Author: Buck5465
Reviews.Content: Paid full rate for 4th of July weekend. Rooms are small, bathroom even smaller. Shower curtain had very strong mildew smell. Beds were comfortable and frig in room was nice. Bellhop staff was outstanding no matter who was on shift--helpful and polite beyond the call of duty. Staff in general was top notch. Bartender on night of July 3rd gave great advice for 4th of July events. Elevators were burdensome and slow. I realize it was a holiday weekend, but waited up to 30 mins at checkout to get an elevator on the 12th floor that we could fit on with luggage. Very inconvenient. Business Center in lobby very convenient to print out boarding passes. Hilton Honors members. Will shop around next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: vnbond
Reviews.Content: Upfront disclaimer: we are Hilton HHonors members and this was a reward stay for us. Back Bay Hilton is obviously a well run city hotel. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. At check in we were given our requested 2 connecting rooms on an upper floor, we had a view of the Prudential Center with the river to our left and downtown to our right. I requested a late check out on one of the rooms as we had an evening flight and offered to pay the fee but was given a complimentary late check out which made our last day so much more enjoyable. The front desk staff was friendly and answered our questions about getting around town. The bellcaps were also very friendly greeting us every time we entered or exited the hotel and directing us the best way to get to places. As well as getting us a big enough cab to the airport. Our rooms were very clean and kept restocked and tidy by our housekeeper each day. She was always in our hall when we left for the day with a "good morning" and had our rooms ready for our late afternoon return. The bathrooms are tight but nicely updated, plenty of towels. Our rooms had a mini-bar type of fridge that we stored water bottles in which was great since it was so hot in Boston our week. Beds were comfortable, good tv's and comfy chair. We were also given free wi-fi, guess that is an Honors perk. As Honors Gold members we were given the complementary continential breakfast in the Diamond room next to the restaurant. The gentleman in charge of the room was wonderful. So polite, friendly and couldn't do enough to make sure you had what you wanted or needed. Our family found the selections to be just fine, scrambled eggs, yogurts, cereals, bagels, pastry and fresh fruits (we don't eat oatmeal but it was there too). Having that right in the hotel was so helpful and a money saver in a big city. We used the business center computers and printers for both our boarding passes and aquarium/whale watch tickets. It was a huge time saver on the aquarium tickets as there was a long (hot) line out front when we arrived so it was nice to have our tickets in hand. The location is very convenient to the Prudential T stop (green line) for subway use(one block away). Also right there by the T stop is a PF Changs and Cheesecake Factory... we ate at both, one after a late evening arrival to the hotel and the other after our exhausting aquarium/whale watch day. The last night we took a cab to Hanover St. and ate at Fiore in the North End.... don't forget your cannolis from Modern or Mikes Bakery. We did not have time to use the pool or exercise facilities. Overall this was a very enjoyable stay and we would not hesitate to stay at this Hilton anytime we were in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night to go to a Red Sox game. We then moved down closer and stayed at the Doubletree. This is a nice clean hotel and had no issues whatsoever. A little pricey and you get a convention charge (tax). I would recommend especially if going to a ball game.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating, but staff was great!”
Reviews.Author: MaryTony
Reviews.Content: Used HHonors points for our stay, would have been very disappointed to spend real money here. Rooms are oddly shaped and not worthy of Hilton name. Higher floors have excellent views; our first 2 rooms were unacceptable - bad view, stained carpets, taped up window frames. However, front desk made it right and the breakfast staff was excellent, especially Jasoda! Thanks to all who made our trip great!

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhajah
Reviews.Content: Just completed a weekend in Boston for Father's Day. If you are looking for a phenomenal hotel with a great staff and convenient location, look here. The staff did everthing possible to make the stay absolutely perfect! Particularly the wait staff at the breakfast that hustled throughout the morning. Great job! And in addition, this location is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Hilton, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: lostinatlanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. Location is very good and room was very nice as well. Only disappointment was breakfast. The Hilton Honors breakfast was minimal, fruit and baked goods. All the other Hiltons that I have spent the night offered a full breakfast so that was the only bad part of the stay. Parking is also very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fenway and Shopping and Dining, Oh MY!”
Reviews.Author: MandMIdaho
Reviews.Content: Located just a 10-15 minute walk from Fenway, and right next to the LOVELY Prudential Center and Copley Center for all the shopping and dining options you would ever need, the Back Bay Hilton is the perfect home base for your next trip to Boston! There is also a â€œTâ€� station in the Prudential Building, and a trolley stop just across the street. Traveling anywhere in the city couldnâ€™t be easier! We stayed at this Hilton for 5 days, and we were greeted by Omar at the front desk. He was so wonderful and welcoming! As â€œGoldâ€� Hilton Honors members, we are supposed to receive a room upgrade. Well, being faithful Trip advisor readers, we had â€œdone our homeworkâ€� and had read that â€œcorner room, high floorâ€� was what we should ask for if we wanted a view of the city. Instead of Omar giving us the â€œnone availableâ€� speech, he instead â€œblocked outâ€� four rooms so he could take us up and show us each room until we found one that best met our needs! Iâ€™m not kidding! Now THAT is service!! Omar later sent up coupons for two free in-room movies! Such a great welcome!! If only every hotel had an â€œOmarâ€� at their front desk! Our room was keep spotless during our entire stay, and we had four small bottles of water left for us by housekeeping each day, which was appreciated. There is a small fridge in your room, but no microwave, which would have been nice. The only â€œdown sideâ€� that we found was that this Hilton does not have an â€œExecutive Floorâ€� for Hilton Gold and Diamond HH Card members, but there is free in-room internet. There is a room where they serve a free continental breakfast for Gold and Diamond HH Card members, which is TRULY a continental breakfast: cereal, fresh fruits, breads, scrambled eggs â€“ but not much more. It seems like adding a â€œHampton Innâ€� type waffle iron wouldnâ€™t add much to their expense, but would be a nice change over so many â€œcoldâ€� breakfast items. But it was free â€“ and the breakfast room was well appointed and a nice place to eat. We would stay here again and we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: MDIRunner
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was within walking distance to Fenway Park - we were going to a game to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I put into the "Comments for hotel staff to see when you arrive" box on the reservation web site that we were coming there to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The person at reception wished us a happy anniversary! So fun! And as I was making my way to the elevator with both our bags (my husband was getting a box from the car), the concierge noticed my slow progress across the lobby, jumped up, grabbed an empty elevator, held it for me, asked what floor I needed after I was safely on, punched it, smiled, and left as the door closed. All the hotel staff were this friendly and this helpful - noticing if help seemed needed and offering it in a kind and respectful manner!! The room was amazing - we had reserved a room with a view - a slight extra charge but well worth it. The view was wonderful - even our Boston-living daughter and son-in-law praised the view. And the shower: it was simply heavenly. I told my husband that if the shower had been placed so that it, too, had the view, I might never have left the shower. The walk to Fenway Park was fun - and we had the option of a pedicab, too (though we did not explore this option - it seemed like it would have been fun and fast.) It was easy to find our way back to the hotel after the late game. We had a great time touring Boston, seeing the game, and enjoying the hotel and the friendly service we received. We will visit Boston again and will stay in this facility. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Califaloha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel with a Grand Circle Travel group tour and we were very happy with our stay. Nice staff and rooms. Only complaint would be the pay-for-wifi. We felt very safe in the neighborhood and it was right next to The Prudential Building where you can go to the top and view all of Boston for free!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: ncbosoxfan
Reviews.Content: Staff, always friendly and helpful and a location in Boston's Back Bay that cant be beat. Short walk to Fenway, shorter walk to the green line for the T with Boylston and Newbury streets right around the corner and you have both easy access to the rest of the city combined with more than enough to do right outside your door. Shaws supermarket is a 5 minute walk and Copley Plaza and square are within 10 minutes. Plenty of food choices all around. $40 for parking per night

Reviews.Title: “This was a great location to explore Boston”
Reviews.Author: paulav
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Boston before and we were hoping we chose a good location when we chose the Hilton Back Bay- and we made the right choice. The location is 1 block from the "Green line" which is dirt cheap public transportaion and will get you anywhere in Boston FAST-it is very safe. The Beantown Trolly stop is right outside the Hilton. Also the hotel staff and service were the best. The room was immaculate, with a lot of space, you could not hear anything from other rooms and the view of the city and river were so impressive. We ordered room service and it was an excellent meal and we also enjoyed the pub - great appetizers and once again great service. There is a small bakery with snacks and coffee in the lobby and we purchased something from there daily. We also ate the continental breakfast one morning and the choices were excellent. We want to go back to Boston and I would not stay anywhere else. Thank you to the staff for making this a very special trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: AllSet2011
Reviews.Content: Faultless customer service would be the overwhelming impression of my Hilton Back Bay stay. As I work in the hospitality industry, the 'First impressions always count' mantra is one of the keys to a good hotel stay and the Hilton Back Bay delivered both on first impressions and follow up. I had a really pleasant stay, which began with being greeted on arrival by one of the best check-in personnel I've encountered - Natalie - who was superb. Efficient and charming. Immediately confirmed my request for a river view room and offered a high floor room choice too, plus confirmed that a parcel I'd arranged to be shipped to the hotel was waiting. Whether it's good selection, staff training or staff that naturally enjoy their job but found all the hotel staff were also excellent. Room was a good size, nicely decorated in cream/browns with green accents, complete with a chaise longue provided as an extra finishing touch. Large workdesk and good range of TV channels on large flatscreen TV too meant both business and relaxation requirements also met. Bed was exceptionally comfortable with plentiful pillows and excellent quality bed linens. Housekeeping standards - which very unobtrusive during my stay, while overall, there was minimal corridor/other guest noise - were very high. Bathroom possibly on the small side for two sharing but again, immaculate and a range of quality toiletries, hairdryer and plentiful supply of towels available. Fabulous views of the boats on Charles River and the Back Bay area, so glad this request was met and in such a gracious manner too. Gym/swimming pool area was exceptionally tidy and well presented, excellent locker/bathroom facilities even down to little finishing touches such as body lotion and mouthwash, with excellent quality towels provided. Compact lobby had everything a traveller/tourist needed, included a Starbucks/snack area & complimentary computer access, (both tended to be understandably busy in the morning with conventioneers heading across the street to the Sheraton but rarely a queue at other times of the day), a comfortable seating area, concierge desk, (which was particularly helpful dealing with requests which these staff must hear 100 times a week but still went the extra mile to deliver as if it was the first time) and even a device to wrap dripping wet umbrellas in at the lobby entrance! Back Bay location is both a great neighbourhood and base for exploring Boston, with both the Prudential & Copley T-stations nearby and taxis/tour bus pick-up available outside. I really have not one less-than-positive remark to make about the Hilton Back Bay I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and the staff just shone. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hiltons, always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JaylaStarr
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent Hilton guest and nothing about this particular Hilton was any different. Service was great and the hotel was clean as always. The bell man who greeted me was especially nice and helpful. The back bay area is a great location. I really liked the Starbucks and business center located right in the lobby, it's super convenient. I hate that they charge for the internet being that the room was almost $400 but again, that's to be expected. I do want to point out their restaurant 40 Dalton, mmm mmm good. I'm from Las Vegas so I wanted to taste something different and the room service lady suggested the Lobster grilled cheese sandwich and clam chowder, omg delicious! So much so that when I checked out, I made a special trip back to the restaurant to order that same dish. I have stayed here once before and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile.......”
Reviews.Author: Elfriede42
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I, arrived at the Hilton Boston Back Bay Hotel on 05/05/11 from the UK. The staff were very welcoming. We had arranged for our NY passes to be delivered at the hotel prior to our arrival, and these were immediately handed to us. This was a special visit as two of us had never been to the States and my grand-daughter was graduating from the Berklee Music College!! Unfortunately, the afternoon after the graduation, I became ill and was taken to hospital where I stayed for 2 days. My family had booked out and had left for NY. Brian, the manager on duty, called me at the hospital to find out how I was doing and informed me that a chauffeur would pick me up after being discharged! A key for my grand-daughter's flat was left at the hotel reception, which we picked up, and then the chauffeur continued with me and helped me up 4 flights of stairs to the flat!! This was customer service extreme!! Should any of my family return to Boston, we will without doubt stay at the Hilton Back Bay again - they go the extra mile and are extremely friendly and helpful!! Elfriede Flannagan, Sevenoaks, Kent

Reviews.Title: “First stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: 666-HIM-666
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a first time visit to Boston for a football (soccer) game at Gillette. Very close to Fenway, station etc, taxis are right outside and is about ten minutes from quincy market. Parking is easy on site too. Staff, service and rooms I found were all excellent and would def stay here again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great experience using Hilton Honors points.”
Reviews.Author: 2MITravelers
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms for 3 nights while in town to catch a game at Fenway and do some siteseeing. The hotel is in a great location - within walking distance to shops, restaurants and easing access to the subway. Since we were using Hilton Honors points, I was afraid that we'd be given rooms in an undesirable location (no view). I was worried for nothing! All 3 rooms on the 12th floor had wonderful city views. One of the rooms was on a corner and had a sweeping view as well as a huge shower (no tub) with shower heads on both ends. Our room was always cleaned beautifully, and the staff in the restaurant during breakfast was wonderful. The beds were very comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. Boston is an expensive city to visit, but when we get more HH points, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but you should get more for the money.”
Reviews.Author: 2ski2b
Reviews.Content: Great location but on arrival the room had items from previous guests. After paying over $300/night they wanted to charge an extra $15/day for WiFi access. Why can you get free access at Motel 6 and not at the Hilton?

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Fireinthehole07
Reviews.Content: Nice central location. 15 minute walk to Fenway Park. Once you get to the hotel you can walk to all areas. Great places to eat, safe. This is where I will stay next time. Parking was $16.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mariax_gr Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Though this Hilton appears very 1970s, it actually is great value for the quality it offers (or maybe I just got a good offer as I paid about Â£100.00 for one evening). The room was big and clean, with good facilities. Everything was clean and as it should be. Nice enough coffee was a bonus. Unfortunately the couple next door were having a great time -the soundproofing could be improved. A lot.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bear2Maine
Reviews.Content: Third time staying at this hotel and never been disappointed. Great location with fantastic views of the city. Watched the Bruins beat the Canadians at the bar. Great atmosphere! You must try the lamb chop appetizer, incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nipper100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Boston Marathon. Rooms were large and clean. The best thing about the hotel is the location. Centrally located and within walking distance to all attractions. A great supermarket within a couple of blocks for affordable take-out. The Cheesecake Factory is within a block Unfortunately, the service on the attached restaurant "40 Dalton" was not great. One server to accommodate the three occupied tables in the place was slow. We had to ask for a beer three times before she finally brought it to us and she didn't apologize. I didn't appreciate having to pay an additional $15.00 a day for Wi-Fi. I've stayed in Holiday Inn Expresses and Best Westerns for half the price with free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “love the bed and the room was large”
Reviews.Author: mad155
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last night. Room was very clean and large. Bathroom a little small but that was okay. overlooked the river and i could see the top of fenway. not sure of the view on the lower floors. i got there late so i had to eat at the hotel. the dalton resturaunt was okay. steak was not cooked the way i ordered but it was a hangar steak but the sauce was great. will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, best gym ever”
Reviews.Author: silverthief2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights while attending a conference at the convention center across the street. The room (1501) was spacious and clean, good view, and no problems. The location is also good, close to the Prudential Center, food on Boylston St., and shopping on Newbury St. The real highlight is the gym and pool area on the seventh floor: huge gym with new-looking machines and weights, with adjoining small pool area. There is also an outdoor patio area if the weather is good. Check this one out if you want to get a good workout while traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Excels in all 6 Tripadvisor categories”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: First of all, as one who travels frequently, hotels rated 5 stars need not be the most expensive as is the case with the Hilton Back Bay. The Tripadvisor site looks to service, location, cleanliness, value, room quality and sleep quality. In my mind, this hotel rates 5 stars for ALL the above. First of all, the service is first rate from the moment one walks through the door, to the front desk, to room service, breakfast room, all with a sincere desire to please the customer. Our room was spick-and-span clean--no hidden corners with dustballs, etc; linens were fresh, glasses sparkled, 5 pillows added to the comfort. As for value: the hotel's website listed numerous "specials" and we took advantage of such a rate. Location is ideal: steps from the Prudential Center and all its shops. We walked to the Boston Symphony for a performance. Fenway Park for BoSox fans is a walk away. Fortunately, the MBTA Green Line is in the Prudential Center and is the perfect T Stop for short trips to the Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Stewart Gallery, the North End, Government Center, Copley Square, and College stops. Cambridge is fairly close as well. Purchase a $15.00 weekly T Pass and you are set for travel in Beantown using the Hilton Back Bay as your center. The Green T line also makes for a easy 1st step for those wishing to visit Salem and its marvelous Peabody Essex museum.When visiting Boston my wife and I make a point of eating seafood. I must say that the one evening we ordered room service the seared scallops and risotto we ordered were as good as, if not better than, the seafood we enjoyed at the "name" 1st class restaurants we also visited. Amazing!! My sense is that the management of this hotel has taken the steps to insure that the needs of the visitor are the #1 priority. Job well done!! 5 stars at a reasonable rate. Doesn't get better than this.!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - close to colleges, shopping...”
Reviews.Author: fltraveler100
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently while touring colleges with my teenager. Excellent location for touring colleges...easy walk to Northeastern. Also very close to great shopping and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: inkski
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very nice and clean. The plumbing is loud and the cost to park is high. I would tru another hotel before going back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: Jinxy11
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting Boston. Expected a little more. The property was slightly older. Couldn't turn our thermostat below 68, but they did send someone to help open our window. We were on a high floor with lots of noisy teens who woke us up. We called and Hilton sent security right up which was nice. Great pool and hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasha51
Reviews.Content: For us this hotel's location couldn't have been better given we were visiting nearby colleges. It allowed us easy access to the T lines, and to Prudential Center which was great in such cold weather (we're from CA) for nice stores and restaurants. The hotel itself was great - has an indoor pool, helpful concierges. We had booked a low rate online and so I was worried we'd get fairly low quality room, but far from it. On the 20th floor, had a great view of Boston, room was substantial to meet our needs, very clean, very quiet and well appointed with very nice, comfortable double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like a SOFT bed.”
Reviews.Author: kowzy
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. Staff nice. Beds made my back hurt (too soft) and if you are used to a King for two people, a double wont cut it. Had to get a roll away. Asked for and got the roll away and Wi-Fi at no charge, a $40 per day savings. Right across the street from the Prudential and Sheraton, with great food court and shopping. Right next to Summer Shack restaurant. Walking distance (1 block) to the "T" subway. "River view" is to the Charles river but way way off in the distance. OK pool and hot tub. Good weight room. Rooms do get stuffy in winter, as the AC and fans don't run, and too noisy to open window. Pillows were awful. Trolleys pick up and drop off right at hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff provides excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: chitownflyer
Reviews.Content: In todayâ€™s hotel industry, there are hotels which provide accommodations, and then there are hotels which provide superior customer service as the staff at the Hilton Boston Back Bay whom made my stay an enjoyable experience. When contacting the hotel, the front desk manager Segen was very helpful in arranging a quiet and comfortable room for me in advance of my arrival. At some hotels, the Diamond lounge or HHonors breakfast provides minimal or insufficient dining options. At the Hilton Boston Back Bay, Gold and Diamond members are provided with their own lounge with a nice breakfast buffet including fresh fruit, cereals, bread, hot oatmeal, and a warm egg dish. The Diamond lounge concierge Eddie oversees the lounge during the week and is great with providing guests information. His colleague Claudia also provides very nice service on the weekends as well. The location of the hotel is in the Back Bay which makes is great for going to Boylston, Newbury Street, Copley, and the Prudential center. There are free computer terminals on the ground floor for accessing the internet, and WiFi is also free on the ground floor as well. I look forward to returning to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay-but low water pressure”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Spend two full days at hotel for meetings. Check-in was quick and friendly. I requested and received a quiet room. The room had large Flat-screen TV, comfortable bed and bedding and plenty of room. The bathrooms do not have much counter space but there is plenty of counterspace in the room. The shower and shower water pressure was my only issue. The water is much less than your average low-flow shower head. Taking a shower required a lot of extra time becasue the water flow was so low. The shower itself was not updated relative to the rest of the room and it needed to be. Shower doors were awkward to open and use. Parking a car is $41/day. On a more positive note: has a Starbucks and great resturant. Conducted a 2-day seminar in hotel and the banquet and conference staff did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for a nice price”
Reviews.Author: SweetP0lly0369
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Back Back for 3 nights. I thought the room and bathroom were both clean. We had an issue with the shower on our second night. A quick call to the front desk and someone was at our door within 10 minutes to fix the problem. Afterwards, the front desk called our room to make sure that we were satisified with the repair and if we needed anything else. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. It was a great perk that they offer complimentary luggage storage after check out time as we had approximately 5 hours before leaving for the airport. The front desk staff was helpful with directions and recommendations for dinning and local attractions. It's within a 5 minute walk to Boylston Street and Newberry Street - both are great for dining and shopping. I thought the price was reasonable based on the location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay -- Outstanding gym”
Reviews.Author: COfamilyman
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable; I felt pampered. I got a couple of great nightâ€™s sleep on comfortable beds and pillows. The room was temperature controlled by an actual thermometer (what a refreshing change from those window unit heaters/air conditioners). The hotel itself was beautiful; a high end experience. I was able to use the free business center to complete some work while sipping on Starbucks coffee served right there in the hotel lobby. To top it off, the Hilton Back Bay had THE BEST gym Iâ€™ve ever seen in a hotel. Lots of running treadmills, weight machines, free weights, and floor space; I got a real workout in while traveling. The pool and hot tub were clean and just wonderful. On one evening, I visited the bar/restaurant, the FORTY DALTON. Nice place but, wow expensive. $11 for a single glass of wine. I also decided not to eat there since they charge $17 for a hot dog. No kiddingâ€¦$17. Fortunately the location was superb so there were lots of eateries within walking distance. I highly recommend a local seafood establishment called the Atlantic Fish just two or three blocks away. I used my hot dog funds for lobster :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for New England Conservatory Audition”
Reviews.Author: cwspence_NH
Reviews.Content: We live about an hour north of Boston but decided to get a hotel room for my daughter's audtion at the New England Conservatory (NEC). It was the best decision because it snowed the night before and instead of fighting the weather we were cozy in our room at the Hilton. The location is within walking distance of NEC and convenient to restaurants and shopping. The Prudential Center is just across the street and has 3 restaurants: Legal Seafoods, PF Chang and the Cheesecake Factory. My daughter used the Hilton business center to print out final copies of her sheet music from her computer. We parked in the garage which was a bit expensive but worth it since we did not have to deal with the snow. Luckily, I was able to get a great room rate using LastMinuteTravel.com. We recently stayed at the Chicago Hilton and the stay here in Boston was equally nice. We loved the pillows and the Crabtree & Evelyn bath products. The staff was friendly and helpful. The views from the room were wonderful - ours overlooked the Christian Science Center, which was very pretty in the snow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: It's obvious that customer service is #1 at this hotel. Everyone was incredibly helpful and nice throughout our too brief a stay. The only disappointment was that we reserved a corner room and were assigned a handicapped corner room. We did not feel right keeping it because it should have been made available for guests who really needed it. Instead we were assigned an upgraded room (not a corner rm) on the top floor. The view was fantastic and everything about the room was fine. Mattresses are on the firm side and the pillows are superb. Other reviewers have commented on the incredible location. We were there for a college visit at Boston Conservatory--a 4-5 minute walk, along with Berkeley School of Music, Symphony Hall, and it's a short walk to New England Conservatory, and Northeastern Univ. Eateries and restaurants of all price ranges and cuisines are close by. It's also a short walk to public trans., and cabs are quickly available at the hotel. If our daughter is accepted to Boston Conserv. and chooses to attend (crossing fingers and toes!!), this will be our hotel of choice in Boston during the next 4 years.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: outoftownIAD
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, but what stood out for me was the customer service. Every staff member I dealt with was friendly and helpful, from the doormen to the front desk people to the concierge to the wait staff. We had a large corner room, which was very clean, with comfortable beds and plenty of towels and toiletries in the bathroom. As HHonors members, we had free wifi in the room, which was nice; otherwise, there is a business center adjacent to the Starbucks in the lobby with complimentary use of half a dozen PCs and a few printers. The hotel is near the Prudential Center shops - you can cross the street and walk through the Sheraton to get there if the weather's freezing like it was when we were there. We didn't use the pool or fitness center, but we stopped by to check it out and thought it looked nice and well-maintained. We'll try it next time since we'll definitely stay here again the next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: achill_28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in may 2010 + found the hotel to be very good. Staff were very friendly especially the bar + resteraunt staff. The room was very spacious + clean + the very large flat screen tv also helped..!!! Was very accessible to the city + it also helped that the trolly tours of the city pulled up right outside. Would highly recommend the hotel to any of my family travelling to america + the boston area.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: topdog1066
Reviews.Content: me and my brother traveld to boston to watch a bruins game and chose this hotel for its location good clean room great beds ac was a bit lould stayed on 12th floor no noise from other rooms if in boston again i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShayOakland_CA
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean. The views from the 23rd floor were great. They have a decent small workout room. They charge $15 a day for internet service which is pretty lame.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean rooms, poor service, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: sexonthebeach150
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've stayed at in Boston, and as a frequent business traveler (despite this being a pleasure trip), the worst hotel I've ever stayed at that was rated 3.5 stars. Why? The rooms are not clean. Someone had vomited in my room, and the bed spread was left with the vomit on it after housekeeping had cleaned. They had also omitted cleaning the minifridge, cleaning marks off the wall and chair, and removing dried gum from the nightstand. As a Gold HHonors member, the hotel upgraded us to breakfast with hot items from the Diamond Lounge Continental Breakfast (but if you have to pay an upgrade fee, don't, because it wasn't well prepared or tasty). In any case, the upgrade wasn't necessary - only a clean room was, but they could not accomplish that. The floor also smelled of smoke and the hotel couldn't identify the source for about six hours. The front desk manager's response? Deal with it or leave. The hotel does nickel and dime - no free internet ($14.95/day), parking ($44/night), etc. There are much cleaner, more service-oriented, and more modern hotels in Back Bay, Downtown, and the North End for the price of this. See my pictures for the proof of what I've said in the review.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonLib
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a recent snowstorm. As Hilton Gold, I was surprised to have to request a higher floor from the 5th floor room originally assigned, but did end up on the 24th floor. The room was clean and well laid out, with nice linens and a very comfortable bed. It was quiet, at least on this floor. This is a 3.5 star hotel that probably aspired to 4 star status at one point, but now seems to have found its niche. The pool was on the small side, but clean. I though the complimentary continental breakfast for Gold HHonors was quite fine, with good fresh coffee, a nice fruit assortment, and some freshly cooked (not dried) eggs. The staff member assigned to the Hhonors breakfast area offered very good service, despite what was probably a difficult morning for any staff member having to commute to the hotel. Room service was at New York Ritz Carlton prices (and thus avoided), but there are good dining choices nearby. Indoor access to the subway is easy by crossing the street to the Sheraton and then walking though the mini-mall to the Prudential stop. Walking outside it would be no more than 2-3 minutes tops. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but pay attention to the bill!”
Reviews.Author: explore with more
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Boston Hilton Back Bay while attending a professional conference recently, but make sure you check your bill before checking out. On the positive stay, the staff were very friendly, professional, and accomodating. The room was good and well-equipped but a bit dated. In particular, the small refrigerator was a bit dirty and the racks were broken. The bathroom was clean, but small and seemed like it could use some updating. The temperature control worked excellently and the room was very quiet. The bed was comfortable, and overall we had good nights sleep. But the challenges concerned the cost of the extras and the final bill. The breakfast buffet with a discount coupon was $20 per person, and in-room wi-fi was $14 per day. Thankfully there are computers in the lobby with free internet access. The Starbucks in the lobby was handy as well. But at check-out we disovered that we had been charged for someone else's room with all that person's additional charges. Had we not checked the bill carefully, we would have paid much more! The staff did correct the mistake, but it makes me wonder about how Hilton processes room bills. In the summer I had another bill mix-up at a Hilton in Chicago. Overall, this is a good choice if you are attending a conference at the Hynes Convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, with quibbles”
Reviews.Author: RoxburyRusset
Reviews.Content: They are right about the beds -- very comfortable, and nice cotton sheets. Temperature control in the rooms actually works. Computer terminals and online access available free -- a rarity these days. They're stingy with the coffee. You only get two coffee pads, and those are stale. I suppose they want you to use the Starbucks in the lobby, which I did. I have to admit it was good. Other quibble: you can still hear noise from the next room, though it's pretty muffled. And what is this trend toward loud music in the lobby? Adds to the stress of traveling. Wonderful location, half a block from Boylston Street, around the corner from the Hynes Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE... MUST READ!”
Reviews.Author: unsatissfied
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before to complain but I would never want someone else to go through what I did this past weekend. Not only was the Hilton Back Bay a terrible hotel for all the typical reasons (screwed up my reservation, no towels, dirty room, thin walls) but my car was broken into in the garage that they charge you to stay at. Not only was it broken into in their "secure garage" but someone tried to steal it and when unsuccessful, stole everything inside of it. When I saw that this happened the hotel was absolutely NO help, would not refund my parking fee, and even asked us to leave because they didn't want the police to come to the hotel!!!! So basically after an already terrible stay they charged me to stay in their parking garage where my car was severely damaged and my personal belongings were stolen and then they asked us to leave. DO NOT EVER STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Fenway park but not close enough to Boston common”
Reviews.Author: Champtrip
Reviews.Content: Clean quiet hotel. You could get the old trolley sight seeing bus close by that showed all the sights in Boston. A group of restaurants close by. A bit far from the centre of town to walk.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Boston Back Bay is a winner.”
Reviews.Author: musiclady17
Reviews.Content: Our son had a college audition at nearby Berklee College of Music. This hotel provided a great location, a beautiful spacious room, and excellent customer service. The staff provided my son with a space to practice the night before his audition at no extra cost. Everyone was very friendly and trustworthy. I ended up leaving my checkbook in the room. Housekeeping handled this well and it was mailed to us the day after we checked out with nothing missing! The view from our corner room was gorgeous and the beds were heavenly. My son got a good night's sleep and nailed his audition (full scholarship!!!). If he ends up attending Berklee, we will be regular guests here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for conferences”
Reviews.Author: emmaline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 days for a conference. It is a perfect location for a conference at the Hynes Convention Center. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Staff are friendly. It is close to shopping and restaurants. We had a corner room with large windows and a great view. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a shower with double shower heads. There is free wifi in the rooms, but you have to log in from the lobby every 24hours for the free internet which was a little annoying. The location of the hotel is great if you need to be in the back bay, but I would stay closer to downtown if I was doing a lot of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pilou27
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Back Bay is a really nice hotel. Good location in the "Back Bay" area, near the subway station. The room are big enough, the bed and pillow are very confortable. The staff was nice and helpfull. The only "small" problem is the WI-FI : if you want to have internet in your room you have to pay more than 14$ per day! But you can go with your laptop in the buisness center and it's free there. If you don't have a laptop there are 5 computers (with big screens!) in the buisiness center too! The breakfast is expensive but you can have a "starbucks" coffee and some brownies or cookies in the lobby for cheap prices. I'll definitely go there again if I'm in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: rae0607
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we took the ferry to Cape Cod, choosing it mainly for its location to the Back Bay so we could see friends (payed $115 on a Thursday which seemed very reasonable). You can also walk to the Common pretty easily and there are tons of restaurants and stores nearby. We were able to check in early and were given the option of a low floor or high floor, so obviously we chose the high floor which was so worth it. Our room overlooked the Charles and you could even see Fenway Park! The king sized bed was so comfortable, and the room was a nicely decorated and a good size. Overall a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Hilton's Back Bay hotel was a great location to explore the city and had lovely view from the 24th floor.”
Reviews.Author: Peacher
Reviews.Content: I organized a trip to Boston for 20+ docents from the Boise Art Museum to OD on art. I chose the Hilton's Back Bay hotel because of it's location and price. We were there for 5 nights. Everyone was very satisfied wth the rooms. We were close to shopping, many activites, good restaurants and public tranportation. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BMBeer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon during October, the hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to most things a tourist to the city would want to visit including the Prudential Centre which was literally two minutes walk from the hotel entrance. Smooth check in, our room was a kingsize corner on the 26th floor (the top) and the manager went out of his way to leave us a bottle of champagne on arrival as he knew it was our honeymoon. Lovely large room, clean, no knocks on furniture etc. Amazing views over the city, the room had everything you wanted apart from one, a sofa, it seemed strange to have such a large room with a chaise longe and one desk chair, not good if you want to relax or eat room service etc. Put a sofa in and the room is perfect. There is lots of space for it. Bathroom quite small but very clean. We had breakfast at the hotel which was ok, we had the buffet so cant comment on the individually ordered items, restaurant seemed small for such a large hotel but wasnâ€™t full so no problem. Food we ate was fine. Only one thing was the unusual music playing at breakfast and a very deep bass that made it feel like you were eating next to a nightclub (possibly not music coming from the hotel not sure). Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT Location”
Reviews.Author: FirstLast
Reviews.Content: Being unfamiliar with Boston, choosing an area in which to stay was sort of a shot in the dark for me. I could not have selected a better location. The Hynes Convention Center T stop is out the front door to the right, then right on MA Ave about 1.5 blocks. Maybe 3 minutes to walk there. This is a Green Train stop. Very easy to access the theatre district, all the universities, Boston Common. Hotel was a typical city Hilton. Small triangular floors so never any hall noise. One problem is the HVAC. Very difficult to change temperatures and no option to leave the fan on to cover city noise. No bathroom vent fan either. Other than that a clean, standard hotel room. Nice pillows but the mattress had seen better days. Definitely not a bed to rave about. Had continental breakfasts in the Diamond Lounge. Nice staff there and at the front desk. Easy to get a taxi even in off hours if you need one. Newberry Street is 2 short blocks away. It is walkable to Boston Common, BU, etc if you want. I will absolutely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Leedstraveller24
Reviews.Content: I'm not a lover of Hilton Hotels. I think they often live on their name. But this one was pretty good. The staff were friendly and helpful from first arrival and the room was pleasant and spacious with a lovely view over Boston. The hotel is within easy reach of great restaurants, but quite a walk to Boston Common and tourist spots such as the Freedom Trail. The hotel had two really good points: a lovely little breakfast room where you could get coffee / muffins / fruit at a reasonable price, and good, free internet in the lobby where you could also print off boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Appears to be a competently-run business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PT07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid October for a work trip. This is a no fuss business hotel. The room was spacious and comfortably appointed. Perfect for a hectic work schedule, with everything within easy reach. Elevators are a tiny bit slow. There is a coffee shop in the lobby, and a light but cosy bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jackiestwo
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on Priceline (at least $200 cheaper per night for any hotel in the area) when coming to Boston for a vacation. The front staff was very nice and helpful. They moved our room to a higher floor so we could have a better view when I mentioned my mom's 65th birthday. The concierge was very helpful, although sometimes the line was very long! The pool was small, but my daughter loved it. The subway was a 5 minute walk away, which we didn't mind at all. The coffee shop lady knew my name the second day and was very friendly. There is a huge mall in the Prudential building that you can get to through the hotel across the street. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby, which was fine with me (they also had computers that you could use in the lobby and there was usually one available.) Little food hint: to save money and time, we ordered Domino's pizza 3 nights of our trip when we were bushed and it was always very hot and fresh! (I wish it was always like that in my home town!) Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: grammysosa
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel and stayed there in July and had a great time. The hotel was perfect. So, I recommended it to our friends and ourselves and returned in October. We waited two hours for our room which took us to about 4:00 pm. Upon entering the room, the carpet hit me immediately as being very spotted (icky.) We went ahead and settled in but couldn't regulate the heat/air conditioning unit, and the tv would not work. A maintenance man was sent and told us too many people were using the television sets. That's why it wouldn't work. What? He also gave us a tip to put the heat on low and dial up to 80 degrees. We put up with that, but it wasn't very efficient. Then we begin to shower, but the shower doors were horrible- all rickety and extremely hard to move. Our one lady friend to whom we had recommended this hotel was stuck inside her shower and couldn't get out. Her husband was finally able to move the door enough for her to squeeze out. He reported the problem and maintenance took the door off and put up a shower curtain. The following morning, our television still wouldn't work, so I took the remote down to the desk and asked them to give us one that would work. I also asked about the very spotted and dirty carpet. She said she would move us but that another room may have the same dirty carpet. She said she couldn't inspect each and every room for dirty carpet. She didn't impress me AT ALL. There was one concierge who was able to give us some information, but the other two just stared at me when I asked a question. They simply didn't know anything. Even though this Hilton Hotel is located well for us, we will find another place to stay next time we are in Boston. It was embarrassing to have recommended the Hilton to our friends. There was one high point during our stay, and that was the wonderful man who staffs the free breakfast for Diamond members. I give him five stars, but I give the rest of the hotel and its staff a one star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: doreen_dunmore
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great standard as you would expect from the Hilton. Was in a great location for shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fishmusic
Reviews.Content: Everything came up to expectation, with no complaints. We arrived in the evening to an exceptionally warm and friendly welcome from reception. Our room was comfortable, clean and spacious. We had booked in advance via the internet a package without breakfast. We had breakfast in the hotel, and it was great, but to us it seemed pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kted14
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in one of the superier panoramic room that are incredible. I stayed there for our anniversary and i wanted to make a reservation this year for the same room. One of the general managers responded to my request within minutes of my email and told me the process to help ensure i can stay in the same room this time around. The general manager was awesome and i 100% recommend this hotel because of the help from staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Ceil33
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston to go to a game at Fenway Park. We found this hotel on Tripadvisor and the location was absolutely perfect. We could see the stadium at night from our hotel room window. It was close to the subway, shopping, and a full service grocery store. Our room was nice size and clean. The beds were very comfortable. Everyone there was very helpful and answered all of our questions and gave us advice and directions to anywhere we wanted to go. Fitness room was open 24/7. It has a pool and hot tub, but we never used it because we were too busy sightseeing. They even had 5 PCs with free internet in the lobby. I would highly recommend this hotel. Boston is a great place to visit. Lots to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Basset_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night to attend a Red Sox game. I booked this hotel online w/ the advance no CX policy for $99/nite. This was an great price for a Boston Hotel. I opted to take a corner room upgrade for $9.00. When we checked in, the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The corner room was so big, very comfortable, so worth the extra $9. This hotel is in a great location with Newbury street a block away, the Pru close. I would definately stay at this Hilton property again when I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Small closets, very bad view, mold in the bathroom and a noisy ice machine.”
Reviews.Author: polished_pink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the ACS conference and decided to make a week of vacation. The hotel looked nothing like the photos on the internet. We had a 12 inch closet which we could not hang our clothes. We called platinum American Express and asked them to get aus a room with a real closet. Well that didn't work. The bathroom had mold in the tub and the ceiling had mold and falling down wall paper. The ice machine around the corner was filled from our bathroom sink so you can imagine that noise! Our view was terrible, just the air conditioning units from the buildings. UGH! On the positive side, the food in the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience on a Rainy Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GradStudentSpouse
Reviews.Content: The good: Location, view from room, gym, pool, hot tub, service, slept soundly, clean shower The rest: Though I slept soundly, the walls were a bit thin and I could hear a what must have been a whole family chatting & playing about in the next room during the day. The toilet my room (1706) was bizarre in that it shot water back up when flushing. I had to wipe drips of dirty toilet water off the seat a couple times because of this. Then, we figured out how to flush so that only the lid got wet and not the seat, but still... That said, the bathroom was otherwise spotless. The lobby was kept freezing cold (60's?) so that I did not want to stay down there long. It was raining for most of my visit, and under such circumstances this hotel seemed like a minimalistic place to stay. Excepting the freezing lobby, benches beside the elevators, pool area and a relatively dark & expensive restaurant on the first floor, this hotel did not offer any comfortable place beyond one's own room to sit down, relax and wait out the rain.

Reviews.Title: “It was a terrible experience, they have very poor room service.”
Reviews.Content: please try to keep the timings u tell the customers.......

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: timmy16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for 2 nights. Hotel: The hotel is very nice overall. It has a modern feel and is well kept. They do not have a valet, but the parking garage is connected to the hotel ($35/night) Room: I had a king room. The room had plenty of space, a comfortable bed and was very clean. Room Service-I did have room service one night and the food was very good! Location: Great location. You can walk out and walk any direction to find shopping, restaraunts, bars, walking paths, etc. Business/Fitness Centers: the hotel offers both, while i didn't use either, they both looked very nice. In summary, very nice hotel and location, I would definitally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great fitness centre”
Reviews.Author: Snowmancolin
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a last minute treat when we decided to stay in Boston a day longer. The staff were friendly even though we must have looked scruffy with our backpacks!! The room was clean and comfortable. We were really impressed with the fitness centre which helped after a sneaky visit to the cheesecake factory nearby! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and good location for shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: GLJRangersFC
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed this hotel due to its location and the ease with which you can walk around Boston from this hotel. The room was big and had a good view and like all Hiltons had more than enough bathroom toiletries The only small gripes were the safe not working and there were exposed nails on the back of the cabinet holding the fridge. The bar was good and bar staff friendly though we didn't eat in the hotel.The tour buses for the hop on/hopoff tours leave from just outside the hotel and tickets can be bought from the concierge. All the staff at the front desk were friendly and gave good advice Would I stay again at the Hilton Back Bay ? definately

Reviews.Title: “ok, big and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: MariMichelena
Reviews.Content: but nicely located, standard chain hotel. a good idea was the starbucks in the lobby. not specially friendly staff, but no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “No Upgrade, A Miserly Breakfast Instead”
Reviews.Author: johnash
Reviews.Content: We'd contacted this hotel well in advance before making a reservation for our first visit to Boston, our last port of call on a month-long tour of the USA. My partner holds a Hilton Honors "Gold VIP" card which entitles him to a room upgrade at Hiltons or, failing that, breakfast. When we Emailed the manager the implication was that we would be booking a pretty good room ("Superior Corner Room") but that an upgrade may be available to a "River View" room. This was not forthcoming so he was given vouchers for a "Continental" breakfast. We checked that this was correct as, at other Hilton-brand hotels we'd been given an excellent full breakfast in lieu of upgrade. But that was their policy so we suffered the meanest (ie most miserly) of breakfasts we'd encountered on our whole tour involving stays at 18 different hotels. Well done Hilton. This was worse than any Comfort Inn or Best Western Continental breakfast we had come across. Having said this, the waitress (from Eastern Europe, perhaps?) who was attending to breakfast could not have been more helpful and friendly. It's just a pity she had so little material to work with! This somewhat spoiled our stay here as did the rather limited public space, much of which was taken up by a dreaded Starbucks. Hotel staff (Bell hops and Reception staff) we friendly enough but this hotel did not have the feel of a big-city hotel as the whole approach was somewhat amateurish. There was no official valet parking but the guys at the door were happy to do this for you - at your own risk I guess! The room was good. A nice view (away from the river!). The corner was wasted, though, as no extra furniture was provided. Just one lounge chair in the room when there was easily enough room for a 2nd comfy chair in the large empty space next to the computer desk. Two in a room so why not two chairs to sprawl in?? We loved Boston and Back Bay is an excellent location for bars and restaurants and an easy walk or ride (the subway is great) to all the other attractions. Shame about the breakfast! We'll look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: PedroAthens
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Boston Back Bay is a typical Hilton, located just steps away from Old Town and shopping. There is a trolley tour stop just outside (at the Sheraton, across the street). The rooms are decent sized, clean, and comfortable. It's like staying at most other Hiltons around the world. The rooms seemed to be a bit larger than usual. There was a mix up with our bill, as the reservation was in my name but my wife checked in before me and gave her credit card. For some reason, they charged her card for a higher rate than reserved, but corrected it without needing to contact them at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: foleya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is right opposite the Prudential centre there is a T station there. It is within walking distance of Fenway and we could see the game going on from our room. Lots of restaurants and bars on Boylston street which is just around the corner. Felt very safe at night time around there. You can walk to the city centre easliy from here The room was lovely great swimming pool and gym. The bar was also very good. We did not eat in the restaurant so cannot make a comment on that. Very clean and very central would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: gparch
Reviews.Content: Why oh why do the upscale hotels charge for Internet service when a low priced hotel offers it for free? Otherwise, I can't complain too much. The room was spacious, clean and the bed comfortable. The common areas are well maintained. Parking at the hotel and the room itself are overpriced. Location is great - you are close to restaurants, the convention center, Back Bay shopping, the South End and Copley Square. I tried the fitnesss center and pool and found both to be worthwhile plus no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeSpur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little worn, but ok. Nice view of the city from the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Noting out of the oridinary - but too expensive internet and parking”
Reviews.Author: Statstjenestemannen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Boston Back bay for two nights. The hotel itself seems well maintained and the standard is OK; nothing out of the oridinary though. When you are using the elevator in this hotel, be sure not to be in a hurry! There are only three elevators, and often that seems inadequate. The elevators often get full, and people (especially on the lower floors) has to wait for quite some while until being able to cath a ride. There is an excellent parking facility within the hotel. Unfortunately, this is charged at a high rate, as is also the wifi internet. At the prices that is payed to stay at this hotel, internet shoud be complimentary; and parking shoud be cheaper. The hotel staff are generally friendly and helpful, and I had an enjoyable stay. If this hotel reconsiders its charging policy, and give the guests more perks, I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Amenities, Large Rooms, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: csakow
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Hilton Back Bay three times now, and each time I was impressed with the staff, rooms, and amenities. The restaurant at the hotel was also great, had a large selection with a fantastic buffet breakfast. The rooms are clean, large, with really nice comforters and a large flat screen tv. The pool is also a decent size, with a nice hot tub spa and a gym overlooking Boston to compliment it. I would definitely choose the HIlton Back Bay for all my stays in Boston, as long as the priced stay relatively reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “That`s not a Boston accent”
Reviews.Author: HappyScotGlasgow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a brilliant 12 days in Boston and thoroughly enjoyed staying at the hotel. We found the hotel location to be a perfect base for travelling around Boston. My wife had injured her leg and was grateful to sit out for the occasional rest at the area beside the pool and gym. We had a room on the 26th floor and had a great view, especially for the 4th July fireworks. The room was very nice, we enjoyed it. The staff were all great, with the luggage, at reception, in the bar and keeping the room immaculate. :-) Keep up the good work, we look forward to returning one day!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: Teacher406
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute because of the competitve rate we found on Travelocity. That said, we worried about what we would be getting for the price! We were very pleasantly surprised regarding this Hilton. Understand, it is primarily a business hotel... There are not multiple restaurants and other amenities found in pricier hotels. However, we were traveling as a family and still found everything we needed. Our teenagers loved the internet access in the business center, and we loved having a Starbucks in the lobby. This hotel is in a great Back Bay location, with easy walking distance to the Prudential Mall, and several great restaurants. We had rooms on the 25th floor..(AMAZING VIEWS!) and we did not hear street noise at all...which made sleeping in easy!!! I would not hesitate to book this hotel...It is a great find in Back Bay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: obiwankenobiTroy_NY
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast! Very friendly breakfast staff. Unfortunately no free internet in the rooms! Though free internet is available in the lobby. Very clean and big room!

Reviews.Title: “wow,amazing great staff and great food”
Reviews.Author: carlagartland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in November. we went over to do a bit of shopping and see Boston. It was wonderful. the staff from the doorman,receptionist,concierge,wait staff and housekeeping staff and the manager they were all lovely. The breakfast was amazing,so much selection and the waitress got to know our names after the second day and she always brought me out strawberries :) the rooms were big,spotless,modern and comfortable. I was right in the middle of everything and just a short stroll through the prudential centre to a restaurant called legal seafood have the crab cakes...delicious! We will be going back next year and this is were we will be staying!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Hilton Diamond Member”
Reviews.Author: SMEMBoston_Ma
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member and I was disappointed with my recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton in Boston. Returning after living abroad for a couple of years and excited to be back in Boston for a quick visit, I booked the brand of hotel I know and trust and am most loyal to. The Hilton Back Bay reminded me of a Hampton Inn level of hotel. There are not many amenities for those in their loyalty program. Additionally, the room was not serviced one day (!) and the makeup of a previous guest was never removed from the telephone receiver in the bathroom. I was most surprised by the quality of the room given the hotel advertises that they have recently gone through a multi-million dollar renovation. The hotel room did not live up to the quality rooms I find in Hilton hotels around the world, including in Asia Pacific where I live. I try to stay in Hiltons each week when I travel. If central location is what you are seeking, this is a good choice amongst many hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “homely and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: lazarus4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in june this year and we were delighted by how well we were treated and looked after. the room was of good size, air conditioned, with flat screen tv, coffee maker, iron and board, hairdryer. we had a decent city view. the staff in the hotel were very nice and helpful, the staff in the restaurant were brilliant, but best of all was the bartender, Matt. we arrived about 10pm in the hotel and after a brief look around the hotel we went to the bar to study guides and maps. Matt came over and pointed out a lot of places of interest and how to get there. he went way beyond the call of duty and is a credit to the hotel. as we never got to see him before we left, we can only thank him on here, thank you for your help Matt. to have a pint of samuel adams beer in a bar looking the samuel adams grave was not to be missed. i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Fee Party”
Reviews.Author: WRC6
Reviews.Content: I knew from experience that downtown Boston was a pricey lodging destination. In town for a Red Sox game (already a costly proposition), I shrugged off the cityâ€™s typically astronomical hotel prices and opted for the Hilton Boston Back Bay for its proximity to Fenway. The Hilton generally delivered on quality but the final tab, inflated by a laundry list of taxes and fees, was as frustrating as a line drive off the Green Monster by a visiting batter. WHAT WAS GOOD: The location is perfect for any activity or attraction in the Back Bay, including Fenway Park. Boston is a horrible driving city so being able to walk or take the â€˜Tâ€™ is a huge plus. Thereâ€™s an unlimited number of shops and restaurants within easy walking distanceâ€¦.Thereâ€™s a small but adequate pool, spa and fitness center on the seventh floorâ€¦.Service was excellent throughout our one-night stay. Every member of the staff was friendly and accommodating. WHAT COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER: Walls are paper-thin; youâ€™ll hear conversations spoken in a normal tone when the television and fan are offâ€¦.This is an urban hotel, so itâ€™s not particularly shocking that floor space is limited. We expected a bit more leg room for the price, howeverâ€¦.Some reviewers raved about the views from the higher floors. Thatâ€™s definitely not the case at the lower levels. Our fourth floor view was of a dreary industrial side streetâ€¦.My biggest knock on this place is the price and the fee structure. With an already steep base rate, the add-ons were a real drag on the wallet: $39 for parking, $25 for a rollaway bed, $15 for internet, plus the already outrageous state and local taxes; you get the picture. THINGS TO KNOW: Thereâ€™s a seven-story parking deck but only a six-floor elevator. If youâ€™re forced to park on the highest level, youâ€™ll have to haul your stuff a long wayâ€¦.Opt for the highest floor possible to avoid disappointing viewsâ€¦.Not surprisingly, prices in the hotel restaurant are astronomical. BOTTOM LINE: To be fair, downtown Boston is a frustratingly overpriced hotel market to begin with, so the prices here really arenâ€™t out of whack with the area. Stay here if you want to be in the thick of the action in the Back Bay, donâ€™t want to risk the uncertainty of some of the lower priced options, and are prepared for a bit of sticker shock.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, close to shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: QwertySouthwestUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week. The staff are polite and friendly and the room is clean and comfortable. There is a business centre, swimming pool, restaurant, gym and Starbuck's on-site (I only went to the Starbucks). The restaurant seemed pricey considering there are a lot of places to eat nearby. The wireless internet only cost $20 for 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: DropDeadDeeds
Reviews.Content: I'm here right now. Since we're trying to relax and get a lot of rest for a marathon we're doing the 26th, we chose to stay here at The Hilton because we were under the impression that it's supposed to be so amazing and luxurious, etc. Well, the room looks okay but I don't see one single thing about it that makes it any better than a super cheap motel or hotel. I just stayed at a Super 8 last week for a few days and I'd take Super 8 over The Hilton any day of the week. There is no microwave in the room, there is no fan in the bathroom to keep it from fogging up, the ac in the room is very hard to use, no washer/dryer (S8 has them), our mini fridge doesn't seem to be working, and the internet isn't free- which at this price it damn well should be. You could get all that at Super 8 plus everything The Hilton has and pay much less to stay there. It looks nicer and that is all. The advantage is only superficial. I can say the staff is very nice, the place is clean, etc but you can get that at a much cheaper place. If you want to spend more money for no reason, come here!

Reviews.Title: “Serendipity”
Reviews.Author: SBFiona
Reviews.Content: What a find! My first trip to Boston and this hotel turned out to be perfectly located for everything...shopping, the T, Restaurants, and Shaws Mkt. for when you want to just grab a good bottle of wine and stay in. Can't say enough about this place, rooms were nicely decorated, beds were comfortable, a bit pricey but good value for the money, staff is friendly and professional, again, great location and you can walk to anything. Booking our next trip to Boston here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: travelingbadger17
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. The staff was the big positive about the hotel, they were exceptional and provided excellent reccomendations. Also excellent was the health club but the pool was closed while we were there. The rooms (especially the bathroom!) was on the small side (but we did get basic rooms, so suites were likely bigger). Rooms had sweet views of city. Location was decent. The biggest issue I had was the constant nickle and diming Hilton has resorted to. We ate out for breakfest each morning to avoid paying exoburent fees. Would try somewhere else next time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Cookieburns
