Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on a trip to see The Phillies play the Red Sox. We had a corner king room. We had plenty of room and a great view of Fenway Park. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable. Location was in walking distance to Fenway and many shops and restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We encountered no problems at all with this hotel and would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Got a good deal on a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Powderbaba
Reviews.Content: * Excellent hotel, though is overlooked due to distance from financial district * Is not too far though * Excellent rooms and very well done * Nice peaceful location * Room service was prompt

Reviews.Title: “No complimentary wi-fi or breakfast; otherwise happy”
Reviews.Author: samanthasopoe
Reviews.Content: I was reconciled to paying big bucks to be in Copley Square, Boston, which is convenient to Newberry St. shopping, Fenway Park, and art museums. For the $300+/night price tag, though, I expected FREE wi-fi and a complimentary breakfast. Had a king bed room and a comfy chaise longue. The room was quiet (10th floor, facing a pedestrian way, so no vehicular traffic). No shampoo -- probably an oversight that housekeeping would have gladly furnished. But at these prices, it should not have been overlooked in the first place. The heating/cooling thermostat was not intuitive and took a long time to figure out. A 7-min. walk to Fenway, across the street from the Prudential Center and Legal Sea Food, and a few blocks walk to the art museums make the location ideal for touring the west side of the City. An MTA station was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Met My Hilton Expectations Quite Well”
Reviews.Author: Genghisdon
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a convention, and was lucky enough to get a great rate on a room at this Hilton with an AWESOME view of Cambridge and Fenway Park, so my Boston experience was a good one. Everything else about the hotel is what you would expect from a downtown Hilton - the rooms were comfortable (their bedding is TOPS in my book), and the service was pretty good too. One of the highlights I thought was kind of nice was somebody came up and knocked on my door in the morning when I missed repeated wake up calls due to being in the shower...nice touch, I thought. Pretty good stay all things considered. BTW - my review would have been lower if I didn't carry my own Internet access fob with me; this hotel's fee is through the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: as1mmons
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hilton has an amazing location that you can't beat! Neighbors with the Prudential center, the hotel is located in the midst of copley square. The closets T stop is the prudential center on the green line, which is located in the basement of the Prudential building. The hotel was nice, and what you would expect from a Hilton. The front desk staff was exceptionally nice, helpful and accommodating. The bathrooms were a little outdated, but the rooms were nice and mostly clean. The pool was also a little outdated. Make sure to get a high room, because the view is incredible! Also, I would recommend seeing the Mapparium in the Christian Science Center right across the street. It is a giant globe made out of all stained glass! Definitely worth the visit. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: grammylinda
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last October with my 85 year old mother and my sister. Neither had been to Boston. I put her age in because it was such an ideal location. Just across the street is the Prudential Center where you can get trolley tour tickets, Duck boats (and, although you can't get on the Duck boats with the GoBoston card anymore there, they were so kind as to make an exception for us so my mom didn't have to go all the way to the Science stop to get it). There are several restaurants in the Center, as PFChangs, Cheesecake Factory, and others, plus a food court with lots of selections. You can get on the trolley at the side door. The doorman was helpful, the room (a corner double) spacious and clean, and the beds were comfortable. There is a coffeeshop with a few goodies, a spacious computer workstation, and a restaurant. We asked for a refrigerator in our room also. There are many restaurants nearby and a grocery a few blocks away. The tour buses pick you up outside. We thought it was a wonderful hotel. (I posted a review when we returned but now see I must not have done it correctly) I have recommended this hotel to friends who have now stayed there and agree it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Boston - good location”
Reviews.Author: MumaRules
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Back Bay Hilton in Boston and each time there were issues at this hotel. This time around was the day after a catastrophic water main break outside of Boston that affected 31 towns and cities. Fortunately for us, we had been informed of the issue prior to our arrival. Had we not, we would have used the water in the bathroom to brush our teeth, etc. since there was no signage in either the lobby or our room warning us not to do so. I inquired at the desk upon check-in about the situation and received a vague response. Directly across the street is the Sheraton Hotel and they had signs at every entrance warning guests about the water: â€œThe tap water / ice is not currently suitable for drinking but can be used for bathing, flushing and fire protection. Please use hand sanitizer after washing hands ...â€� Since there was no such notice and instructions at the Hilton, I inquired again at the desk and they told us about 2 small bottles of water in the room that we could use for brushing our teeth. Nothing about washing hands, using the ice and no hand sanitizer provided. I was very disappointed, so much so that I sent an email to Hilton close to midnight, hoping they would correct the situation the next day. My Sunday night email was answered on Friday night by the manager, claiming that each guest was handed a letter upon check-in and that a letter was available in each room. Clearly this was not our experience. Water problem aside, there were a few other issues at the hotel. We took advantage of the whirlpool where we found a thermometer holder attached to the steps by a string but upon further inspection, there was no thermometer attached. A few minutes later, I found part of it in the whirlpool. This could have been a dangerous situation â€“ first because of the broken part and second due to our inability to objectively assess the temperature of the water. On the plus side, our room had a nice view of Boston and the Charles River. With all the great hotels available in Boston, this one is ok but would not be my first choice. For the price point, you can do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, incredible view from the...”
Reviews.Author: themuffins
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, incredible view from the 22nd floor. We were there during the boil water advisory and they had plenty of bottled water available. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton chain should be proud”
Reviews.Author: PaulaB72166
Reviews.Content: We just spent the night at the Boston Back Bay Hilton, and loved every moment of it. Check in was probably the fastest I had ever been checked in and after a long day at work you know how nice great service can be. The location is superb, as there is so much within walking distance the Fenway, Landsdown St., and the Prudential Mall and skywalk. The staff's knowledge of the other attractions in the vicinity was also very helpful, which made travel quite easy. We walked all over, did a little shopping, had lunch at Tequilla rain, had dinner and saw a show at the House of Blues- just terrific! The rooms are spacious and modern with lovely decor, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I would'nt hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Nicest Hilton in the Chain”
Reviews.Author: EdinDC
Reviews.Content: I like most Hiltons. I usually find they offer very good value, and service. This Hilton, I'm afraid, doesn't meet that standard. The location is terrific. It's an easy walk to the Public Gardens, Trinity Church, several T stations, Fenway and the Berkley College of Music. The hotel is also well kept - clean and well maintained. The build quality of this hotel is very sub par. I have never stayed in a hotel with such thin walls. Every time the person in the next room flushed their toilet or closed the door, it sounded like they were in our room. The service in this hotel is also not up to par. Check-in at the front desk was brusk and very little information was given to us. Although she told us how to access the parking garage, she failed to mention the daily charge of $40 a day. Although she gave us breakfast coupons (one for a two day stay) she didn't tell us where to use them. Is there an execuitve lounge, or are they used in the restaurant? We were charge $60 for internet access for two days. I was told the charges were reversed - as a Gold member I shouldn't be charged at all - but how can you be charged for internet access 4 times over a 2 day stay? As an apology I was offerred a late check out. I could check out at 1pm with no charge! Whooppee! An extra hour! The hotel's lobby and public spaces are very unspectacular and small. This is simply a lackluster Hilton in many ways. And where service could have made up for the deficiencies - it also dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special About Hilton Boston Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: LivPhilly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Belvedere St. entrance is a trolley stop - convenient. Across the street from the Sheraton and huge mall/convention center - excellent. Nearby walking streets, libraries, Lyric Stage Theater, and Fenway Park (10 min walk). The staff is friendly and efficient. Free internet in lobby area - very nice. The hotel itself is more budget than high class. Rooms are very small, tiny little bathrooms (hard to turn around in). The lamp shades in two of our four rooms had been sliced and diced by some previous partygoers. Pretty bad. . . . One of the two phones did not work. One lamp did not work. The room was freezing and could not be altered from the room (we tried and tried). Our requests for assistance was quick and effective. Overall, a decent place to stay, but I expected more luxury from a hotel with the Hilton name,

Reviews.Title: “Over night with friends in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jdamon
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed dinner in the restaurant, food and wine were wonderful. The staff was great, service was terrific. Our waiter was patient and professional as two guests joined out table late.

Reviews.Title: “Night in Boston with my Son before flying to Utah.”
Reviews.Author: bear2Maine
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay with my Son before flying to Utah on a ski trip. The Back Bay turned out to be perfect! Everything went as planed, the room was great with a view overlooking Fenway! Had dinner in the hotel and the food was excellent. Highly recommend the seafood mac and cheese. Can't beat the beds. They have what feels like a feather bed for matrices pad. Next time in Boston I plan to return hopefully for a Red Sox game.

Reviews.Title: “They're so helpful.”
Reviews.Author: gaolhill
Reviews.Content: I had a mix-up on the bed layout which the front desk fixed. The General Manager happened to be there as we finished and couldn't have been more helpful. What a positive, helpful group of people to stay with in a great location. Nice view of the city too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good location, but a few issues...”
Reviews.Author: tchoneymonner
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful, as it is centrally located to many points of interest in the city. The rooms are clean and spacious, however although the entire hotel is now non-smoking (by Boston law) our room REEKED of smoke. It was really quite horrible. All of our clothes smelled like smoke and my husband's asthma was acting up as a result. We were told our room was always a non-smoking room and clearly this was untrue. We booked on Orbitz, and my assumption is they give the rooms booked at a lower rate through third party sites the "previous smoking" rooms. Softness/firmness of beds is a matter of personal preference, however my husband and I found the mattresses and the pillows to be extremely soft and unsupportive, resulting in two bad nights of sleep. The front desk representatives where somewhat clueless about parking in the attached hotel garage and the hotel in general (note: park across the street in the lot for $10 cheaper a night instead of Hilton's attached garage) but managed to check us in and any other interaction with hotel staff was limited. We found it somewhat unbelievable that the hotel did not have complimentary Wifi in the rooms. It's 2010, and having to huddle in their small and crowded lobby to take advantage of free internet seemed a bit dated, and frankly disapointing. All in all it was an adequate hotel for a short stay, but if I would think twice before making a reservation here for a longer trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has it all...clean, friendly, and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: hartfordtraveler5
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean. The bed and sheets top quality. I find it hard to get a good nights sleep in most hotels, but not this one. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast at the hotel and the food was delicious. The waitstaff was prompt and courteous. The hotel is very convenient to great shopping, restaurants and schools in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for EXCEPT...”
Reviews.Author: 0ccasional
Reviews.Content: I can't get over how expensive the Internet was. $15 for 24 hours... ridiculous. After a 5 day stay, that adds up. The cafe in the lobby has no less than 8 laptops mobbing the tables because other guests feel the same! WiFi should be like hot water and heat--it's a basic need when you travel. Get with it, Hilton! I can understand the overpriced room service breakfast. (the "meal" is $17 but there's separate charges for coffee, an "administrative fee" (isn't that part of running a restaurant???), gratuity, taxes. It reads like a cell phone bill. I can't spend more than my perdiem ($40) on ONE meal! Coffee and juice shouldn't cost $8 and $4 when the "meal" (with no beverage) costs $17

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sox2142
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and staff extremely friendly. We are not from the area and have never really been to a big city with subways/cabs and etc so we relied on the concierge to help us out- very friendly and helpful except when it came time to eat. We asked if there was any reasonably priced "burger" places within walking distance and were given a few places that seemed to be kinda high end - but we had to eat so... The complaint is at the end of the hotel stay we left and noticed a mcdonalds and wendys on the backside of the hotel, it would have been nice if that was mentioned instead of the $100+ meal we ended up buying for our family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravlinNYCDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend visit to Boston. Got a great rate online. A double room was comfortable enough for my wife and I to share with our teenage son. We had a high room with a great view. The location was fine. Its a very short walk to the Prudential Center and the Back Bay subway station. Its also a block away from Mass Ave where you can find McDonalds, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts and a slew of good inexpensive restaurants. The Back Bay Hilton is a fine middle of the road hotel. Clean, and comfortable. My son liked it and you know how picky teenagers are. If he gets accepted to a college in the Boston area this will be our go to hotel when we visit him.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeousable
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge Hilton fan because you always know what you're going to get. This hotel was beautiful & our room was one of the nicest Hilton rooms yet. Our view was incredible & the room was huge. We stayed for 4 nights. The only downside: the toilet exploded the morning we were checking out & it took 15 minutes for a maintenance man to show up. He then accused us of throwing cherry bombs down the toilet!! I wasn't exaggerating when I said it exploded... My boyfriend still needed to shower because he had a business meeting the second his plane arrived in California, so this hold up made him late. Other than the little bathroom mishap it was a lovely stay & a lovely city!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but one big caveat”
Reviews.Author: manhattantwo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Presidents Weekend for a Valentine's Day trip. The hotel is clean and well maintained and the location is excellent: near the Prudential Center mall and a couple of blocks from old Back Bay and Newbury Street with its shops and restaurants. Symphony Hall is a block and a half away, and we attended a superb BSO concert there. However, a warning is in order: I reserved a King corner room at a discounted rate, paid in full for both nights, nonrefundable. When we arrived, we were told there was no corner room available because the occupants of one room had asked to stay another night. We were given a King standard room, but NO ADJUSTMENT for the rate because we had paid in advance! The standard room was cramped for us and had an oblique view past the Sheraton next door: ok, but not what I'd paid for. The concierge very kindly gave us complimentary breakfast, which more than made up for the price difference. But money is not the issue: full pre-payment with no refund should GUARANTEE the room. My conclusion is that the hotel preferred to let the other people stay because they could pay the rack rate for the night. So, while I think the hotel is a good value for Boston, be aware that you may not get the room you want, even if you take the nonrefundable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... Great room ... great service... great location... will be coming back.”
Reviews.Author: DadfromRochester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hilton the last weekend in January 2010. We had a great room.... the entire room was new and extremely clean... the bathroom sparkled. Front Desk service was top notch. This is a terrific location and convenient to everything in Boston. We are coming back to Boston in April and will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton is my favorite place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: CTEllie
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton a few times this year, for business and pleasure, most recently for a weekend get together with a group of old friends. The Hilton is in an ideal location, walking distance to great shopping and restaurants, as well as the downtown business area. It is also extremely easy to access from the highway, which is a big plus when driving into town. The staff at the Hilton was most helpful in suggesting restaurants, and the concierge was extremely knowlegable and had great suggestion for places to visit etc. I am always impressed with the friendly staff and the "boutique' feel of the hotel. The breakfast buffet is wonderful, and the lounge is a great place to relax and have a drink. The rooms are beautiful, with great views of the city. As a frequent business traveler and visitor to I would highly recommend the Hilton to anyone traveling to Boston. You can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous weekend celebrating our 50th birthdays”
Reviews.Author: hcrossen1
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend with my girlfriends from college at the Back Bay Hilton, as we're all celebrating the fabulous 50 this year. Our stay at the Hilton couldn't have been better. The staff was incredibly accommodating, especially the general manager. The accommodations were spotless and lovely. The location is perfect, easy walking to great dining and shopping. The concierge and general manager went out of their way to secure a last minute dinner reservation for Saturday night at a very, trendy, upscale restaurant in high demand. We couldn't have asked for more. Kudos to the Back Bay Hilton!!! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; lousy restaurant service”
Reviews.Author: Rick010
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Hilton Back Bay in mid-January of 2010. Great location, and the room was typically HIlton: very good bed, and a spacious-enough room with fairly utilitarian appointments. The only functional problem was the heat: the thermostat would only go down to 65, which is too warm for sleeping as far as I'm concerned. So I turned off the heating system and opened a window, and was then comfortable except for the traffic noise (which would have been even worse had I not been on the 21st floor). Overall, a nice room at a reasonable price. My breakfast at 40 Dalton (the hotel restaurant) the next morning was another matter, though. I was seated promptly by a very pleasant hostess, and then handed off to a waiter who asked what I'd like to drink. I told him water would be fine, which must have offended him, because he basically never served me after that. After a long wait, the hostess came by and asked if I'd had a chance to order. I said no, and she took my order. She also brought me my food -- a breakfast panini, which was excellent. When I ran out of water my waiter was still AWOL, so I ended up asking the busgirl to bring me some, which she did. When I was halfway through my sandwich, my waiter came by and plunked my bill down on top of the paper I was reading, and walked away. Needless to say, he got no tip. The sandwich really was good, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: Arrival was very early and I knew the room wouldn't be ready. The front desk allowed me to use the fitness center. It has 4 treadmills, 3 ellipticals, 3 bicycles, dumbbells up to 50 lbs, multiple weight stations, locker room and pool. It was quite crowded, but I was able to get my work out in and have a shower. Surprisingly, my room was ready after heading back to the front desk and the room was on the upper floors facing the Charles River and looking into Fenway Park. Pretty cool. Clean, good sized. The walls are a bit thin so could hear the people in the room next to me. The water pressure in the showers really sucked. Bathroom was also quite small. The restaurant downstairs, Forty Dalton, was really quite good and prices for food and drink were reasonable. The concierge desk was extremely helpful and quite friendly. The bellhops were hit and miss. Some just stood around watching people struggle through the door and didn't help until asked, but others went the extra mile. All and all a good value with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Micheal84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton Back Bay for a week in June 2009 and it was a bit of a disappointment. The doormen and front desk staff were not particularly friendly or helpful. My room was huge with a wonderful view of the Christian Science Plaza but tastelessly drab in decor. The lere centre was small for a hotel of its size and class. It was perfectly adequate and a nice location from which to discover Boston but I'll be checking out other options on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Update on Hilton's amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mainer7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boston Hilton in late December and was very pleased. The location (nr to Prudential Center and easy access to Green Line and Orange Line T) is excellent. The hotel is modest in size (about 25 floors but limited rooms on each floor), but they now have a Diamond Lounge for breakfast on the ground level - too bad it is not also open all day for use. The rooms are pleasant, particularly if you snag a 'corner room' which is sized up. FYI - free internet is available in lobby, but very costly ($14.95) if used in one's room. Rooms have flat screen TVs with a good selection of cable channels. Management has made the main lobby more hospitable and it is easy to use if working or visiting. Will be nice when they finally drop the Internet fee for in-room use. Recommend for stay when interesting in having access to shopping parts of downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: dan118ny
Reviews.Content: good value, very helpful staff, clean...no complaints we were traveling with our one year old...the crib that they provided was a pack 'n play, but it was fine

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: SlideTime
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel picked via priceline price $75 a night. Great food in the hotel restuarant "Forty Dalton". Room very nice with flat screen T.V. and lots of room. Staff was nice and very helpful. Location was central to everything. Five free internet computers in lobby with a printer... great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: knevets
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at this hotel. The room was clean and quiet. The location was excellent. Very close to public transportation, trolly stops, sites and attractions all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay and service that I have had with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovelylady31
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at check in time (3PM) and was greeted at the door by the bell man. He was very polite and helped us with our bags to our room. Our room was great.. We had 2 rooms side by side.. The beds were to die for, nothing but comfortable.. We had room service in the morning, which was great, nothing beats waking up to coffee, muffins, danishes, and crossiants by your bed.. I have stayed at many hotels, but The Hilton Back Bay is by far the best hotel. Location is great close to many restaurants and shops..

Reviews.Title: “Very understaffed and eating there made us sick”
Reviews.Author: Tiredtraveler1
Reviews.Content: Very understaffed and eating there made us sick, sometimes the front desk was unattended for up to ten minutes....I thought a hotel was opne 24 hours. Also,,,we became ill after eating at the restaraunt. Then we had to wait 45 minutes for security(apparently only one security person works each shift we were told) to do a food poisoning report.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Tricia F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of October and were pleased with our choice. It's close to subway stations, Prudential Centre, shops and restaurants and is well located to walk down Newbury & Boylston Street to the Public Gardens & Boston Common. You can also take a trolley tour which picks up outside the hotel. The hotel had everything we needed, coffee maker in the room, comfortable beds and well equipped (if a little small) bathroom. We had asked for a room higher up and that's what we got, complete with great views over Charles river at one side and part of the city at the other. There is also a very good coffee shop within the hotel. Staff were very professional, friendly and helpful and we would stay here again if we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for sightseeing in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Kentishlea
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel from the UK for two nights as part of a longer tour and were delighted with the room and the location. The room was great, beds comfy and clean and the bathroom was nice. There is a shopping center opposite to get breakfast or you can eat at the hotel. The bar is very expensive and when we were there it was very loud and noisy due to some conference people. It really is a great base to explore Boston, you can walk to Quincy Market, Newbury Street is close by which is lovely. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely go there again if we were visiting Boston

Reviews.Title: “Close to Fenway”
Reviews.Author: tlc2424
Reviews.Content: We loved this Hotel. The location was great, short walk to Fenway and parking garage attached to the hotel. The staff was efficient and very nice. The view from the room was well worth the money and the room itself was very clean and the bed was super comfortable. Go Red Sox!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: bilste
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Back Bay in Boston is well located for whatever you want to do in Boston. Within steps of the "T" station, one can reach the Harbor, Boston Commons, Universities and the Freedom Trail easily. The hotel is clean and well appointed. The elevator shaft tends to be noisy, so choose a room away from the elevator if possible Coffee maker, etc is available ( a must for me) but, much to my disappointment, there was no fridge. Also, there's a charge for the internet although it is free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting BU”
Reviews.Author: dundies
Reviews.Content: I booked my room online at a discounted rate and was so pleased! I had a corner room which was absolutely beautiful and well appointed. The staff was very friendly, and the location was great for shopping and visiting the BU medical campus. I walked everywhere. I'd love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: TrdThunder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! very clean plenty of elevators, staff is great and very attentive, right in the heart of boston, minutes away from boylston street, newbury street, fenway park, and other great boston attractions, This hotel is a great hotel for those coming into boston for tourism, as it puts you right in the heart of boston and within walking distance of everything! high floors are a must for a breath taking view of the city and cambridge! The place next door (Kings) is a bit expensive however they have great steak tips! and offer bowling, pool tables, and some arcades! Great for a classy night out in boston's nightlife!

Reviews.Title: “8/31-9/6/2009 North Eastern University - Daughter's College Trip”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiians3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay Hotel over the dates of August 31 through September 6, 2009 as our daughter was starting her freshman year of college at NEU. This hotel is centrally located to the "T" Green Line between the Prudential and Hynes stations, two blocks from the shopping and restaurant district on Newberry Street, three blocks from the NEU and BU campus' and about four or five blocks from Fenway Park. There is also a great wine store about a block away from the Hilton on Massachusetts Avenue! I made our hotel reservation at priceline.com with a bid of $71.00 for a three and a half star hotel in the Back Bay area of Boston (we were in Boston in April 2009 and we got the Marriott Copley for $71.00 on priceline). I checked another site, www.betterbidding.com and found another person that stayed over the same dates that we did at the Hilton paid just $64.00 on priceline. Unfortunately the Marriott Copley was at something like $120.00 per night over our dates. I called ahead to the Hilton and requested a high floor, corner room because the community on Trip Advisor advised that these rooms were a little larger and they were located away from the elevators and ice maker noise. The only problems we experienced were: 1. The carpet in the room didn't look dirty but when you walked barefoot or with socks on, your feet tuned black almost immediately. I called housekeeping and requested them to shampoo the main areas of the room and they complied the next morning! Make sure you leave a $2.00 tip for the housekeeper each morning and they will make certain you have plenty of bottled water, clean towels and extra bath amenities daily! 2. The thermostat in the guest rooms can't be adjusted by you (even though it looks like you can adjust the temperature from the thermostat), it can actually only be adjusted by the hotel maintenance manager from his computer. The first four nights, we felt like we were sleeping in a refrigerator. I let the front desk know about the problem each morning for the first four days in a row and the problem finally got taken care of on September 3rd. I was a little upset that we froze our butts off for the first four nights, but the front desk staff shut me up by giving me three coupons for a full American breakfast for the next two mornings. Some tips for you: 1. Wireless Internet access is $14.95 for each 24 hour period in your guest room but it is free in the lobby area. I went down to the lobby the first day to connect my laptop to the Hilton's free wireless service, I then left my laptop connected and took the elevator back up to my room. The WIFI service stayed connected for free! It will automatically disconnect every 24 hours, so you have to repeat this process daily. This saved me almost $90.00 over our 6 night stay! 2. Hilton Honors members (Gold or better) have access to a complimentary continental breakfast in the lobby restaurant. We called the waiter The breakfast Nazi because he seemed to be mad every day, but all in all, the breakfast was sufficient as it consisted of eggs of the day, fresh fruit, oatmeal, bagels, juice and coffee. 3. Parking is something like $37.00 per night. That's more than half of the cost that we paid for the guest room, so you are better off using public transportation if at all possible! 4. We purchased three, 7 day Charlie Cards for $15.00 each upon arrival at Logan Airport (ticket machines are at the baggage claim area). I read on Trip Advisor about how easy it was to take the "T" from the airport to the Hilton (take the free airport shuttle bus from the curb at baggage claim to the Blue Line inbound, Transfer to the Green Line at Government Center and then catch any Green Line B, C or D outbound to to the Hynes station and walk two blocks to the Hilton or take the Green Line E outbound and exit at Prudential station and walk through the mall to the Sheraton hotel, the Hilton is across the street from the Sheraton). We saved $40.00 to $45.00 on taxi fare from the airport and another $30.00 back to Logan when we departed and we used the "T" and the bus system to get around Boston for the entire week to shop and get to the North End. We also went to the New England Patriots game on Thursday night and we found (on Trip Advisor) that there is a special MBTA commuter train that will take you from the Back Bay station in Boston directly to Foxboro Stadium for just $12.00 per person, round trip. This is a great deal as the train only makes three other stops along the way and it only takes about 45 minutes to get from Boston to Foxboro Stadium. The train leaves the stadium for the return trip to Boston about 30 minutes after the conclusion of the game (you don't want to miss this return train as the stadium is in the middle of nowhere). 5. The North End area of Boston is full of great but over priced Italian restaurants. We found on our last trip to Boston that La Famiglia Giorgio's ([--] or www.lafamigliagiorgio.com) one block off of Hanover Street to be a great "family style" restaurant. The three of us shared a large Caesar salad, an order of steamed mussels, the daily special lasagna, my wife had a glass of wine and I had an Italian beer (this was enough to feed the three of us and have leftovers to take with us) and the check was under $70.00 including a 17% tip for the wait staff! We then walked over to Modern Pastry Shop on Hanover Street to pick up a few chocolate dipped, ricotta cheese filled cannolis for dessert. These are to die for and they are only about $3.50 or so each. Just remember that the cannolis at Modern are much better than Mike's Pastry Shop! 6. I went to restaurant.com and purchased a $50 restaurant certificate for Kingston Station located at 25 Kingston Street or call [--] (another Trip Advisor suggestion) for just $20.00. The stipulation is that you have to purchase at least $100 at the restaurant which is no problem if you have a glass of wine, share appetisers and an entree each. It worked out to be about a 30% discount once you added in the gratuity and the food and service were great! Make sure you try the truffle fries, They are awesome! You can take the Green Line and walk three blocks to the restaurant (sorry, I forgot the stop). Hope these tips help you to enjoy Boston on the cheap as much as we did... I'd also like to thank the entire Trip Advisor community for pointing us in the right direction and suggesting such great things to see and do while we were there. My only complaint is that we didn't have enough time to do everything we wanted!

Reviews.Title: “Not Good Value at all”
Reviews.Author: NoMierda
Reviews.Content: Through PriceLine we got a room at this hotel and even with the discounted rate through priceline this hotel did not provide good value. We were treated like third rate customers when we arrived because the hotel agent knew we recieved this hotel at a discounted rate. She was snobby towards us and we got the worst room in the hotel. It was on the 4th floor, right next to the ice machine and the housekeeping closet and through our window we had a view of the dumpster outside. Not to mention that the toilet did not flush properly. This hotel also nickels and dimes customers for everything. They charge $36/night for parking, $1.25/minute to use the phones in the room even if you are calling a local # or using a calling card and to use wireless internet they charge $14.95 for 24 hours. The worst part of all is that when we checked in, the agent did not even bother o tell us that they had 4 computers in the lobby that customers could use for free to access the internet. The only reason we found out about is that we saw people using them when we left the hotel. Had we known about it we would not have needed to pay the 14.95/month. On top of that, even though the internet in the lobby is free their computers use old versions of Inernet Explorer and it takes about 3 minutes for anything to load. The only positive thing I have to say about this hotel is that the beds are extremely comfortable and the air conditioning works really well. These are things many other hotels also have.. I would recommend any other hotel in the Back bay Area as the Hilton really disappoints!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: rand415
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hilton after reading several reviews online...and because we were going to be in town to catch the Red Sox/Yankees game and wanted to be close to Fenway. The location was just perfect - very close to the T, and a 15 minute walk from the ballpark. The hotel was clean, staff (particularly the concierge) was extremely helpful, and the rooms were spacious enough. I guess my one and only complain is the cost to park overnight in the garage. However, as you may read in many other reviews, this is very average for a parking garage in Boston. We stayed at a Marriott on another night over this same stay and their overnight cost was $42 (versus Hilton's $37). I would certainly recommend this hotel. Also, if anyone is traveling to Boston for the first time, I would recommend checking out the North End area - great restaurants and lots to do by Quincy Market.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: graybarn41
Reviews.Content: Had an upper floor view, but the elevator wait on Saturday was not pleasant. One elevator was out of service and there was a large wedding on the premises with guests staying in the hotel and a music camp at Berklee starting so many with musical instruments as well calling for the elevator. Room was nice, roomier than some, pillows and bedding comfortable. As an HHonors member, had a nice complimentary breakfast with fresh fruit. Parking was a bit scary as the garage was undergoing renovations, but I was able to leave the car all afternoon after checking out without an additional charge. At $37 a night, I was glad I got a little more value from the charge. Had a surprisingly low rate ($119.25) with a Visa card discount. Come on Hilton, time for free wireless, $14.95 was steep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad view (this time)”
Reviews.Author: moto_sgx
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay since I particularly like the location--very close to all the best sights in the city without being in the very dense civic quarters. I am pleased that the hotel has maintained its cleanliness and amenities and that the staff continue to be expedient and polite in a business-y (as opposed to familial) manner. I liked the pool and the jacuzzi, which were good to start the day or end one. I got a poor room this time compared to my previous visit though. As with the other poster, mine faced the parking garage next door and the aircon ducts below. If you were to stay in this hotel, don't go for the rooms between -04 and -08, if my memory serves me right since they are oriented to these views. Altogether still a commendable practical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed lack of parking & room bad view”
Reviews.Author: travel4uflorida
Reviews.Content: Parked on the top level, level seven and to walk to fifth level to get elevator to the lobby. No signs of where to get elevator. narrow spaces, dead end parking we had to back out on each level and search for an empty space. Dangerous backing out. Room had a terrible view of the a roof and the parking garage, I could almost see our car. We were near the pool somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best 4th of July Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: ssitravel08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this past 4th of July and it was simply awesome! The room was extremely clean and spacious. There was a huge flat screen TV and a full size desk/work station. The view from our room overlooked the city. The bathroom was a decent size and the shower was really good, especially the water pressure. The Hotel staff were very nice and very helpful when we needed to rent a 10 passenger van to take us where we needed to go. The location is great for shopping, you can just walk up and down the streets and find a lot of good shops. There was one ice cream place that I can't remember the name of but it was probably some of the best ice cream I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “An average Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: heatherinPhilly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Back Bay Hilton about 20 times since last Fall for business. I think I have stayed in every type of room they offer over that period of time. My favorite by far is the Deluxe rooms on the corners (rooms xx15 and xx16) - they are a bit small in size, but are removed from the main hallway, which helps with the hallway noise. That is my main issue with this hotel - it is VERY noisy. You hear everything in the hallways, your neighbors, and every toilet flushing and shower running. The rooms themselves are very clean and renovated - fantastic TVs and beds. However, all that being said, I still can't get over the noise. The location is fantastic, and my company has a corporate rate, so I have decided to just keep staying there instead of finding a less noisy alternative. The front desk and doormen are also fantastic, and the food at the restaurant is good as well. All in all - I would rate this hotel much higher if it wasn't for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: Very impressive Hilton. The location is great with easy access to all downtown landmarks as well as being right next door to the Sheraton and the Prudential shopping center. The room was quite nice with updated furnishings and a comfortable bed. The flatscreen TV complete with HD programming was very nice as well. Carpeting, furnishings and hallways were updated and very nice. Did not eat at the restaurant so cannot comment about that but there are literally hundreds of eateries and bars within a half mile of this location. Staff was friendly and professional at all times. This Hilton gets it done.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: SlovakTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and clean. Most friendly receptionist welcomed us and made our stay much better from the first minute. Rooms are very good size, bathroom is great. Location is also good, close to major attractions and not very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: kmh2301
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in order to be close to Fenway. The corner room offered a beautiful view of Boston & Cambridge & the Charles River. It was immaculate and the tv was huge :) We were able to walk to the Red Sox game. Please note that the parking rates are RIDICULOUS ($37), as they are in almost all Boston hotels, so if you have a car be prepared. However, we were able to find meter parking on the street for only a few dollars. Easy access to lots of restaurants, bars and shopping. Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pharma_researcher
Reviews.Content: This Hilton property is neither grand nor magnificent but features and excellent location close to the Prudential Center, the shops at Newbury Street and the green-line T-stop to everywhere. The breakfast buffet again is not magnificent but OK for the price. The swimming pool is very good. The room was OK, we got the river view with an extra 9 USD/day; room rates are fair. However, check the taxes that are charged on your bill (there was an article recently in the USA Today claiming that Hilton gives the final price on booking including taxes and extra charges)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: gleuny
Reviews.Content: We traveled on pleasure, not buisiness. I don't like being nickeled and dimed, however, this buisness hotel didn't do that. I'm a silver member and had two free night certificates, and was upgraded to a 25th floor corner room, with the hotel booked solid for a convention . . Only complaint came waiting for the elevevator, in the morning when biz folks were off to the show. But the view as worth the wait. However, this corner did not have the balcony. Slightly smaller than the other king beds, for more room get a double bed Nice pool, small out side deck. The whirpool , although small, packed a good power punch to work those muscle knotts out. The small gym was well equipment and 'sweat-smell free'.Great central location for getting around. we walked to everything. Boston common, fenway, Beacon Hill. And the subway is 5 blocks, far enough that the homeless are not at the hotel door, but not far enough to work up a sweat.The hhonors floor is 24, the gold room is nothing to rave about. I walked in and saw fresh fruit, coffee, and some dry goods. Far cry from the free breakfase at a hamption inn. You can cross the street and eat in Prudential center, or better yet, outside on newbury st. NO problems with staff. Front desk was fantastic. At 9pm I ran out of milk for my comp. in room coffee, and the manager opened the frig up at the starbucks which just closed. Then housekeeping appeared with more creamers and coffee. I would stay here again,if the price was right. And it seems more updated than the busy , croweded 5000 room Shereaton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “It served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: marine2531
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for a long weekend in April. Nothing spectacular, nothing to complain about. Our room was clean and very spacious. There was about 7 feet in between the end of the bed and desk. The staff seemed very friendly and concierge was very helpful. Close to Prudential, the T and some pretty decent food options. Only thing that was not cool was the $35 a night parking fee. But i do believe that's the average fee for hotel parking in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: travelmom61
Reviews.Content: This nice hotel is so convenient to the convention center, shopping at Prudential Center, the subway trains, Fenway Park, Symphony Hall and many other attractions of Boston. The staff was pleasant and the rooms clean. We have nothing negative to say about this hotel and were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ledox
Reviews.Content: a great hotel and great location for shopping and eating (close to Newbury st. and Boylston st.) Everything was clean and the service was great! ill come back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE FOR FENWAY PARK”
Reviews.Author: soxfaninfl
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Hilton Back Bay for the 2nd time and had another great experience. Perfect place to stay if you are attending Red Sox games- you can walk to the park in about 15 minutes. It is also close to the T for everything else you want to do. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Service not acceptable for a Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: Savarra
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Boston Back Bay Hilton for 1 night. The room and location were great but my checkin was miserable. The desk attendent couldn't find my reservation, and couldn't find my HHonors numbers to cross check the reservation. This was graduation weekend in Boston so finding another hotel would have been extremely difficult. I asked for a manager. He finally came over, told me the desk attendent had it all taken care of (he still hadn't found my reservation), and went back across the counter to continue chatting with one of the bellmen. I finally had to boot my computer and find the reservation email with the confirmation number. Then magically they found my reservation. This took approximately 30 minutes. On the way up to my room the bellman asked how my day was and I told him I was very unhappy with the incompetent checkin staff. I thought he might have relayed that message to the shift manager but if he did I didn't receive a call or contact of any kind. I also left a voicemail with the GM but haven't heard back and it's been a week now. For $400+ per night I expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hometown_Philly
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for one night at Hilton Back Bay. The hotel was perfect for our needs; beds were very comfortable, rooms were clean & quiet (14th floor) and the in-room coffee maker with take away cups a life-saver. Hilton accommodated our request for an early check-in, which we greatly appreciated. We came by train to Boston Back Bay station and walked everywhere we needed to be - including to and from the station. Extremely convenient. My first trip to Boston, but a winner all the way around. I'll be back.... : )

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Boston Back Bay - wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: BANJOJersey
Reviews.Content: We are seniors and travelled around America for four weeks. Boston was the last hotel on our itinerary. Landed in Boston at 8.30am, we were very tired but the Hilton gave us our room at 9.30am and we were able to catch up on sleep before starting our sightseeing. Our room was on 22nd floor, it was large and spotlessly clean. The bath towels were the biggest we got to use on our trip and the beds and bed linen were extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and we were able to get the local trolley bus right outside the door. The meal we had in the hotel restaurant was delicious and not too expensive. Boston is a delightful city. Joan - Jersey - Channel Islands - Britains

Reviews.Title: “Moslty a positive”
Reviews.Author: JPIowa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for four nights while attending a conference at the Haynes Convention Center. The location was great (just had to cross the street). The neighborhood has lots of restaurants and a mall across the street. The views from my room were great. Nice flat screen TV. Comfortable bed. Clean, quiet room. I did not need to interact with the staff very much, but they seemed efficient and polite. The only strange thing about an otherwise nice room was the bathtub. It seemed like they had put one of those plastic covers on top of it, and it was not well glued to the bottom, which gave the bathtub a motelish feel I did not expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Â«Value for MoneyÂ»”
Reviews.Author: Aguire
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with good staff. Internet was free - very good. Good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Catered for the needs”
Reviews.Author: Expect_quality_2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in February. Found very little to complain about. Greeting at reception was friendly and efficient and not over the top. Room was very clean and comfortable and found that everything worked as it should in the room. Only slight complaint was that it was a small bit noisy as the lift was near our bedroom. Room was kept very neat and tidy everyday that we were there. We didn't eat in the hotel or use the bar. We did use the Starbucks cafe that is in the lobby on occasions and service was good and friendly. The free use of Internet in the lobby was very useful. The hotel is well located being directly opposite from the Prudential Centre and very close to the "T" stop at Convention. Also is within walking distance of Boston Common, etc. There are a lot of good places for eating nearby to the hotel, we really enjoyed the lobster at Steve's Summer Shack just around the corner from the hotel. The hotel is nothing special, but very much caters for the needs of the ordinary holiday maker.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good sized room, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: LHRFlyer11
Reviews.Content: I am just coming to the end of my 4 night stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I booked the hotel with the knowledge that is is well located (I had previously stayed at the Sheraton across the street). The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the T (subway) stop at Prudential Center and this was handy as I had travelled from the airport by T. A tip - if it is wet when you arrive and your travelling to the Hilton by T, go through the Sheraton hotel as you can walk through the Prudential Center and into the Sheraton completely undercover. You then only have a walk across the street to the Hilton (cheeky, yes, but it will keep you dry!) I arrived around 2pm and check in was fast and welcoming. I had a deluxe room on the 25th floor. The room itself was a good size, with a king size bed which is very comfy and a huge flat screen TV with around 45 channels. There is also a desk and comfy chair. The bathroom is small, but adequate with a shower/bath. My shower head needed to be propped up with some tolietries, but was fine otherwise. There were a good array of amenities. Internet access (wireless) is $15 a day. I chose to eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant - 40 Dalton - on day one, as it was convenient to do this. Service was OK but I felt the cost was expensive relative to the food on offer - personally I was expecting more from a North Amercian hotel and I was therefore a little disappointed. I also thought the $6 for a jug of coffee was a bit much considering I was travelling alone! I ordered from room service a couple of nights - food was good but the service charges were astronomic - $4 tray charge plus 16.5% service charge plus 5.5% admin charge!! I used the fitness center and found this more than adequate - plenty of towels, a reasonable range of equipment (which seems quite new) and a pool and whirpool - nice after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is only a few minute walk from Newbury Street and from there it is a 10-15 minute to Downtown. So, all in all, my stay was OK, but I suppose I'm not feeling blown away by the hotel. Its just average in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what a Hilton should be.”
Reviews.Author: luv2eatout
Reviews.Content: I was on crutches when we stayed at this hotel. There was no hadicapped parking and we had to park outside on the roof. We had to walk down two ramps in the rain to get to the elevator only to find that it wasn't working on that floor. We were not allowed to drop off due to the $36.00 valet. When we complained to the front desk about the inconvenience they were very rude and unconcerned. This was so not the service we expected from a Hilton. We will NEVER stay at a Hilton hotel again. When we returned home I contacted the home offices and have yet to receive a response. Not even close to what customer service should be in a supposedly high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Great Location for exploring Boston and its shopping district.”
Reviews.Author: sabrinaa
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hilton from the 12th-14th march and enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is in a great location for shopping and exploring the main tourist attractions. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the staff were very pleasant. There is a Trolly tour of the city which you can hop on outside the hotel. Walking to the main area of Boston takes approximatley 15 min. I booked the hotel at a great price, Â£100/night.

Reviews.Title: “BoCo auditions”
Reviews.Author: LenaCamperlengo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an audition at Boston Conservatory. Very close for that purpose. Location was excellent- near BoCo, Berklee and Newbury Street and there is a way to get to the Pru Center through the Sherton directly across the street (thus minimizing our time in the biting cold wind in Feb). Staff was friendly and helpful. Tried to 'beat the system' and not order the pig out al you can eat breakfast, but ended up paying more for my small breakfast all due to the $8 a la catre coffee. Went with the $20 breakfast buffet the next day and just chalked the price up to traveling. We were offered an upgrade at check in and we paid a little bit more for the higher floor, flat screen TV, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that great.”
Reviews.Author: travelligmainers
Reviews.Content: Although we only paid $126 for the room with a King bed, we didnt realize we had to add the amenities to the cost. WiFi was $12.95 for the night and parking was $32 dollars. Doesnt that make the cost really more like $171.00?? I'm thinking I could have had a better room elsewhere for that price. The rooms iron was broken as well and it took 30 mins for a replacement to show up. Dont they check that kind of thing before renting the room? They should

Reviews.Title: “good business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderabout
Reviews.Content: The room we got on registering was not what we had reserved. After going to the room and calling the front desk about the discrepency, we were told that it had found the correct room type we had reserved but it was being cleaned and we would be called in 40 minutes when the room would be ready. We got no call for an hour which meant I had to go down to the front desk and ask for the room. We were given new key cards and had to move our luggage ourselves to the new room. NOT a good first impression. The new room, however, was exactly as promoted on the hotel's website and was large with comfortable bedding and all the amenities. Rest of our stay was uneventful and pleasant. This is a solid business class hotel in an excellent location immediately across the street from the Hynes Convention Center and the Prudential Center. It has an attractive pool (good for kids) and workout center.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy a clean hotel, with customer-savvy staff”
Reviews.Author: hitthehighway
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here - the staff is excellent, from the pleasant greetings when we arrived, to the perfect dinner suggestions from the front desk, to the bartender who took the time to entertain us with some fancy drink suggestions - we couldn't have asked for more! Hilton Hotels = Why stay some place else, when you can have it all!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton is just fine”
Reviews.Author: PennProf
Reviews.Content: Great Location with easy to park in attached garage, Quick on and off to the Turnpike. Standard "nice" Hilton, good free interent access and computers in lobby, expensive wifi in rooms. Got a great rate through priceline and have booked previously through Hotwire. Very close to Fenway Park for Red Sox Games. Better than Sheraton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hilton Back Bay (after a room mixup)”
Reviews.Author: narco37
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I scheduled a one night stay around Christmas time for a romantic getaway in the city. The rates were pretty decent so we booked a superior view deluxe room. We arrived and checked in, and our room was on the 25th floor. We went into the room, and the view was great, but it was not what was advertised in the hotel website. We requested a deluxe room, and this was a standard king room. The person at the desk told us that the type of room we requested were all being renovated on the top floors, but he could give us the room on a lower floor with a not so great view. Why he couldn't tell us this when we checked in, I don't know...did he think we wouldn't notice the difference? The deluxe room is alot larger, has a double headed shower, and a different layout, as advertised on their website. He personally showed us the room that we originally booked (minus the view), and offered it at a discounted rate and gave us breakfast vouchers and he apologized. That was a nice touch. That was our only problem, if you want to call it that. I don't think it was that big of a deal, but it was more the principle of booking something and not getting what you booked. The room was spacious, clean, and the bed was super comfortable. They have a huge flatscreen TV with lots of channels and a clock radio with an mp3 connection. It was extremely quiet. We took advantage of their gym, which is on the 7th floor and has updated cardio equipment, which have tv/radio hookups on them. It was very clean and we watched the sunset from the window. The pool/jacuzzi was closed so can't comment on that. The location is great. The hotel is in the center of everything and it's very close to the T. We got room service and they came very quickly and picked up the tray quickly as well. We had breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel, and it was pretty good, especially since it didn't cost anything. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would go again, but would probably book over the phone to make sure that there aren't any surprises when we get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: shorty822
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location (2 blocks from newbury) and pretty much attached to the prudential center and copley place. There are definetly a lot of things to do around the area. The T is also very close and convienent. The rooms are nice and clean, but nothing fancy. I was unable to use the pool, as it was closed when I was there, but it looked nice. Parking was expensive, but I think it's expensive in every hotel downtown. If I was to return, I would definetly consider this hotel again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stop in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Aksel
Reviews.Content: A good but just standard Hilton hotel, but with a great location in the middle of the shopping area with connection to two malls and also close to the Metro. No executive lounge, but a small separate Honors breakfast lounge. Did not try the restaurants, nor the fitnesscenter with pool. Location 8/10: Right in the middle of the city with easy access to everything. Its located between two metro stations, which is more modern then to match the rest of the city. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, museeums, etc.. Lobby/Check-in 6/10: Nothing special, but not bad neither. The greated me as an Honors member and had upgraded me according to my request, which was excellent. Two free internet computers by the lobby, which was good (Business center costed approx $12). Room 6/10: Big size room with a huge and comfortable king size beed. The view from the 29th floor facing Charles river and the Cambridge side was beautiful. There was a lounge chair to sit comfortable and relaxed in and just look at the huge, I think it was at least 40â€� LCD TV, which also had many HD-channels, so watching a football game in HD was amazing. It was a very cold stay for us, but the heather worked perfect A small closet with safety deposit box and a drawer. The negative were that the minibar had been taken out from all rooms. There is a coffe/espresso maker, which was very good, also with a take-out mug, which is a small plus. The bathroom was ok, with a tub. Restaurants 4/10: Did not try the restaurants, except the Honors breakfast lounge. A bigsize LCD tv, but no newspapers. The food was ok, typical American breakfast I would say; bagels, creamcheese, salmon, donoughts, muffins, etc.. Other: There is a fitness center and pool, but we did not try these. There is a garage that has direct access to the hotel, so we could park the rental quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Boston Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: snowangl1985
Reviews.Content: I have travled to Boston multiple times and this was by far one of the best stays I had there. The Hilton Back Bay is in a wonderful location, very close to almost anything you would want to get to. The hotel staff I encountered was friendly and helpful. I have worked in the hospitality industry for a few years now and I was very impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Members Beware”
Reviews.Author: sjatbeach
Reviews.Content: Folks, I stay 125+ nights a year in hotels .. below are my ratings for this property. 5 being the best rating. Diamond Member Accommodations (i.e. Lounge, Breakfast, etc) = 1; This may seem like a harsh rating but I think it is spot on. I have stayed at the Waldorf in NYC, who also doesnâ€™t have a Diamond Lounge. However for a mere price of $6, one may get an outstanding breakfast buffet. This location in comparison charges $20+ dollars. Some Hilton name brand properties even provide a free coupon to Gold and Diamond members. Lounge â€“ Not sure why they donâ€™t have a lounge, I requested that the GM provide feedback on this one. Room = 4 - Big screen TV and clean rooms Staff = 5 Gym / Pool Facilities = 5 Location = 3 - A short taxo to most BOS attractions

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, fancy hotel with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: GirlGenX
Reviews.Content: My husband is in Boston often for business, and I come with him most of the time, which means we stay in alot of hotels. When it comes to nicer business hotels, they are all pretty much the same with some differences here and there... but the Hilton Boston Back Bay stands out from the pack. The building is new and the decour and materials are all very sharp and high end. Everything looks shiny and new. The staff is exceptional ... helpful ... warm ... opening doors, holding the elevator, fulfilling requests promptly and always going the extra distance, even when you don't tip them. Everyone remember my name and my daughter's name and always went out of the way to make us feel welcome. The lobby is very modern and spacious with so many comfortable arm charis, wide screen TV, several complimentary computers with high speed internet, a Starbucks cafe and restaurant, and a semi-private lounge-nook right outside the restaurant that is perfect to work or study away from the hussle and bussle of the main lobby. The wi-fi is free in the lobby too. We stay twice for a week each time. On our first visit we had a superior king room (room 2318). The view was of the Prudential Center ... very nice. The room amenities were all top of the line. Modern decour, new everything. Very nice, though a bit limited in floor space. It's fine for one or two people, but we had our two year old with us, and it was a little tight. The second visit we were in the superior king corner suite with balcony (room 2205). It is very spacious and perfect for a little one to run around in! Excellent room, highly recommend you stay in this room (if you don't book one with a panoramic view, which won't have the balcony). The view was of the downtown, the Charles River, MIT across the water, and we could see Fenway Park from our Balcony and the window. It was a little bright during game nights, but the breeze off the water felt great. Sunrise through sunset and beyond, the view was fantastic. As the lighting changed, the mood of the view did. Something worth writing home about. The furniture, linens, toiletries and bathroom were all excellent quality and appearence. Marble top everything, flat wide screen TV, the works. The in room thermostat tells you the room temp as well as the outside temp (very helfpul when running out the door and needing to know if you should bring a jacket or not). The location is the best. Boylston is two blocks away, The Prudential Center mall is two blocks away ... Berklee School or Music and Christian Science Center (gorgeous to walk through and photograph) are two a half blocks away. Tons of great restaurants near by to choose from ... everything from Pizza to Seafood from Vietnamese to Indian from chain to authentic you can think of. There is a supermarket at the Prudential Center and a Trader Joe's across from the convention center. The restaurant in the hotel has delicious breakfast and the crab cakes are the best I've ever had! During out stay we got to know much of the staff by name, and it felt like good friends hosting us in a world-class guest room. Everything looked very clean and room service left the room spiffy clean each day. The chaise lounge and ergonomically designed desk chair were beyond comfortable. My daughter and I spent many hours lounging by the window watching the sail boats in the Charles River. There are two childrens' parks on West Newton, one and a half blocks past Huntington. You will see a Seven Eleven on the corner, then a laundry and dry cleaners, then you will see the sign for the first park on the right. It has stuff for 3-5 year olds and 5-11 year olds. If you cross at the cross walk on the left, and walk 1/2 block you will find an enclosed park with locked fences to keep the kids in that is perfect for babies and toddlers. I took my daughter almost every day. It's a great area to walk around. I've included pictures of the views from both rooms, as well as the bathroom, which has glass tiles on the accent wall above the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonamom
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hilton Back Bay. We were on the Hilton Honors floor. Our room had an unreal view, you could see all of Boston. It was amazing. The hotel is nice, its in close proximity to alot of attractions in Boston. The price of the rooms are very high though. We only stay there when we use spouses Hiltons Honors points. As was the case this past weekend, as it was son's college parents weekend, and the prices in Boston were through the roof. Nice hotel, would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrtr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed the location of the hotel, but encountered poor service, which we have never encountered at other Hilton Hotels, where we have stayed at in the U.S. Except for one young lady, who handled our check-in, the reception desk people were impolite and unfriendly. But the worst service came from the hotel's own concierge: She was condescending and downright rude to us, when we asked her information about the city tours. Naturally, we pledged never to return to this Hilton Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in boston but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights to see Boston...walking distance to 2 T stops and even Prudential center(mall shopping and grocery store) Had to pay 35 per day to park but i guess thats normal there..space is at a premium. Took trolley tour thru conceige desk $32.00 per 1st time in boston and lots of history to see lots of walking Didn;t get chance to use it but hotel had nice work out room and small pool...everything looked 1st class. 2 computers to use in lobby and even 2 in starbucks which is in lobby. no charge for use Paid almost 300 per night including parking but all good hotels seemed to be that or higher... Would stay here again..if i couldn't find as nice but cheaper. Beds were comfortable and room was very clean..1st class toiletries

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good position”
Reviews.Author: hantshawk
Reviews.Content: we stayed for three nights in september ,friendly staff ,comfortable rooms good position , we had breakfast on one occasion although very good it was cheaper to pop over the road to the Prudential center where there is plenty of choice. Next door there is a superb fish resturaunt which serve the best oysters in boston.Its easy to walk to the sights and the shops.we would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location.”
Reviews.Author: SteveBishop.
Reviews.Content: This is a well positioned hotel. Whilst there we walked everywhere and if it was a little to far to walk, the hotel is handy to two subway (theT) stations. Rooms are clean and comfortable and we had ample storage. Unlike many hotels, the in room safe was big enough for our laptop. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful and the girl in the bar was a real star whilst we were there. The exception being, while we were there, the staff in the breakfast room. The first couple of days they were first class, but then we seemed to get a different couple of girls serve us and they were uninterested and one time we had to ask for our coffee four times before it arrived. They were the exception though and we just stopped having breakfast in the hotel, so it didn't spoil our stay. We did have dinner there one night as well, and they were great as well. We walked to Fenway Park to see the Redsox so if you want to take in a game, then this place is idealy placed. Shopping in the Prudential Center is just across the road and the bars and restaurants on Boylston Street are only a block or so away. We stayed in Boston for a week and didn't bother hiring a car, as much as I love driving in the States, it would have been a waste of money. The 'T' is fast, safe, cheap and frequent and if you buy a pass it is also valid on the 'T' buses as well giving great value. Give public transport ago. In Boston it is fine and the best way to get around. Having said that, if you do use public transport to go to Plymouth, then be warned. There are only a few trains a day and the station at Plymouth is two miles form the seafront, so either get a cab to the front or be prepaired for a hike! Plymouth is a nice and pleasant day out with plenty of historic things to see and do. Especailly nice are the crew on the Mayflower. They are dressed in period costume and will answer your questions in the language that they used at the time. We would recommend 'Isaac's' for lunch. wonderful service, views and food. Whilst in Boston, another must do are the Duck tours. Great fun and very informative. Just through the Prudential Center from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: julieturner
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel. We were on the top floor (albeit not the room i had booked) The room was huge though, with a flat screen tv and comfy beds. The hotel lobby has 2 computers for guests to use for free.The hotel has a very good swimming pool/gym but there is a nice outdoor area (didnt find this til the last day!!) from the gym area it hasnt got a view it looks out onto carparks etc but its got artificial grass with sun loungers and tables and chairs a nice little suntrap. It is well placed for Newbury St and the Prudential shopping and the famous Duck Tours. You can see Fenway Park from the hotel too. But Boston is an 'easy walking city' anyway so getting about from this hotel is easy. Our teenage boys enjoyed this hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre breakfast, tiny bathrooms, better rooms decent”
Reviews.Author: Califdavid
Reviews.Content: I had what the hotel calls a corner deluxe superior room with a small balcony from which if you craned your neck you could see the harbor. The room itself wasn't bad (had a small sofa) although the bathroom was barely bigger than a phone booth. The staff at the hotel was excellent. At this property Diamonds are offered breakfast in the "Diamond Lounge." The "Diamond Lounge" is a room that is only open for breakfast. It doesn't have any of the normal things you would expect in an executive lounge such as comfortable chairs for relaxing or reading material. The continental breakfast offered is not as good as what you get at your average Hampton Inn. If you want to eat in the restaurant your coupon allows you to have the full buffet for $15.50 plus tax and tip rather than the usual price of $21. I was told the hotel previously offered the full buffet to Diamonds but Hilton corporate told the hotel they were being too generous to their Diamond guests. Although I attempted to chat with the hotel's general manager about their policy toward their Diamond guests, I was unable to get any response.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: ray2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hilton 8/3-8/5 and were happy with the hotel. We stayed in a wheelchair accessible room which worked out well for us because the built in chair in the shower was perfect for bathing our 2 month old. I would stay there again Likes: 1. Computers with free internet access in the lobby 2. Close proximity to the Prudential T stop 3. Clean rooms 4. Great view of the Charles River and Fenway Park 5. Comfortable beds 6. Price ($139/night) Dislikes: 1. Smoke smell in room 2. Expensive parking $35/night (cheaper than the Sheraton across the street)

Reviews.Title: “god hotel but unfotunately we were on a smoking floor”
Reviews.Author: elizabethDorking
Reviews.Content: a very nice hotel with large attractive rooms and very comfortable beds but unfortunately the first night of our stay was marred by being in smoking rooms. I had booked non smoking but apparently these are not guaranteed. The hotel could not change our booking until the next day. Other than this the stay was excellent The eighth floor is definitely smoking - not sure how many more! 21st floor isn't - and has fabulous views

Reviews.Title: “Beware of getting into the bathtub!”
Reviews.Author: dahlia8
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was lovely the bathtub is dangerously slippery! We had 3 rooms and everyone slipped getting into the tub. I slipped and fell bruising my leg and hitting my head. Fortunately no bones were broken but my bruises are extensive. There are no anti-slip pads, mats or handles in the tub. There was no manager on duty but I did file a report with the head of security and sent an e-mail to the manager. I would be interested to see if the Hilton fixes this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: PatrickP
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip to the USA in July to escape New Zealandâ€™s cold winter, weâ€™d gone online and searched for a hotel in Boston that not only had good facilities (and more importantly a swimming pool) but which was also close to the city centre. On Paper the Boston Hilton ticked all the right boxes â€“ Unfortunately as much as we wanted to like the Hilton Back Bay, it continuously fell well short of our expectations. We really wanted to like this hotel, our room was nice, the foyer was nice, but ultimately it was let down by inept maintenance and shonky service. Visiting Boston in July meant it was extremely hot and most days weâ€™d head back to the hotel looking forward to a swim in the Hiltonâ€™s pool.
