Unfortunately for most of our stay, the pool was closed for emergency maintenance, only being open for one day. Staff at the front desk blamed the contractors maintaining the pool and although they offered us free dinner or breakfast, the lack of a pool, really did put a negative on our stay at the Hilton. If that had been the only issue weâ€™d have been slightly annoyed but things however didnâ€™t get better from there. Our room also had a 36â€� LCD TV with many HD TV channels. What could have been the Hiltonâ€™s saving grace turned out to be a fizzer as most of these channels barely worked, with the TV showing a â€œNo Signal Messageâ€� more often than a picture. Adding further insult to injury, the free wifi was available in the Hilton's foyer, whilst for some bizarre reason they opted to charge an astonishing US$12 per day for access to the very same wireless in guest rooms. Having stayed in numerous hotels during the month we spent in the USA, the Hilton seemed to be the only hotel that we had any major problems with. If smaller hotels can properly maintain their pools, provide free Wifi and have TVs that work why can't a multinational chain like the Hilton get it right??? With retail room rates for the Hilton Back Bay starting at about US$400 per night, the gap between what is being charged and what is being delivered is simply too big to justify staying there when other hotels seem to be able to deliver significantly more value for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Back Bay Hilton for 2 nights as we had tickets to Fenway. Loved the hotel and especially the staff. From Mark at the valet parking to the lovely lady at reception with the great looking nails. Every one seems to love their jobs and their city. The location is wonderful for a first time visitor and finding PF Changs & Cheesecake Factory around the corner was a treat. Our room was spacious but did have to get an extra bed as the beds are narrow. Breakfast was confusing to me, get the bacon, sausage from the buffet station & order two eggs. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: hawkdoc06
Reviews.Content: We arrived here early in the day but were warmly greated by the front desk staff and allowed to check in several hours early. Our room was very spacious with a nice flat screen, HD TV, well-stocked mini-bar and robes. The bed was dreamy, the linens were luxurious. We ordered room service one day and the service was impeccable, delivered on time and the food was exceptional. The pool area and workout room is very nice. Workout facility was nicer than in most hotels. Great location. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MTEES
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire.com and were thrilled with the selection. The room was totally renovated, very spacious and clean. Although our arrival was early and our room wasn't ready, the Hilton took our luggage and called us when the room was available. The location was great with two T stops close by and the Prudential Center right across the street. We could easily walk to Newbury Street for a variety of restaurant selections. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: katybish
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for an overnight in Boston. We had Red Sox tickets, so we wanted to be in walking distance of Fenway. We arrived at 1, 2 hours before check in, because we wanted to get into Fenway before the game. Our room wasn't ready yet, but Omar at the front desk saw our dismay, and found us a room right away. The service was great. The room was very comfortable, the bed as well, and overall, we had a very pleasant stay. The location was great, with the Prudential Center and Fenway all within walking distance. Although we didn't use it, the pool and fitness center looked very nice. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel..”
Reviews.Author: McKRy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there this past Saturday night. The hotel is renovated so it is very clean! The rooms were nice, but my only complaint was that the walls do seem to be thin. The people in the room next door came in at 2:30 am and I could hear them in the bathroom, toilet flush etc. Also, I could constantly hear the elevator going up and down all night which was very annoying. Not sure if I am super sensitive to noise as I do not see any other complaints about this. We got a gret price, so it was hard to complain. The staff was very nice at check in. We had breakfast at the hotel (just ok), nothing fancy at the buffet. But once again, staff was extremely nice. Also, great location close to shopping, restaurants and the T.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerNY
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed our stay at this hotel in April....they are finishing up a renovation and only the lobby lounge was not complete during our stay...the pool and fitness center and outdoor sun deck are great. The location is convenient for tourism with the Prudential Center right next door with many dining options, plus trolley and duck tours are available right outside the door and around the corner. The hotel has funny angles and request one of the corner rooms that opens up with more space than a standard room. We drove everywhere we wanted to visit and generally found parking easy except in the North End by the Old North Church. Tourist tip - there is a parking deck right under the Boston Common and real ease of use to get to the swan boats and public gardens. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: TheScheduler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Boston Marathon. Even though the hotel was overflowing with guests, the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our room, while small, was very nicely renovated. I'm not a huge fan of Hiltons, but this one has won me over. The location was great for sightseeing, although not so convenient to the marathon finish line. Still, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, fine hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Haddock_99
Reviews.Content: PROS: Location, newly renovated rooms (still in progress), great Hotwire rate, free Internet kiosk with printer CONS: Renovation still in progress Booked a weekend here on a great Hotwire rate (70% off the Hilton website rate). Having read some of the reviews here, I was a bit unsure about the hotel. I was, however, pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in the midst of a renovation. We were assigned to the 24th Hilton Honors floor with a newly renovated room. 50" flat-screen HDTV, nice new furnishings, comforters on the bed (I hate bedspreads!). Everything was clean and the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Bonus: a free computer and printer with Internet access on the 2nd floor. Great for printing out boarding passes. The location is great. Just a short walk from the T, the Shops at the Prudential Center, and shopping on Newbury St. The lobby was somewhat torn up for renovation but they promise to be finished by May 2008. All in all, really pleased with this Hilton. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Seemonkey
Reviews.Content: Situated 2 minute walk from Pudential " T " station, by a $15 weekly travel pass and take public transport its cheaper and surprisingly easy ( as opposed to $30 taxi) hotel is under renovation a the moment, but that doesn't get in the way of the experience, the only real issue id the paper thin walls, but the room does have flat screen TV's , ans a great view over Back Bay. The Prudential Centre/ CopleyPlaza and Newbury & Boylston street, are literally on the doorstep, so great food, cheap shopping and a brilliant talking tour around Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great Area”
Reviews.Author: emmie_newyork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel restuarant and lobby area are under rennovation so it wasnt looking its best. We had just stayed at the Plamer House Hilton in chicago which this hotel is not in the same class as. However the rooms were spacious and very clean. The location is what i was really pleased with about the hotel - within a short walk there are lots and lots of very nice bars, shops and excellant restuarants. I would def stay here again as i think downsatirs will be looking a lot better soon and the brilliant location was excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room but loud!”
Reviews.Author: DetroitDM
Reviews.Content: Pros: Room was nicely furnished-better than expected. Decent size, modern and updated. Decent location-any further from downtown would be too far. Near T-stop, prudential center/mall etc. Friendly staff. Cons: Noisy! Loud! Very, very thin walls. Can hear toilets flushing on other floors! Phones ringing, t.v.'s, vacuuming in other rooms! Half of the hotel was under construction- began very early every morning. The thermostat in our room didn't work. Ice machine broken or empty on at least 3 different floors. No fridge. No fan.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate, polite staff”
Reviews.Author: metroburns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 2008 for 2 nights. Room was large and well cleaned. Bed particularly comfotable and the room service meal was one of the best we have had. My only gripe is that while we were there they were booking guests in at half what we paid for an advance reservation, not really on when you are a regular and HHonors member

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: suebhon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Back Bay with my husband and two children for a 3 night trip to Boston during the February school vacation. I got a great deal of $106 per night on Hotwire and for this price it was a steal. The room was pleasant with a nice open view. Small bathroom, but clean. Comfortable beds. The pool and hot tub were great amenities with the kids and the fitness center was nice. We were given breakfast vouchers for one morning when we had issues with the room temperature. Overall, staff was friendly and helpful and the location was convenient to the T and to shops/restaurants. I would stay here again--especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great buy, right near the Prudential Building!”
Reviews.Author: ABonVoyage
Reviews.Content: As always, this hotel is great for it's price. It is clean, has nice toiletries, a nice gym with pool, and if you are lucky, a great view of the Charles! The decor is a bit boring, but it's clean and the staff are also friendly. It has a good location right across from the Prudential Building. It is also quiet. Nothing outstanding, but very nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience -- No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Cheffreygo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Boston (from Kansas City) because I was slated to be in Boston for a conference and because her birthday was the same weekend we decided to fly out a few days early. We booked this hotel on Hotwire for around $135/night for two nights. The hotel itself was in a nice area. The Sheraton just across the street is connected to two large malls via walkways and there is plenty of dining. The hotel is also right beside The Church of Christ Science's headquarters and Berklee College of Music. The lobby and restaurant seemed to be a little old-school, yet still elegant and welcoming. Upon arrival the staff was very kind. The doorman asked us if we had eaten and when we told him we hadn't, he offered his advice on good eateries within walking distance. The front desk staff was very polite and asked what our occasion for staying was. When we told them that my wife's birthday was the following day they gave us breakfast vouchers, which was much appreciated. Our room itself was nice. It was nothing spectacular, but we had no complaints. The panoramic window along the full length of the room was a nice touch -- especially since our room overlooked some beautiful architecture. The free breakfast buffet was good and had a large variety of options. We ordered room service our first night in and each just had some Spinach & Artichoke Dip along with a Caesar Salad. All in all, I would stay here again at the right price, but I would probably rather stay in the Sheraton across the street or a different hotel in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “So So Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbear14
Reviews.Content: The facility itself is one of those poor sisters built in the 70s -- nondescript concrete. The lobby and rooms are pleasantly appointed and of decent size, no argument with amenities. The staff was friendly and competent. The room service, however, was abysmal. Breakfast, particularly, was a great disappointment. Overall impression: So - so. This hotelâ€™s main claim to fame is a very convenient proximity to the convention center. You can do much worse, but for a somewhat upscale chain, this branch is a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hilton, Above Average Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: RichardofAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bay Back Hilton while attending a conference in 2005. I've stayed at other Hilton's around the country and this one easily met their standards. Those standards being good service, good clean rooms, and a nice building with good facilities. That's how most Hilton's are: Good. This one was no exception. I stayed on one of the upper floors in a room with two double beds. It was average sized and very comfortable with a nice desk and desk chair and comfortable sitting chairs. My view was nothing special, but I think it's unfair to cut a hotel to pieces in a review over their view (unless you personally requested a room with a view), as it is often something that they don't have much control over. As for the location, it's very central to to the city. The Heinz convention center (where my convention was convening) is a short walk away and this is very nice, especially if the weather is bad, which it was while I was theret. There are a few good restaurants around and a very, very upscale mall in the area which was fun to wander around. The doormen are very knowledgable about the area and about transportation and always greeted me warmly when I left or returned to the hotel. Little things like that get big marks in my book, because it is often that one smiling face or that one extra helpful person you remember from a stay at a hotel. The one thing that exceeded my expectations was the restaurant. It's called Boodles, which is a funny name for a restaurant, but they can get away with it because I had one of the best meals of my life there. It's very classy and my waitress treated me like a VIP. The food came in courses and each one was better than the last. I have heard that this establishment has gone down hill since my stay there, so you might want to read some other, more recent reviews, but I have nothing but good things to say about it. Just make sure that you bring a big appetite to Boodles, because your not going to feel hungry for a day afterwards you'll be so full. I also ate lunch in the hotel's lounge/restaurant a few times and it is very, very good. So, there you have it. A solid, average Hilton, with an exceptional restaurant. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Boston Back Bay very nice”
Reviews.Author: linguica
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We have stayed at the Westin Copley Place several times but decided to make a change. The room was smaller in size but very clean with comfortable beds and pillows. Bedding was new and clean also. Very nice and helpful staff. Location very good if going to the Prudential Center Mall and shops - just cross the street. A little farther to walk to Newbury St. and Copley area than the Westin. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NEtraveler07
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for a stay in Boston to do some shopping and to get into the Christmas Spirit. The locale is great, a block off Boylston St. and not too far from Newbury St. shops. Also the Prudential mall is across the street, a great feature for winter shopping, though it does close early on weekdays. The staff at check in was very pleasant. The beds were just ok. No special down comforter as is found in most hotels today. The temperature control for the room was not very reliable. The tv was old school, but had a good variety of channels including HBO. Parking overnight will cost you at least $36 in the nearby garage, a bit more for valet. There is free access to one of two pc's in the lobby for checking email etc. We ran away from the restaurant on site - way too many nicer options to waste a meal there. Hotel was just OK, but locale is desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PigeonCove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at this hotel four or five times a year. The rooms are comfortable, the prices reasonable and the staff is friendly and helpful from the doorman, to the front desk, to the restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Could be improved”
Reviews.Author: NashuaNH
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed one night so we could see the Boston Pops Christmas concert. We arrived early and a room was ready, but not the one we specially asked for. We had asked for a corner room with floor to ceiling windows of the city. We got a room with a view of the rooftop of the neighboring Sheraton. No nice windows, no nice view. We decided not to talk to the desk about it and move on, now I wish we had. This Hilton has no members lounge for carded members, so there is no complimentary breakfast or cocktails. The two business stations in the lobby are free to use, but Internet in the rooms, and any additional channels (even music) are charged. When we checked out the next day, the bill for room charges was 20 extra than what we had on our reservation. I brought down the original reservation and it took some time for the front desk to straighten it out. They kept correcting the bill but adding charges, so it was frustrating. They werent very apologetic about it, I felt like I was bothering them. That is why I wish now I had complained about the room because it was out wedding anniversary and had made special requests. I would try the Sheraton or Colonnade next time and compare services. They are all in the same place. Other Hiltons in the area have so much to offer and I think this one is just older and doesnt have the same. So in comparison, you may be disappointed. I was.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Back Bay Hilton”
Reviews.Author: beachloverok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Back Bay Hilton the 3rd week of November for 5 days. The room size was large, the beds ultra-comfy, and the bathroom was spotless. I had friends staying at the Sheraton and had experienced the chaos and noise over there, so it was a pleasure coming back to my quiet hotel lobby. The location was great. Two blocks over to Newbury and Boylston for shopping, across the street from Prudential Center Mall and Copley mall, trolley stop in front of the hotel and a quick cab ride to the beginning of the Freedom Trail.( If it weren't so cold outside we would've walked there.) I saw many of the hotels, (for curiousity's sake), and will choose the Back Bay Hilton again when I come to Boston. Walls are a bit thin, but the beds are comfy enough to make you forget that. There is a giant Shaw's a block away so you can bring soda's and snacks back to the room.The Legal Seafood restaurant in the Prudential Center is fabulous....also, try SkipJack's Restaurant...a few blocks away. Choose this hotel for the relaxing lobby, the friendly staff, the large rooms and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Adam R
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here during a trip to meet with some colleagues in Boston and found the location was superb (lots of great shopping, restaurants, sights in the area) and that the room was a cut above most others (and certainly above most others in the Hilton chain). The bed was extremely comfortable; the room was stylish and spacious; the staff were friendly and helpful - I would definitely recommend this hotel to others - stay here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: PAM_from_LINY
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because there was a shortage of rooms in Boston this particular evening and I was visiting a relative in a hospital. I had reserved a king bed and was told that had been given to someone else, so I got a room with 2 full beds. Not a problem. After ordering room service for dinner, I went to bed as I'd traveled all day and had been at the hospital. The TV which I wanted to watch in bed, was not working. I called Front Desk but didn't want anyone to come up at 11pm to check the TV, so I turned in. I was asked if I wanted the key to the mini refrigerator, which I accepted. The key didn't work. The bathroom overall was fairly clean, with the exception of moldy silcone around the basin and some "personal hair" (not from anyone's head) in the sink and toilet. The carpet in the room looked really dirty--I wore socks. The internet connection cost around $13.00 per day. Fortunately I was there for only one day. I got lost on my way in and when I called, whomever answered didn't seem familiar with Boston at all. For what I needed--a place to sleep after a stressful day--it fit the bill. I'm glad I was not there on leisure because I would have felt ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if need to be by the Hynes Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the â€œback bayâ€� area of Boston â€¦ towards the south side. It is not in the immediate downtown area but is right across the street from the Hynes convention center and a large mall. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, as well as other major hotels like Sheraton, Marriott, Westin and others. The Hotel â€“ the interior of the hotel is nice but nothing fancy. No extravagant lobby or sitting area. The elevators appear to be designed to have at least one unused elevator at the lobby. Check-in was quick and staff was courteous. There is a bellman at the entrance most of the time. The hotel is kept in good shape and the hallways are clean. Did not use the pool or workout facility. The Rooms â€“ nice, and fairly large for a big-city hotel. As usual, the Hilton beds are among the most comfortable. Bathroom is small but efficient. Room was generally clean but found a few stray hairs in the bathroom. TV was not HD. Good views from the upper floors. The Restaurant â€“ had breakfast at their restaurant Boodles. The buffet was decent and the dining room quaint. There is really not a good bar at this hotel but you can walk across to the Sheraton and find a nice lobby lounge or at one of the area restaurants. If you are spending time by the Hynes convention center, this is good choice of hotels but there are others with better lounge & restaurant areas. NOTE: make sure you tell the cab driver the â€œBack Bay Hilton by the Hynes center on Daltonâ€�. Just said the â€œBack Bay Hiltonâ€� and got dropped off at the Boston Hilton â€¦ which is more downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ezzie3
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate through Hotwire. Room was smoking and we got two double beds instead of a king, but more than worth the money, and the faint cigarette odor wasn't very bad at all. Right in the middle of everything in Boston. Great access to restaurants and historical sites. My girlfriend left her necklace there, and they were nice enough to overnight it to us for free. Thanks Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and river views”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Jill-from-NH
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to use Hilton HHonors points for a free room at the Hilton Back Bay. Upon check-in with a courteous front desk attendant we were upgraded to a corner room on the 18th floor with balcony and view of the Charles River. This room was spacious, quiet, and clean, and I definitely enjoyed the view. (Note that the upgrade was based on the fact that I am a Hilton HHonors Gold Card member. I have found that Hilton is very good about rewarding loyalty with both airline miles, Hilton HHonors points for free stays, and with free upgrades/breakfasts/access to concierge lounges, etc.) The breakfast buffet the next morning featured a reasonable variety: tomato quiche and smoked salmon were present in addition to the usual scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, potatoes, oatmeal, fruit, cereal, and yogurt. The sweetbreads selection was very nice, including scones, chocolate brioche, apple pound cake, and caramel-pecan roles. Service was acceptable but not great: we received tea and juice promptly but no one checked back to see if we needed more tea and they were slow to collect empty plates. This seems to be a small property: there are only 18 rooms on each floor of the tower, no sundries/gift shop, and only one restaurant choice. It is just across a narrow street, however, from the Sheraton, which has a Starbucks and other restaurant choices in addition to a passageway from the lobby to the shops, food court, restaurants, viewing platform, and mass transit station in the Prudential Center. Thus from the Hilton it is very easy to access the top of the Prudential tower for fantastic views, great food at Legal Seafoods, books at Barnes and Nobles, high-end goods at Saks Fifth Avenue, etc.--as well as the rest of Boston via the "T" (mass transit system).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Sucal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the start of a New England holiday in Sept 2005. The hotel is in a great location adjacent to an excellent shopping centre and subway station. There are several restaurants within the shopping centre and many a short walk away. The room was furnished to a high standard and the staff were all friendly and professional. Couldn't fault the hotel or the price, the Sheraton across the road asks twice the price and is full of Conference delegates. It was also in an ideal position for driving a hire car out of town as there was no need to transverse the centre of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Felt More Holiday Inn Than Hilton!!!!”
Reviews.Author: p-m1
Reviews.Content: There are 2 Hiltons in the central Boston area. Last year, we stayed at the Hilton in the Financial District. It was great and only walking distance to Quincy Market etc. No pool though. This year we thought that we would try Back Bay and again opted for a Hilton primarily to experience another area of Boston and to benefit from the indoor pool. Although the staff were very friendly, the hotel was rundown and jaded. Certainly not what we would have expected from Hilton. The cleaning staff also did not have that much attention to detail! As for the pool, it was okay but nothing special. No Hilton Executive Room either which was something that we missed. We did like the Back Bay area though and there were lot's of attractions in that area. We particularly enjoyed walking all the way to Harvard Square and back! We do like staying with the Hilton chain but would not use this one again. The Hilton in the Financial District is a much better option. If you want Back Bay, from our brief observations, The Lenox looked good.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay but but 2 flaws”
Reviews.Author: maniakman
Reviews.Content: Location is close to ideal: Across the street to the Prudential Center entrance (via Sheraton) and a short walk to Hynes Convention Center Subway station as well as an even shorter walk to Newbury Street with all its Restaurants and Specialty stores. Lobby is somewhat small but all common areas were clean and updated. Service was friendly and professional. Two free computer terminals are available in the lobby for brief internet access and boarding pass printing. Rooms were clean, updated and our kingsize bedroom size was acceptable. Bathrooms are a bit small but updated and clean. No complaints about the Roomservice. Wireless internet access is available for $13/24hrs. Pod-style coffee machines and ceramic mugs were very welcomed. Now for two somewhat serious detractors which might have to do with the location of our room ( 7th floor on the south side, room 713) 1. you can constantly hear the elevators skating up and down. The sound seems to reverberate through the room, -- not loud at all, but still noticeable. I suspect that the rooms to the north side might have less of this problem since they are not adjacent to the back wall of the elevators. Perhaps even rooms further up would experience less of this noise. 2. somehow cigarette smoke was occasionally coming into the room through the bathroom vent . It was not visible, but it was definitely very noticeable. We could not determine if the adjacent room neighbor was smoking in his/her bathroom or if it was coming from the 8th floor which apparently is the smoking floor. There was no active exhaust action happening in the vent from what I could tell, rather, air was coming into the bathroom from the vent. Either way, the bathroom venting seemed inadequate to keep this from being rather annoying. Again, perhaps rooms on higher floors would not have this issue due to the greater distance from the smoking floor. Without these two items, I would have definitely rated this hotel above average.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: The_Crofter
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Hilton for four nights at the end of July. We paid for the upgraded corner room but couldnt see a difference from the standard room apart from a bit more space. The room was clean and comfortable, with a small balcony that you could manouvre a chair out onto at a push. The swimming pool and gym were fine nice to have a quick dip after a long day sight seeing. Used the bar but not the breakfast room which seemed to be overpriced. Overall it was a good experience and we would stop again if in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but felt a little deceived”
Reviews.Author: Lavallee5
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for a 2 night stay in August 2007 on Priceline....$159 a night!!! Then I get my bill and I was charged $39 a day for parking. I felt this was a little excessive, but idk...seemed they jacked my bill up with that.......also the pool was awful. No steps for little ones, very small and in a air tight room where the chlorine smell knocked us down! If you are loooking for a nice pool for little ones, check the Sheraton across the street.........pool was a lot bigger and had a sliding roof which opened to let the sun in. Looked fabulous from our room window.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 night getaway. After being quoted a room rate over $400 for a hotel downtown, I was ecstatic to get a room here for $168! The hotel and room were immaculate--all appeared to be recently renovated. There was a large, flat panel TV in the room! The bed was SO comfortable with a plush comforter and down pillows. Only distraction was the stained room carpet. Nice indoor pool and exercise room. Staff was mostly friendly and efficient except for the young, blond lady (her name begins with an "M") at the front desk. Hotel is only about 2 blocks from 2 "T" (subway) stops--very easy to get around Boston. But the trains are short and crowded at all times. A lot of reasonable little restaurants in area due to a local music college.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abbear
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Back Bay is a great hotel. We went for a short weekend trip and it is centrally located to Newbury Street and Boylston. Easy to get to shops and restaurants and also not far from the airport. The hotel room was very nice. The pool and exercise room were in above average condition. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it if you have to pay full price”
Reviews.Author: stixy386
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Back Bay is an average hotel with high prices. We booked a Corner King Deluxe Room for 258/night. I booked through the hotel b/c I wanted to make sure we received a corner room b/c the view was important. For $258/night the view was the only thing we got. The King bed was not very comfortable and the room was musty. The bathroom was very very small. The view was great but was not worth it. We could have stayed at the Sheraton and gotten the same view and a much better room. We didn't have any problems with the staff, in fact they were very helpful. The bathroom towels were very rough, sounds picky, but when it actually hurts to dry yourself off there is a problem. I had breakfast at the buffet one morning, an average buffet, and it cost $50 for two people. Next time we visit Boston we will most likely be staying in the Marriot where at least we know they have excellent beds. Would never stay at an overpriced Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rook3rs
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be an excellent choice for the various activities in Boston. Our upgraded room (Diamond HHonors) was of a good size, clean, and well furbished. I had checked in by internet the previous day and selected our room so the check-in time was only a few seconds. The buffet breakfast had a reasonable choice and the bar food in the evening had an adequate selection - both had good food. The staff throughout were good and helpful. It is well worth buying a bus/T train 7-day ticket even if only staying 4 or 5 days to allow travel throughout the area. We travelled to Harvard, all over the city, and the JFK library. The latter is excellent and can take several hours to cover - take the free guided tour first and then wander back round.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jcb_sandiego
Reviews.Content: The Back Bay Hilton was a lovely surprise. Modern - granite in the bathrooms, very clean, very spacious rooms. We had a 2 double room for my husband and I and our two small kids and there was plenty of room to operate. The rooms have a mini-bar refrig, and great in room coffee with pods, real cups and take-out cups if you are dashing out the door. The view was excellent - we were on the 18th floor and had a city view. From the hallway we could see that a river view room would be terrific, too. The room had amazing temperature control - quiet quiet quiet, yet could control temp very well - even told you the outside temp at the push of a button! The staff was very helpful. The bell captain knew our names the first day and was cheerful and seemed like he was checking in on us as we came and went - you just don't get that kind of greeting and service around anymore! He was a treat. The concierge was helpful in getting us some last minute Duck Boat tickets (which you've gotta do - even if you know Boston - it's great fun!) and making other recommendations for the area. We'd stay there again in a second and would highly recommend it. Great location - you walk out the door and into the Sheraton which is connected to the Prudential shopping area, etc. You can walk through all of that to the other side of the Pru and be at Copley square. Just an aside, the Fenway Park tour wasn't worth it -- they walked us around three different sections of seats, told some history, and asked us how we liked the view from Section whatever... no walking on the outfield/warning track, no seeing the inside of the scoreboard. For a family, it was expensive and I could have seen the same view during batting practice of a game for no additional cost!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnjunk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there last night, and it was a horrible customer service experience. They have Kiosks to check in in the lobby but they didn't work, one half-worked but you still need a plastic card that you have to wait on line for, so the kiosks are essentially useless. (We guessed that the desk workers do this on purpose to save their jobs instead of the kiosks taking over their jobs). We asked the first reception worker for a quiet room away from the elevators and ice machine. We go to our room, and it is directly across from the elevators. We go downstairs and ask another clerk for the same. We go to our room, and it is directly across from the ice machine. Then they lied to us and tell us that all rooms are near the elevators the way the building is configured. We go to the third room they give us and it is away from the elevators finally! There are many floors to this hotel, and it take a long time to get an elevator. When we woke up in the morning, I wanted to make coffee with the room coffee machine, only to find out they give us only decaf. I called the front desk for the coffee, and then had to wait 45 minutes, No coffee, I asked the cleaning people on the floor, they hardly spoke English and said they were out of regular coffee. I called the front desk again, and they started complaining to me that it was housekeepings' responsibility. I had to go down to the front desk, wait on a long line, and finally get some. I would have thought at a Hilton, the service would have been better. Frankly, the people were idiots, and I wasted a lot of time on getting my quiet room and coffee. That said, the rooms were clean and a decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Okay except for staff”
Reviews.Author: lo2e
Reviews.Content: As a former reviewer pointed out, the hotel is great but the staff has a LOT to be desired. I booked my room at the Hilton on Priceline for $65 (~$80 with taxes/fees). The hotel is not what I would call easy to get to driving wise, but certainly very easy to get to with public transportation by getting off at the Prudential stop (as a footnote, if you are flying into logan or taking the train into Boston, I do NOT recommend taking the subway directly to the hotel if you have big luggage... the green line of the T is VERY hard to accomodate luggage on as the cars are pretty small... I would suggest a cab). A LOT of things are within walking distance of this hotel, including Fenway Park, Newbury Street (a lot of high-end stores and nice cafes and restaurants), Copley Square, the Prudential Center, Berklee College of Music, and others. And obviously once you're there, you can take the T to just about anything in Boston. Now, on to the staff... I was traveling with my wife and a friend of ours, so when I went to check in, I requested a room with two double beds (knowing that Priceline only guarantees double occupancy, but it doesn't hurt to ask). I was told by Brendan (the man checking us in) that there were no two-double rooms available, but they could put a rollaway bed in our king room for $20 for the night. We agreed, and away to our room we went. After checking in, we walked around Boston a bit to see the sights and came back several hours later. We get back to our room, and still no rollaway bed there. So, I call the front desk to see where it is, turns out they are sold out of them, but there is a two-double room available that we can go right into! Now, obviously someone needs to get their act together and know what is and isn't available, because obviously Brendan didn't have a clue. Overall a great stay and would be pleased to stay here again. Oh, and by the way, if you are a guest at the hotel, parking is $35 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good business trip w/ Hilton Back Back”
Reviews.Author: william146
Reviews.Content: My company sent me and a colleague up to Boston earlier this month for a convention. They left the booking up to me, and although the convention was at the BCEC (down near the waterfront - not close to the Back Bay), the Hilton Back Bay had decent prices for the weekend and I knew it was close to good restaurants and whatnot. We arrived very late due to flight delays, but were happy with our room. 5th floor (no view unfortunately), but two double beds which were VERY comfortable (especially the pillows). Room was a decent size. We liked the location since it seemed to be right in the middle of a nice area. The doorman was very helpful the next morning -- we were only about 2 1/2 blocks from the subway station (which we were going to take to the convention -- we bought a weekly pass for the T for $15 each). We stopped at Dunkin' Donuts on the corner by the hotel for breakfast and hopped on the T. Only about 25 minute subway ride (a few switches) to the BCEC. After a tiring day at the convention, we knew we wanted to go out and have a good time that evening. We were already planning on going to a Red Sox game on Friday night, but figured we'd try getting tickets for the Thursday game too. Fenway is an easy 5-10 minute walk from the Hilton -- very convenient! Had a blast at the game both nights, and it was nice to be so close to the hotel afterwards. Our room was very clean (except for Saturday -- housekeeping didn't make it up until about 3:30 in the afternoon, when we were back in the room napping), comfortable, and every staff member was very courteous and good with directions to places (Summer Shack is right up the road if you need a quick seafood fix). Unfortunately, we didn't venture into the Prudential Center area at all, but did take the T down to Fanuel Hall/Quincy Marketplace, which was a straight shot 15 minute ride. The free computers w/ internet in the lobby was a nice touch too - I was able to check my email and print my plane tickets for the ride home in advance. We had to hail a cab to and from the airport b/c we arrived after the T stopped running and left before it started running, but if you arrive during normal running hours (5:45am - 1:45am or so), this wouldn't be a bad option, especially since the cab ride will cost you at least $20 (and like I said, a weekly pass on the T is $15 a person, so this could be a better option depending on how many are in your party). The hotel staff was very friendly even at 4am - getting a cab was no problem (they had a few waiting). Overall, I'd recommend Hilton Back Bay to anyone taking a trip to Boston -- it's in a nice area, w/in walking distance to lots of restaurants, shops, and attractions, and is fairly close to a subway station to navigate around downtown on. Of course it helped that I wasn't paying the $1,000 or so for the 4 nights we stayed, but it was worth it anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great. Am I getting too fussy?”
Reviews.Author: FromIreland
Reviews.Content: I travel on business a lot, and I usually try to stay at the Hilton because they're good. This time, I'm on a vacation with my wife and two teenage kids. We got a room with two double, plus a roll-away bed (extra $20 per night, which is pretty excessive!). We ordered an extra large room, but to be honest, we didn't notice. We were on the HHonours floor, right over the main entrance. So first the good. The location is fantastic. A quick walk across to the Prudenial centre, and close to public transport. The room was clean, with a small balcony (maybe 1x1 meters). There's two free to use computers in the lobby with internet capabilities and printer. Staff were helpful. The bar was nice too, but I didn't eat there. The pool was small, but OK. The Jacuzzi was good and hot. There's no real bad, just a list of small niggles that add up. For example, when we entered the room initially, we were literally overpowered by the smell of chemical cleaner - maybe a carpet cleaner? While the room was clean, it was old and showed in places. Being above the front entrance was a real pain, cos the porter kept whistling for cabs all the time. A shrill high-pitched whistle, which woke us up at 7am one morning. I think the $20 rollaway charge is steep, and I don't think it's worth paying any extra (like me) for an extra size room - I certainly didn't notice any difference. Would I go there again? Actually, probably not. In my opinion, it's just not up to the standard of other Hiltons!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - NOT recommended”
Reviews.Author: tabald
Reviews.Content: It's a shame how a great chain of hotels can make such a great mistake in hiring employees and managers. The Hilton Back Bay is, by far, the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. We were not able to obtain a fridge so we basically had to dine out 24/7. The nearest laundrymat is a few "BLOCKS" away and they pretended to not have a clue where it is when asked. We gave in and had to "dry clean" some underwear and a swim suit, we never saw the swim suit again and we were acused of not filling out the itemized content list. They basically didn't believe we sent the swim suit to get cleaned. They knocked on the door at 7:00am the morning of checkout and yelled out "CHECKOUT" since it seems they didn't believe the copy of the checkout bill being slid under the door was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: DJCandyJ
Reviews.Content: Beautiful View, and very clean. Couple minutes from the mall, tours and Downtown boston. Everything you need is in the area. I will book them again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business travellers to Boston”
Reviews.Author: The Black Adder
Reviews.Content: Overall I am a management consultant and stay in plenty of good hotels all over the world, a Diamond Hilton HHonors member and I have stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for ~25 nights since March; I find it to be a good-quality hotel for visitors and business travelers to Boston, and would recommend it highly. I will continue to stay there for the next few weeks while I visit Boston. Location The hotel is located on a quite side street, right next to a Sheraton Hotel and the Church of Christ, Scientist (which I have never visited but it looks like an elegant building). It is ~3 minutes walk away from many shops & restaurants at the Prudential Center (PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory) and ~5-10 minutes walk away from tons of good places on Boylston Street and the parallel street, the tony Newbury Street. It takes less than 10 minutes to get to the Boston Common in a cab, which are easily available outside the Sheraton. Room I always stay in the same room on the 26th floor, which has huge curved windows all the way around one side of the room with a fantastic view of the West side of Boston from Fenway Park to the Prudential Center. Room furnishings are good and I love the huge wide-screen HDTV, and the coffee maker stocked with Lavazza coffee. The bathroom has a great shower with 2 large showerheads so you get deluged with water from both sides. Service I find the staff to be pleasant and professional, and now that they recognize me, the service is even better. My only nit is that they can't seem to get my request for a Wall Street Journal newspaper delivery quite right on a consistent basis. Food I always have my breakfast at the Boodles restaurant in the lobby and they have a well stocked breakfast buffet. I have tried room service on a few occasions and the meal (clam chowder, Caeser salad) was fine and delivered promptly Gym There is a well supplied gym on the 7th floor with 3-4 treadmills, 3-4 elliptical steppers and other bikes, steppers etc. There are some free weights and various resistance machines. There is a small indoor pool and Jacuzzi as well. Gym is open 24 hours and the pool closes ~10 PM. BTW There are plenty of other good hotels in the area to choose from including, Sheraton, Westin Copley Place, Marriott Copley Place, Four Seasons, Taj, Fairmont Copley Square, and Jurys.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton: Great quality and location”
Reviews.Author: ksmovu03
Reviews.Content: This Hilton was in a great location - the next street over had shopping, food, bars. But the hotel itself was very quiet, as we had a room on the 18th floor with an awesome view. Our rate was only $70/night due to being purchased on Pricelin. We didn't have a rental car since parking is so expensive, but the day pass on the T worked great. You can definitely get wherever you need to go anywhere in Boston without walking too far due to the many T stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArtiesBear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed Thursday through Sunday of last week. Our room was clean, comfortable, and had a small balcony with a good view of the city and a peek view of the Charles. The hotel was quiet, with street noise audible only when we had the balcony door open. There is complimentary coffee and bottled water replenished daily, a mini bar, iron/board, hair dryer, Crabtree & Evelyn amenities, clock/radio with MP3, lighted closet, ice machines on each floor, and a small store in lobby behind front desk for incidental items. The hotel is in an excellent location -- within walking distance to much of what Boston has to offer. We used no public transportation during our stay (except to and from the airport), but had easy access to the T, and readily available taxis if we desired. Tour Trolley stops and Duck Tour boarding areas are nearby. One late morning, we walked from the hotel to the beginning of the Freedom Trail and completed the Freedom Trail, taking time to stop at various places -- shopping at Quincy Market, lunch at Durgin Park, touring Paul Revere's house and the USS Constitution, and walked back to the hotel by mid-evening. This may be too much walking for some, but if you find yourself exhausted, public transportation is readily available, be it the T, a taxi, or a bus to get you back to the hotel. We had a late dinner at Boodles (the hotel restaurant) the evening we arrived. The service was efficient and courteous, and the food was surprisingly tasty. We also had breakfast at Boodles the morning we departed. The buffet offered a good variety, and a breakfast menu was also available. The hotel fitness center has recently been remodeled and offers a good number of cardio machines, universal equipment, free weights, complimentary cold bottled water, locker rooms, a pool and spa. Note: my husband stayed on the following week for business and moved to the Sheraton across the street. His comment was that he much preferred the Hilton Back Bay -- larger room, better amenities. Being from Phoenix, we've had little subway experience and were somewhat hesitant to take the T. However, after riding in a taxi to drop me at the airport for departure, my husband experimented with the T and found that it is an easy T ride between the airport and the Back Bay area. We plan to use the T in lieu of a $40+ taxi ride to/from the airport during future visits to Boston. We had originally planned to stay at the Hilton Financial District, but after touring Boston, I am glad we chose the Back Bay. Currently, the Financial District is not as attractive. They are readying an area for a greenbelt/park of sorts resulting from the Big Dig. But, at this time, it is appears to be more of a vacant lot. In addition, I felt the Back Bay was a lot more walkable and visitor friendly than the Financial District. If you are going for leisure, stay in the Back Bay. You'll find it more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant 4-day stay”
Reviews.Author: swissvalian
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for a convention. The room was nicer than I expected for a room at a conference rate - king bed, sofa, side chair, desk/chair and enough lighting to keep the room bright if desired. Also had a minibar although I didn't touch it, and on top of that was a coffee maker, ice bucket and glasses and two half-pint bottles of Poland Spring water which were replenished daily. Small padded bench at the foot of the bed which faced the TV. Coffee guzzlers will want to hit up the front desk for additional coffee, as the packets provided make but a single cup each, and they leave you 2 regular and 2 decaf packets in the room. Some little niceties: the alarm clock had a wire for plugging into an MP3 player's headphone jack if desired, a soap dish on the sink, magnifying mirror in the bathroom (adjustable), a light in the large closet which came on automatically when the door was opened, complimentary fresh fruit (apples/oranges) at the front desk, USA Today delivered to the door early each morning (it was there by 6 AM every day), two foil-wrapped Astor-brand chocolates on the bed each day. I only ate once in the restaurant (breakfast for $17 + tip) and the buffet had plenty of options - pastries, bagels, oatmeal, bread, fruit, and the ubiquitous eggs/bacon/sausage/potatoes/pancake options. You could also order from a menu if you didn't want the buffet. I didn't need anything special but based on my smooth check-in experience and having my bags checked on the last day until I needed to get to the airport, I expect they would have handled things well. Free wireless in the large and comfortable lobby but $9.95 a day in the room. There was also a concierge desk in the lobby. While I didn't use it myself, the fitness center was very large and nice. It had just recently been renovated. Directly across the street was the Sheraton, which was connected internally to both the Hynes Convention Center and Prudential Center, so in bad weather you could get to the Prudential Center restaurants without having to be out in the elements other than having to cross the street to the Sheraton's entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: LezahSwayHampshire
Reviews.Content: Without exception the staff were friendly and helpful. We had a four night stay. Good location, great shopping close by, and good restaurants. Our only complaint was the size of the beds in the room which are smaller than a British standard double bed (probably four feet wide.) We were on the 23rd floor with a good view. No problem at all with the lifts when we were there.The buffet breakfast was good with an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Nikon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located in the Back Bay Area of Boston. It's very close to the Prudental Center with shops, restaurants and the magnificent view from the top of the Prudential Tower. Nearby is also Boylston Street and Newbury Street with more shopping and restaurants. The area felt very safe and friendly. Boston is compact so we walked into the city center and the New England Aquarium, it took about 30 minutes. The Hotel may need some remodeling in the next years but the room was comfortable and we also enjoyed the very good breakfast buffet. ThereÂ´s also a small but nice pool and a jacuzzi. Overall I would say this is a good hotel in a very friendly area an I would probably stay here again when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lift”
Reviews.Author: traveler from Hinsdale
Reviews.Content: The HIlton Back Bay has elevator problems. Not just broken elevators and there were two of those during our stay that significantly lenghthened lobby wait times, but noisy elevators. Our room was located behind the elevator bank and across the hall from the elevator and at night and in the morning we could hear the elevators going up and down. This is a real impediment a to good night's sleep. There isn't much soundproofing between rooms either, as it sounded as if our neighbor was showering in our room. On the plus side, the rooms are pleasantly decorated and the hotel is conveniently located to the Prudential Center mall. Although there is no concierge, the Front Desk did make us a restaurant reservation and the bell staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but only because of corporate reimbursement”
Reviews.Author: Kahleefonia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference, for which the rates were knocked down to $160 a night. Reasons for the selection: the proximity and distance (Sheraton was a bit close for comfort-- the event spanned the Hynes center and parts of the Sheraton) for a first-timer in Boston. Since I'm more of a Best Western fan, the amenities were all right, but nothing really better. Sure, the polished marble, fancy chairs, and internet access were nice (glad that the company was paying for the internet access as it wasn't free). There was an issue with the toilet not flushing properly and the fact that the maid who serviced the rooms cleaned out the trashcans by dumping the contents and wiping the inner surface before rearranging the linens (no she didn't not wash her hands between handling the trash and freshening up the beds). If I were to return to the area I'd certainly opt for another hotel after paying close attention to recommendations on TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “convenient, friendly, and spotless”
Reviews.Author: vhamer
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at the Hilton Back Bay. Nabbed a $90 room via Hotwire...well under the listed price. The room was ample and spotless, with many conveniences. Great bed & linens. Had a nice view from the private balcony. Large bathroom. Chocolates on the bed. Very helpful staff. The hotel is in Back Bay, so the area is pretty commercial / financial (Prudential Center, Newbury St, etc). But the Prudential T stop was really convenient (2 blocks?), and Boston Common was within walking distance. The Hilton ensured that our weekend trip was oh-so-lovely. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Central modern Hilton Boston Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: The Hilton made for good central location for a weekend hop to Boston. Our delux King corner room on the 26th flloor had a comfortable/heavenly bed, 37 inch hdtv, small sofa and balcony, internet access for a fee, and great views. Free internet and apples are available in the lobby. The room was spacious, very quiet, clean, and modern, hotel corridors were well lit, and staff was very accomodating. Unlike the adjacent Sheraton, Marriott, and Westin, the Hilton is not connected to the Prudential Center mall so if you want to shop until you drop you have to exit the hotel, cross the street, and enter the Sheraton for an access walkway-no big deal. The plus for all of this is that the Hitlon is tranquil and not frenetic like the Sheraton and other connected hotels-the downside for some is that you don't have ready shopping access or easier access to the facilities of the other hotels. However, you do have a nice rooftop $2 mil fitness center with a nice 25 foot heated indoor pool and jacuzzi. Boston Public library with its current excellent John Adams Unbound exhibit is 3 blocks distant, the North End is walkable, and there are plenty of cafes on nearby Newbury Street, or just off it, like the Island Hopper for a well-prepared inexpensive Mayalysian /Thai lunch or dinner and Giacomo's (make a dinner reservation-small, tables are close, atmosphere is noisy, but the food is mouth watering-swordfish in a peppper sauce, ravioli stuffed with shrimp in a wonderful cheese sauce, and good wines at reasonable prices, including that of the dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in the back bay area”
Reviews.Author: DrLogical
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for a while but still comfortable and the location is excellent. missing some things like a VIP lounge but the restaurant is very good. Good views from the windows all around. right in the heart of the back bay area. close walk to mall, train, and Mass avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jamtart18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for New Years for one week and had a great time. Husband is a Hilton Honors gold member so we were upgraded to one of the hexagonal rooms on the 22nd floor and got breakfast vouchers for our entire stay. The room was fabulous with floor to ceiling windows offering amazing views of Boston. We found all the hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly (in fact, we found practically EVERYONE in Boston to be helpful and friendly!!). We ate breakfast every day at the hotel and whilst it is of a very high standard I was getting fed up of it by the end of the week - there's too much much choice :-) We only ate in the hotel once in the evening (New Years Eve). It was a special meal they had laid on and was fabulous. The hotel location is great for Newbury Street, Prudential centre and all the shopping, and the trolley tour bus stops outside the hotel. Also withing walking distanc eof Fenway park. I would defintely stay here again if I ever went back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: linkakk
Reviews.Content: Great Back Bay location, close to shops and restaurants. Great Bed - extremely comfortable. Large room - stayed in a corner deluxe. View was non-existent on the 9th floor other than the Citgo sign. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: queendomcome
Reviews.Content: I generally do not like to stay at chain hotels, so my fingers were crossed tightly till check out time. I stayed here for a weekend with friends. It was pricey but split between three people it turned out to be quite reasonable. Wacky location, but if you know your way around the Back Bay area (and it won't take long) you'll be fine. Shopping directly across the street in the Prudential Center was quite convenient. Beds were comfortable, but small. They call it a double I call it an oversized twin. Room was clean and cozy. Beatuiful bedding and a really nice bed side radio. Concierge was helpful. Hotel held our bags at check out so we can grab brunch before catching our train back to NY. Not bad stay; I was nicely surprised. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kmc1974
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times and always enjoy it. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member we are always upgraded to a beautiful room and get free breakfast, which is excellent. The rooms I have stayed in have amazing views of the city with panoramic windows. It is in a great location and easy to find if you're not that familiar with the city. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: MultiCulti
Reviews.Content: I would normally only stay at this type of large hotel if it was a business trip. But I didn't plan far enough in advance, it was Columbus Day weekend and most hotels in the Copley area had already sold out. The room on the 20th floor was very spacious with a sweeping view of the city and no street noise. Every amenity that one might expect at $200/night was available. The bed was extremely comfortable with down bedding and turn-down service. Bathroom was clean and there was plenty of hot water and pressure. Front desk staff and doormen were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: shoredude1971
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with very courteous staff. The reservations agent who originally took my reservation, the valet, the doorman, the desk clerk were all polite and efficient. The only staff problem was the concierge. There was never anyone at the concierge desk the entire weekend. My room was on the 18th floor and I was assigned a handicapped accessible room (which I didn't require but as they were sold out it was the only king bedded room available). It was a very large room with 3 windows. The bathroom counter was huge. I've never been a fan of the handicap tub, so my review of it would be biased. Everything in the room was definitely new. The room was definitely sound proof. When I opened the windows, the noise below was quite loud. The hotel is in a very nice neighborhood near a college. The Prudential Center, a high-end shopping center was just down the block, where you can catch the green line of "T" or the subway. Boylston Street had many nice shops and was a block away. There were a few fast food restaurants a block down on Massachusetts Avenue. Copley Square was a few blocks down and I could see Fenway Park from my room, but I never had time to make it there. There was so much to do nearby. Several tours leave from the hotel. Even for Boston, I thought they were quite expensive. As a matter of fact, a lot of the area is expensive, but so are most of the cities along the Northeast. If in Boston again, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Some Problems at the Hilton Boston Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Although we had a pleasant stay at the Hilton (except for 1 MAJOR problem), I felt that I needed to write this review to inform others who might consider staying at this hotel. The lobby was pleasant enough -- a bit on the small side compared to other Hiltons that I have stayed at before. Check-in proceeded quite quickly. The reception staff were excellent and efficient. The room was pretty, but rather small. However, I was surprised that they wanted to charge a fee for internet access. At 2:30 AM, we were awakened by a very loud alarm, eminating from the room radio. A fire alarm had gone off and we were instructed to proceed to the stairwells to begin our descent. This was OK, except we were staying on the 26th floor. The other guests (quite elderly) and I (mid-50's) started the trek down. After 15 floors, we noticed that very few other guests were in the stairwell, nor was the alarm ringing on the 11th floor, where we had all stopped to rest. Attempts to reach the lobby staff were unsuccessful -- the phone kept ringing repeatedly with no pickup. I sent my stepdaughter (23) to proceed down the stairwell to check out what the problem was. She phoned me back 15 minutes later that the alarm had been a false one. I then called the lobby staff to see when the elevators would be operational again. They assured me within 5 minutes. After waiting for 20 minutes with still no elevator service, I then started my ascent up 15 stories. By the time I had reached my room, it was 4 AM. We learned from the front desk the next morning that someone had smoked in a non-smoking room on our floor and set off the alarm. I felt like this hotel had no formalized procedures in place for handing the possibility of a fire. Somehow, I wondered why they didn't have a PA system in the firewell, that could have told us that this was a false alarm, before we had trekked down so many flights of stairs. I was irritated by the front desk, lying to me, telling me that the elevators would be operational within 5 minutes. It isn't the hotel's fault that some yahoo was smoking at 2:30 AM, but the communication was lost between them & their guests. When I flew back to TX the next day, I heard from the passengers in the seat beside mine, that they had also stayed at the same Hilton. They said they had seen the fire trucks arrive and leave our hotel within 15 minutes. And their alarm never sounded on the 3rd floor, where they were staying. I think the hotel definitely needs to address this problem and revisit their contingency plan.

Reviews.Title: “overall okay”
Reviews.Author: Moses-CJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days during college parents day. Hotels were full and we were booked at $285.00 rate which is way steep for this hotel. My biggest concern on booking was staying somewhere central, and assuring a courtesy shuttle as I had 3 extra large suitcases in tow. Our first encounter was there was no courtesy shuttle. When I didn't see their name on the airport shuttle phones, I called the hotel and was told to just get a cab. I was a bit miffed. Aside from the pictures of a high rise, and comparable to adjacent hotels, this is a small property. On check in I informed them on the mis-comm on the shuttle to no avail, no apology. I wasn't sure the clerk even understood me. The porters stood and watched us get our luggage on a cart and get it to the room - I think we were just tired from a long day of travel, and i was expecting the big city service. The room was comfortable. The bathroom very, very small. After dinner we headed out looking at other hotels to move as we felt the price was too high for what we had received so far. When I returned i looked on the Travelocity site and the rates had dropped to $219, so I requested our rate be dropped also. The clerk was courteous and did so and we stayed. Overall experience was not unpleasant, but not great. The gym is newly remodeled and machines were good. I was surprised there was no sauna. The Sheraton across the street appeared much nicer and their rates were comparable. We walked through there to get to the very upscale mall, which opens into the Sheraton. In looking at all the hotels i was searching on the sites pre-trip, they are all within a few blocks of each other and all a couple of blocks from the "T" so any of them would have satisfied the 'central' goal. The same goes for the downtown/theatre district sites. We were out at the college campus, the north end for dinners, and also shopped and hit the museums so we walked a lot and took the "T" quite often. In retrospect, Boston is pretty walkable and the "T" made it very easy to get around. We could have stayed most anywhere in these areas - it's all very central. The Hilton is by far not an exceptional hotel. It was nice and clean, and the bedding soft and very nice which is to be expected, not applauded.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: emilyincolumbus
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel after having a less than stellar experience at another Hilton. I checked in late and the woman at the front desk was very friendly, got me checked in quickly and gave me toothpaste free of charge (darn FAA restrictions!). The room (on the 24th Hilton HHonors floor, despite my not being a member) was spacious, spotless, and had a great view. The bathroom was large and included a bathrobe and free bottled water. I had no complaints whatsoever. When I checked out (at 4am!) the young man at the front desk was polite and courteous, and made sure I got a cab to the airport. The staff was always friendly and even directed me to a computer where I could check my email free of charge. I ate in the hotel restaurant once for breakfast, and while it was a little overpriced (to be expected) the service was quick and the portions were a decent size. I also ordered from room service once and again, everyone was polite and service was reasonably fast. The food was not spectacular but was not bad. I would recommend eating on Massachusetts Avenue, as there are a number of good and cheap options there. Overall, I think this was a great experience and it raised my opinion of the Hilton brand considerably.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshleyNY
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston for a weekend getaway. The hotel was extremely clean, the staff was helpful and the hotel is in agreat location. The hotel is only a couple of short blocks from theT and a great restaurant Turner Fisheries (located in a different hotel) on Huntington Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dm1313
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night but i wish it was longer! As a hilton honors member i managed to get floor 22 which was a hilton honours floor - the view over the city was amazing! The room itself was very spacious and had loads of goodies in the bathroom :-) Hotel has a nice indoor pool and i beleive recently rennovated gym. Also has a nice sun deck! Only a stones throw away from the prudential centre and the green line T station. Very handy for staying right the centre of everything! Also would recommend eating at the top of the huib restaurant - if you go here just before sun down the views are great - they have a bar menu which is a lot cheaper than their main menu - you can get burger an pizzas etc! If you are on a budget like we were :-)

Reviews.Title: “We were satisified.”
Reviews.Author: brokenankle
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire at a rate of $119/night. When we checked in we were told that we could have a room with one king or a room with 2 double beds. As Hotwire had guaranteed me a room that would sleep 4, I opted for the 2 bed option. The room was OK, but the beds were tiny!!! The hotel was more than happy to offer me a rollaway for $20/night!! I eventually received the rollaway at no charge. Unfortunately, my son had to sleep on the floor. Each bed held one adult, the rollaway 1 child and the other child had to sleep on the floor. If there are more than 2 in your party, I would not recommend this establishment. The indoor pool was OK but very small and there was not enough poolside seating. The rooms were very quiet and the beds comfortable. I would consider returning at a discount rate. There is no way that I would pay rack rate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hbyerly
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Back Bay is in a great location, close to Newbury St with great restaurants and shopping. There is a small gourmet market (Delucas) just a few blocks away. The hotel is very close to the OLD convention center, but don't confuse it with the NEW convention center, which is not at all close. The hotel itself has a small lobby, with a small on-site restaurant and no gift shop or executive/concierge floor. They do have a small rack of convenience-store type stuff behind the front desk for sale. As a Hilton Gold, I received an upgraded room (w couch) and free water each day. My room (417) was great, wonderful furnishings and bed, couch, and small, strangely shaped balcony. This room faced the Sheraton, and the street between is where many of the large tour buses idle during the day, so I would ask for a room a few floors higher if you plan to be in the room during the day. This wasn't an issue in the evening. I found all of the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly, from the front-desk to housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Back Bay Location!”
Reviews.Author: hpliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay on a recent Saturday night. We were in town to attend a Red Sox game, and as a previous reviewer said, the proximity to Fenway is great. It is only about a mile walk to the park. Equally close was the Pru Center with all its shops and restaurants AND Duck Boat tours! Our room was located on the 16th floor. Other than cranky elevators (one of which was not working), we had no complaints. The room was squeaky-clean, the bed comfortable and the location quiet. I would NOT want to be on the 7th floor -- on the way from the elevator to the pool/gym -- that corridor was highly trafficked. Having also stayed at the Sheraton across the street, we prefer the Hilton -- both the room and service were better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BillDen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night of a Red Sox game. It is absolutely the best place if you are going to a game. Definitely within walking distance of Fenway. The hotel lobby was nice and service was very friendly. The rooms were average. Nothing fancy and the beds weren't the best that I have had at a Hilton. However, we had everything we needed and had no complaints other than the high priced parking. However, that's just the price you pay for staying in this area. The best thing overall about this hotel is the location. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, loved Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Boston last September and stayed at the Hilton. Loved the hotel, room was spacious and very clean. The buffet breakfast is great - only complaint was we were there 2 days before the waitress took the time to tell us about the buffet and we had been ordering breakfast from the more expensive menu until then. Buffet was great value. The hotel location is super, 5 minutes to Newbury street on foot and about 3 minutes to the Prudential centre where u can hop on the train to downtown Boston and be there in about 10 minutes. For shoppers heading to Boston I'd recommend Filenes and to be there at 9am before it gets busy, early morning shopping there is an enjoyable experience. A trip to Wrentham Village for the outlet shopping experience is also a must, super bargains! If you have time a trip to Cape Cod is a great day out also especially when the weather is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the reception staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, large room but extremely unhelpful reception staff. Unable to help us find a doctor. No 24 hour room service, so no breakfast available before an early flight. Unwilling to bring cases down. Worst Hilton we have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Back Bay and Boston”
Reviews.Author: val t
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Back Bay. The hotel was very comfortable and I would certainly recommend it. Ask for a room on the higher floors as there is a fantastic view of the city. I emailed Hilton before we left and they obliged. Harvard is well worth a visit as is Newbury St and Beacon Hill. As we went in December I don't think we saw Boston at it's best. Taxi's are very expensive but the subway is cheap, clean, safe and trains run very frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JorvikWarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for a week in early September and glad we did. The hotel has a good location in the Back Bay area close to Copley Square and with easy access to the rest of this compact city. The hotel rooms were generous in size, well equipped and immaculately clean. There is a great gym/pool/sundeack area which is little used but very good. The restaurant is pricy and although the food is good, there are better and cheaper alternatives right on the doorstep with many good retaurants and cafe bars close by. Have breakfast in the nearby shopping mall which has several fast food/breakfast options. Would highly recommend and certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: NaplesVisitor
Reviews.Content: In my mind, Hiltons are normally pretty safe bets. Nothing terribly exciting and nothing normally too bad. This Hilton exceeded my expecations by a mile. First, the location is terrific if you want to be close to the Back Bay train station, Newbury Street, the Pru Center, good restaurants, shopping, and places to walk around. The rooms must have been renovated recently because my room was spotless and all of the furniture was new, the bathroom fixtures were new and the countertops were granite. The bed and the linens stack up with any Ritz I have stayed in. What pleased me the most was the service I received the next morning from room service. It arrived exactly on time and the server was friendly and refused my additional gratuity because she said it was already included. Five minutes after she left, she returned because she said that the coffee I ordered was not fresh enough and so she brought me a new pot. And, still she refused the gratuity I tried to give her. I don't normally stay at the Hilton in Boston, but in the future I will. Very nice place for business or pleasure. I did not see the gym, but I heard it was new.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JanBury_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. We had a room on the 22nd floor which gave us brilliant views of Boston. Our room was very comfy and clean and our only complaint was the cost of the car park - 30 dollars a night!! We ate breakfast every day in a lovely garden, with a fountain, which we reached through the Sheraton hotel opposite. It was a peaceful start to each day. A great location made it possible to walk to all the main attractions easily.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_Engineer
Reviews.Content: I am a frequest business traveller and have accrued many points as a Hilton Rewards member. I used some of those points to book a room here for 5 days. I was very impressed with the attitude and helpfulness of the staff on the front door and desk. They were fast and friendly. Our bellman gave us information about the local area while he brought our bags to the room. Then he helped to find my cell phone that was lost inside the rental car. The pool and exercise area is clean and bright with new equpment. There is only one restaurant but with the Prudential Center next door and the selection of restaurants in the area, that was not a difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: tomuller
Reviews.Content: good location, price, large room

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel had no AC. It was in the 80's on Saturday. Front desk staff informed us to open our windows that the hotel had no AC. Also bed linens were stained and the toilet ran all night. Front desk staff very unhelpful. This hotel does not represent the Hilton chain very well. The Sheraton across the street is a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: tfinchler
Reviews.Content: Spent Memorial Day weekend at the Hilton Back Back with my wife and two young children. Rate was $154/night, which included two buffet breakfasts per night at Boodles. Hotel is in a great location - close to T, major attractions, shopping and major highways. Hotel is clean and modern. Room was of decent size. Two double beds - both real comfortable. Bathroom looks like it was upgraded recently. Climate control worked well. They have a pool - once was empty and another time (at night) was hopping with kids. Service was unfailingly polite. Vern and Jeff at the door were very pleasant and helpful. Buffet at Boodles was fine - $15/pp (1/2 price for kids - although they let my 3 year-old eat for free). It included french toast, pancakes, bacon/sausages, pastries, coffee/juice and a wet glop of scrambled eggs. If you eat light, you can find McDonalds and Starbucks one-half block away. Considering that you're a 5 minute walk to the T and then only 10-15 mins of a T ride to just about all major attractions (NE Aquarium, Quincy Market, Public Gardens, Boston Common, North End), you cannot beat the price for the convenience. If you compare price with other Back Bay hotels, you'll find that the Hilton offers a great deal.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Boston Back Bay
HotelInfo.Address: 40 Dalton Street, Boston, MA 02115-3123
